Appointments for 
Preaching
by W Woodruff

Sunday


x Sunday July 26th 1835 At [[Johnathan Lowery|Johnathan
Lowery's]] On [[Big Sandy River, Henry County, Tennessee|Sandy]] [[Humphreys County, Tennessee|Humphreys County]]
x Tenn at 12-oclock / Isah 8:20

Tuesday


Tuesday 28th at Brother's [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] on
x [[Cypress Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Cyprus]] Creek / Zenos parable of Vineyard

Thursday


x Thursday 30 at [[Lewis Barker|L Barkers]] / 2 Timothy 2:15

[FIGURES]

Friday


1 Jan 1st 1836 Friday spent at Brother [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]]

Saturday


2 Wrote a Letter to Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|W Parrish]]
containing 200 lines in answer to one from
him that was Dated Nov 29th 1835 and
I received it on the 1st of Jan 1836

Sunday


3 Sunday Preached at Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumleys]] [Chumbley] returned to
Brother [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] to study Grammer
spent the week in studying, at Br Taylors

Sunday


10 Sunday visited the Saints at Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumleys]]
& returned to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]].
Spent the week studying at Br Taylors

Saturday


16 Saturday Rode to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland]] 10 miles

Sunday


17 Preached at the [[Sulphur Wells Academy, Henry County, Tennessee|Academy]] after [[Parson Pott|Parson Potts]]
on Sunday returned to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland]] 4 miles

Monday


18th Rode to Mr [[William Ross|Rues]] [Ross] Preached at his house
at 12 o'clock then rode to [[George Washington Brandon|George W Brandon]]
Preached at his house at night procured
1 subscrber for M[essenger &] Ad[vocate] distance 16 miles

Tuesday


19 Rode to & crossed the Mouth of [[Big Sandy River, Henry County, Tennessee|Sandy]] at
Authurs ferry from thence to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] 24/mile

Wednesday


20 Rode to Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumblys]] 1 mile

Thursday


21 Rode to [[James Hendricks|James Hendricks]] from thence to Br
[[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapps]] [[Terrapin, Calloway County, Kentucky|Taropen]] distance 30 miles

Friday


22 Rode to Father [[Joseph Greenwood|Greenwoods]] Prea^c^hed at
his house the[n] rode to Br [[John Camp|Camps]] 7 miles

Saturday


23 Preached at Br [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapps]] & blessed 10
children in the name of Jessus Christ
then rode to [[Clarks River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Clarks River]] distance 12 m
& collected $7.00 for the [[Kirtland Temple, Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|house]] of God at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]]


24

Sunday


Jan 24 [sideways text in margin] preached at night [end of sideways text]
Preached at Br [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Thomase's]] Sunday & blessed
6 Children after i closed meeting
a Baptist Prist [[William Willson|William Willson]] arose &
and invited us to attend a meeting of theirs
& cleer ourselfs of things they had
accused us of. I answered him before
the people & remarked that I was
surprised that they should take the
liberties of the Country into their own
own hands to try American
citisons by [blank]

Monday


25 Rode to [[James Martin|James Martins]] preach
at his house allso at night 12 miles

Tuesday


26 Returned to Brother [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Thomases]]
preached at his his house. 12 mil

Wednesday


27 Rode to [[Stephen Brady|Stephen Braidy's]] [Brady] 24 m

Thursday


28 Preached at [[Stephen Brady|Stephen Braidy's]] then
Rode to Mr [[John Freeman|Freeman's]] distance 14

Friday


29 Preached at [[John Rowlett|John Rowlett's]] blessed
2 3 children then rode to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylor's]] 5 m

Saturday


30 Rode to Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumbley's]] & to Br
[[Samuel Smith|Smith's]] Preached at his house returned
to Chumbleys distance 3 miles

Sunday


31 Sunday Preached at Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]]

Monday


Feb 1st Rode to Br [[Brother Davis, Tennessee|Davis'es]] 10 mile collected
$500 dollars for building the [[Kirtland Temple, Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|house]]
of the Lord at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]]

Tuesday


2 rode to Mr [[David Cranshaw|Cranshaws]] 14 miles 
[[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] 10 miles A Letter from [[John Whitmer|Whitmer]]

Wednesday


Feb 3rd Rode to [[David Cranshaw|D Cranshaws]] 14 miles

Thursday


4 Rode to [[John Jackson|J Jacksons]] preached at his
house distance 14 miles

Friday


5 Rode to [[Lewis Barker|L Barkers]] Preached at
his hous from thence to Mr [[Anthony M. Tittle|Tittles]]
Preached at his house distance 10.

Saturday


6 Rode to Br [[Joseph Fry|Frey's]] [Fry] distance 10 miles

Nov 3rd 1836. Treaded [traded] with
Brother [[Jacob Bump|Bump]] to the amount
of $12.89
Dec 7th Cr to Bump 2 pair ^socks^ 2/6 $0.94
28th Cr to one spool of th[r]ead 6
to one order on the store for Talering $3.00

& followed him & caught him
in the River & cut his throut
& broat him to shore passed [[Big Sandy River, unorganized U.S. Territory|big

& night to [[Parkersburg, Wood County, Virginia|parkersburg]] at the
mouth of the little penaugh [Kanawhah] River
Distance of the day [in pencil] 162 = 17562


20th Sunday Travled from parkers
burg f◊◊ri◊◊y 12 m from thence to
[[Wellsville, Columbiana County, Ohio|Welsville]] During the day & night


Capt. [[Thomas Clark|^thomas^ Clark]] was in [[Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia|wheeling]] Virginia 187 miles


21st In the morning had a happy
interviewed with priest [[Jesse Turpin|Turpin]] in
wellsville visted the Town & spent
the day at Brother or Elder [[Samuel Burwell|Samuel
Burwells]] in Wellsville

[upside-down text]
Sunday 13th Nov preached at Col
[[Joseph W. Rowlett|Rowletts]] got one Subscribr for ^M & Ad^
14th Rode to [[Owenton, Owen County, Kentucky|Owington]] preached at
the court house Spent the night
at [[William Brown|Wm Browns]] Distance 6 m


15th Travled to Esq [[Mr. Hue|Hues]] 5 miles
South of the [[Big Bone Lick, Boone County, Kentucky|big bone lick]] 25 miles


16th visited the big bone lick &
travled through [[Florence, Boone County, Kentucky|Florence]] & spent
the night at Mr [[Mr. Sandford|Sandfords]] 25


17th went to [[Covington, Miami County, Ohio|coveington]] crossed
the ferry into [[Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio|Cincinnati]] visited
the City. Saw Conway & webst[er]
they told me Brother [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1814|Asahel]]
had located himself in [[Terre Haute, Vigo County, Indiana|terre
haute]] ^indiana^ in company with [[Robert A. Smith|Robert
Smith]]. I ways on the wharf when
the Flora was towed in with
one dead & 11 scalded by the bursting
of the pipes I saw them taken out
Spent the night at cincinnati
on board the ^Robert^ Emmet


18th Left Cincinnati on board the
Robert Emmet passed the little
Miami River travled to [[Portsmouth, Scioto County, Ohio|portsmouth]]
^distance 118 m^ 120 miles


19th in the morning there was a
large Buck came swiming down
the river three men enter a Skiff
[end of upside-down text]

$3 for M & Ad to [[John Whitmer|John Whitmer]]

Tuesday

10 in Missouri
56 in [[Arkansas Territory|Arkansas Territory]]
7 in [[Tennessee|Tennessee]]
I procured 4 subscribers for the Messenger & Ad


I travled 1808 miles while holding the office 
of a Priest divided thus from the 13th of Jan 1835
to the 28th of June of the sam year


From the 13th of Jan to the 28 of June of 1835
I traveled 18808 miles ^to preach the gospel^ which time I held the office
of a Priest divided thus 212 miles in Missouri
656 miles in Arkansas Territory with Elder [[Henry Brown|H brown]]
608 with Elder brown 48 alone
9430 miles in Tenn 760 miles with E [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrish]], 170 alone


Elder brown baptized 2 in the Arkansas in our travels
Elder Parish baptised 18 in Tenn & [[Kentucky|KY]] while I was with him
I baptized 8 while I was a priest & with brother
Parrish in Tennesse 


Assisted Elder brown ^while^ in baptizing 2 in Arkansas Ter
Assisted Elder Parrish in baptizing 18 in Tenn & KY
And ^I^ baptized 8 ^in Tenn^ myself while with E[l]der Parish
& holding the office of a priest


I held 70 meetings while officiateing in the office of a priest
10 with Elder Brown
4 alone
56 with Elder Parish


The following transactions were while i officiated
in the office of a priest


I consecrated myself & effect's on
the dec 31, 1834

Crouper
Wilford Woodruff [18]96

371
[[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1863|Asahel]] Room at
Napa Hotel

Dist[a]n[c]e 1280 Miles

Aug 13 [18]96

We took Cars at 7 oclock
for [[Portland, Multnomah County, Oregon|Portland]] Mistake all
about [ttetins] [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1863|Asahel]] was
supposed to have got the tickets
but there was nothing said
to him about it but when
we got aboard we Met with
Mr [[David Ellsworth Burley|E Burly]] who is the
superintndet of the Road
He gave us passes & both
tickets so we got along we
traveled all night direc
tly we traveled all Day in
terrible Dus[t] & all night

^[ ]^ in the Midst of []
we arrived at [[Portland Hotel, Portland, Multnomah County, Oregon|Portland]] in the
Morning I find I feel better

15
We took breakfast at the
[[Portland Hotel, Portland, Multnomah County, Oregon|Portland Hotel]] I wrote
6 [FIGURE] Letter to [[Ovando Collins Beebe|Ovando]],
[[Abraham Owen Woodruff|Owen]] [[Winnifred Blanche Woodruff Daynes|Blanche]] & [[James Jackson Woodruff|Jack]]
& told him the mistake
Mad[e] in Not preparing [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1863|Asahel]]
with tickets we spent the
day at the Portland Hotel
we went on board of
the State of California 
at 8 oc and sailed through 
the night quite smoothly

16 ^Sunday^ quite cloudy we took
breakfast at 8 c
Sea qutte smooth we
saw som whal[e]s we had
a rather smooth sea all
the way I find I can
both eat & sleep

Monday Mony 17 Sunday

quite a plesa[n]t Day many
large flying gulls follow
the steamer it became foggy
near night they blew the
Fog Horns we Met quite a Mob
at the wharf we had all we could
do to get through them we 
got to [[Palace Hotel, San Francisco, San Francisco County, California|Palace Hotel]] at 9:30

18 ^Tuesday^ We stayed Room this
Morning the price for room & 
board for [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1863|Asahel]] [[Emma Smith Woodruff|Ma]] & myself
is $13 a day $91 a week

Wednesday 19, we took carriage
in the Morning & rode to the 
& viewed Many places a forest occupied
with almost all kinds of birds & squirrels
we saw a plane Lilly, the Leaves as large
as a big wash tub there were but
very few in the America we travelled 
over much ground & saw Much

19

we had an interview with [[Lorenzo Snow|Lorenzo
Snow]] & Br [[Henry S. Tanner|Tanner]] who preside in 
[[San Francisco, San Francisco County, California|San Francisco]] we Continued to 
Attend their Meeting

18 I wrote to [[Abraham Owen Woodruff|Owen]] & [[Ovando Collins Beebe|Ovando]] & [[Clara Martisha Woodruff Beebe|Clara]]
[[Joseph Woodruff|Joseph]] & [[Winnifred Blanche Woodruff Daynes|Blanche]] [[Mary Alice Woodruff McEwan|Alice]] & [[James Jackson Woodruff|Jack]]

19. I wrote to [[Joseph Fielding Smith|J. F. Smith]] we
20 rode to the cliff & saw
the seals
19 we road to the park
& sea shore

20 we took cars & 
went to the [[Cliff House, San Francisco, San Francisco County, California|Cliff Home]]
& saw the great Number
of Sea Lions on the Ro[c]k
It was very interesting to
see their great seal that
would weigh f[ro]m 10 to 1500
[FIGURE] I recd 2 Letters f[ro]m 
[[Mary Alice Woodruff McEwan|Mary]] & [[Elias Smith Woodruff|Elias Woodruff]]

21 [FIGURE]

I wrote 3 Letters to [[Wilford Woodruff Jr.|Wilford]] – 
[[Abraham Owen Woodruff|Owen]] & [[Mary Alice Woodruff McEwan|Alice]]  & sent [[Elias Smith Woodruff|Elias]] letter
to his [[Wilford Woodruff Jr.|father]] in the Letter I wrote to
him All the Comp[an]y but myself
have gone out to day Brother
[[George Quayle Cannon|Cannon]] has gone to see if He Can learn
learn any thing from the Rail road
about the Letter sent him with
our transportation tickets which 
have [miscarried]

22 [[Emma Manella Woodruff|Ella]] call[e]d upon us in 
the Morning with her babe

Bill at [[Palace Hotel, San Francisco, San Francisco County, California|palace Hotel]] $765
$66,70 Aug 22 [18]96 for 13 days

22 Aug

We paid our Bill at the 
[[Palace Hotel, San Francisco, San Francisco County, California|Palace]] & took cars for
[[Monterey, Monterey County, California|Monterrey]] Had a vary
interesting jorny of 124
Miles A vast amount of fruit
Orchards the Most of which are 
Prunes Monterey is one of 
the Most interesting places
in America especialy the 
flower Garden We had an
interview with Col [[Isaac Trumbo|Trumbo]]
[[Alexander Badlam, b. 1835|A Badlam]] & Judge[[Morris March Estee|Esstee]]  
We spent the night at Monte-
ry 23 Sunday We took a walk
through the Gardens the Arizona
Garden was the Most inter[e]st[in]g 
We saw two Centuory pl[a]nts
in Bloom I seemd to have
taken cold and set[t]l[e]d all [through]
my System

24 Aug for the first time in
years I see & hear Crows in the 
trees Near the [[Palace Hotel, San Francisco, San Francisco County, California|Hotel]] we took
A Carriage & Road through 
[[Monterey, Monterey County, California|Monterey]] & took Carriage
& Road through the pacific
Drive [grove] Cypress Grove the ownly
one in the World so the Driver
said saw the Stranded Steamer
on the Rock We drove through 
the [Pacific ??? Land] of
7000 Acres we passd through
a Heard of Large ground squirrels
a great number of them we
had a view of thousands of the 
pelicans & other large Birds on
a high Ridge and Rocks in the 
sea we stop[pe]d & bought some
sea shells of[f] a Chinese girl on
the road side

Aug 25

Brothers [[George Quayle Cannon|Cannon]] & [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1863|Asahel]]
& myself took Cars & rode
to the City of [[Monterey, Monterey County, California|Monterey]] We
highered a fish Boat paid $5
& road to sea opposite of
The [bad] ground & fished with 
Hooks all day we caught about
200 Rock fish & one Rock Cod
of about 8 lbs weight we caught
one rock fish of about 5 lbs most
of the fish were vry small Broth[er]
Cannon profes[se]d never to be
a fisherman but He caught his
share today Asahel Hookd a
Halabut but Lost him He 
would weigh 25 lb.

26 I spent most of the
day at the [[Palace Hotel, San Francisco, San Francisco County, California|palace]] we
had a paper race in
the Afternoon

482 M
to [[Los Angeles, Los Angeles County, California|Los Angel]]

Aug 27

We took cars in the 
Morning & rode to [[San Francisco, San Francisco County, California|San Fran
Cisco]] 125 Miles we went
to the Baths we then took
cars for Loss Angels rode
all Night I did not sleep
any I done to Much yester-
day

28 we got up in 
the Morning & traveled
through the Most romantic
Country I Ever saw Near
half of the way was through 
tunnels they last a
Mile to the bottom of 
valley it is called [[Tehachapi, Kern County, California|Tehcachopi]]
the sun shone through this
in the Highest Elevation
we reached the same as [[Salt Lake City, Salt Lake County, Utah Territory|Salt
Lake]] It is the roughest
peace of Rail Road

I Even travelled for 70
Miles I [our] travelled
we have passed 90 Miles
of rough road we
took breakfast at Hoave's
We passd through [[Los Angeles, Los Angeles County, California|Loss
Angles]] at 1 30 [FIGURE] And
through [[Santa Ana, Orange County, California|[Santaanna]]] 315

we saw the old Missi 
on [[Mission San Juan Capistrano, San Juan Capistrano, Orange County, California|San wan in Capisstar-
no]]. We came to seaside
at 10 Minutes to 5 oclock

Aug 29 We went out on the
pear [pier] got a fish pole that could
not hold any thing ownly [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1863|Asahel]]
caught a small [stingcreo] I spent
Most of the day [reading] the Mong
quarter

30 The Compy went to [Mary]
visit the [[Sweetwater Dam, San Diego County, California|sweet water dam]]

One of the most important
Dams in America. I spent the 
day in my room

31 Aug Several of our Brethren
Met with us to go out on a 
fishing Excursion. They were
[[Oluf Laurits Hammer|Oluf Hammer]] & [[Laura Larsena Petersen Hammer|Wife]] Elders [[Parley Taylor Wright|P T Wright]]
& [[Anna Magdalene Halgren Wright|wife]] [[Elias Albert Bushman|E. A. Bushman]] [[Joseph A. Barry|Joseph A Barry]]
& Miss Cooper of [[San Diego, San Diego County, California|San Diego]] Capt Paulson
took myself ^[[Emma Smith Woodruff|Emma]]^ President [[George Quayle Cannon|Cannon]] & [[Elizabeth Hoagland Cannon|wife]]
with the Rest of our Compay abov
Named Capt Paulson with his Little
steamer carried by gassotine
took us on board & went 
out to sea with us on to the  
fis hi ng grounds about 8 miles

[upside-down text] [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1863|Asahel H Woodruff]] went Sunday
Night & Met with the Saints in 
Sandiego & Addressed them for
about one hour

Aug 30, on the
gospel & had an interesting meeting [end of upside-down text]

Aug 31 [18]96

The Captain tied 5 lines to the stern
of the Steamer & [gave] me the Centre
line these lines were for trolling for
fish thy were about 200 feet long
The Hooks were without baarbs and
fastened with fine wire onto a
white bone we did not use
any biat at all the fish seeing
the white bone grabed it [Shall]
it was the most interesting
fishing I ever tried in my
life we fished about 2 Hours & caught
some 600 lbs of fish they were 
spanish Mackerels yellow tails
And Baracuda I caught
the Largest Mackerel would weigh
some 12 to 15 lbs They kept us very
busy for a while [[Emma Smith Woodruff|Emma]] caught
quite a Number of them & helpt
me haul in quite a number of my
halut

The fish that we caught
would Measure near 3 feet in
length it was the Most Exciting 
luck fishing I Ever was in
They were put into the Hands
of our Friends who went with
us I think they gave most
of them away to their
acquaintances we were some
what weary when we got to 
our quarters

Sept 1, Tuesday Morn[in]g 
we took cars & rode
to [[Los Angeles, Los Angeles County, California|Loss Angels]] & stayed at
the [[Hollenbeck Hotel, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County, California|Hollonbeck Hotel]] [Der/sti/end]
of the Day After Dinner all
the Compa[n]y but myself went
out on a ride to see the
Country I write a Letter
to [[Abraham Owen Woodruff|Owen]] & gave him an acco[un]t of 
our fishing trip and sent him
an Account of the Same from a
paper

Kind of fish Caught Grouper
Barracuda Spanish Mackerel
Yellow Tail, & Kelp Bass Jewfish

Sept 2d we took & rode to 
[[Pasadena, Los Angeles County, California|Passoden]] to to visit the Orange
& Lemon Grove that cover thousands
of Acres we took a Carrage
& rode 2 ½ hours through the Groves
of Orange Lemon & Pepper trees
some of the pepper trees were mor
than 2 feet though the best of the 
trees have ripe green & Bloom
pepper through the year At the 
close of our visit we took Cars
& returned to [[San Bernardino, San Bernardino County, California|San barnadeno]]
Distance of the Day 20 Miles
Sept 3 [[Emma Smith Woodruff|Emma]] & [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1863|Asahel]] done some
shopping

Sept 3 [18]92 [1896??]

I received a package of Letters 
this Morning of 11; 6 to [[Wilford Woodruff Jr.|WW]]
2 to [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1863|Asahel]] 1 to [[Sarah Emma Woodruff|Emma]]
& 2 to Brother [[George Quayle Cannon|Cannon]] [[Joseph Fielding Smith|J F Smith]]
says in his Letter that
Sister [[Ellen Curtis Spencer Clawson|Ellen Spencer Clawson]]
is Dead.

at 2,40 we took cars to
[[Santa Catalina Island, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County, California|Catalena]] We traveled about 30 m[in] ^on cars^
^I [stw]^  took Steam  
boat & traveled to the island
4 & spent the night
4 we took a small Electric? 
Steamer with 2 Men & Brother
Cannon & Asahel & myself on 
Board we traveled on the East 
side of the Island 9 Miles

Sept 4

we travelled with Lines 125 feet
at the Stearn of the boat & caught
several Spanish Mackerel I caught
2 & there & Brother [[George Quayle Cannon|Cannon]] [w] 1
we went on to the Jew fish ground
but caught None they weigh 
from 100 to 400 lbs we next anchored
on a rock 1/2 Mile Long & 300 yards
wide and it is 600 feet Deep to
the Rock we cannot Anchor but the 
Captain Labors to keep over the 
Rock we used lines 600 feet 
long and at the End is fastened
about 1 Doz short lines & hooks
& on the End of the Line fastened 
a rock about 3 lbs weight to 
sink the hook these Hooks were 
beated [baited] with sardines we Cast 
over these Lines and [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1863|Asahel’s]] got 
caught in the Stearn Stern of the

steemer & lost the whole 600 
feet the one I had went to 
the bottom & it was  2to ha[r]d 
work for me to hall up 20 or 
30 lbs of fish 600 feet I ownly 
pulled up once & had but 
2 on with some 12 or 15 lb weght
of fish & ^2 from^ the Stone. I gave it
to [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1863|Asahel]] the Co Man with 
us [[James Gardner|Jams Gardner]] helped him 
about beating & Letting Down
the line He ownly Halled up 
twice A and brought up 6 fish 
which would weigh about 40 lbs
the Next time He had 4 on about 
25 lbs it takes a long time to
Make a Hall the fish will weigh 
from 6 to 8 lb Nearly as red 
as Blood & they as all Dead when 
they got to the top of the water with
their bladders steady out of their

Sept 4 [4] got 2 letters

Mouths it is such a great
Distance to haul them up they are 
said to be good to Eat the Name 
of this fish is Grouper there 
must be thousands upon the rock
for the Hooks are taken as soon
as they strike the rock the fisherman 
Does not have to wait but 
a minute or 2two before He puls 
up his Line after Mak[in]g 3 
Halls we left for Home the sea 
was very rough Presid[en]t [[George Quayle Cannon|Cannon]]
was sick a good Deal of the 
Day I was not sick at all
Distance of the Day I should guage
to be about 30 Mils

5 I had a bad night Did not
sleep well I Rested to day the 
Company went out on the 
water in a glass Bottom Boat

They gave a very interesting 
History of it I spent most 
of the Day in my room reading
the Steamer Came in 
in the evening I saw most 
of the people of the place went
to the shore when the Steamer 
came in

6 Sunday I rode out in the 
morning with [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1863|Asahel]] [[Emma Smith Woodruff|Emma]] 
& Sister [[Elizabeth Hoagland Cannon|Cannon]] in the Glass 
Bottom Boat and in 50 & 60 feet 
of water we could see evary
thing on the water to the 
bottom Clerly & I learned one 
important thing that I never 
knew before this Kelp that 
floats on the sea grows in 
a forest on the bottom of 
the sea like a forest of timber
and we saw large trees

[[Santa Catalina Island, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County, California|Catalena]] 
Island

6 Sunday

of it 50 feet under water
with branchs growing out from 
the Main body like limbs
& we could see all the fish 
swimming in the midst
of this Kelp we saw more
Gold fish in the midst of the 
kelp than any other kind
I wrote a Letter to [[Abraham Owen Woodruff|Owen]] giving 
him an accont of our fishg and 
that we would Start home tomorrow
The two steamer both Left 
the Island [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1863|Asahel]] went to
the Congregational Meeting

7 [[Emma Smith Woodruff|Emma]] was sick through
the night with the [diarrhea]
7. we took breakfast at 6
Island is 22 Miles Long 
from 1/2 to 8 miles wide
containing [Mountains] barely

room to set a House
we took steamer & rode 
to [[Los Angeles, Los Angeles County, California|Loss Angels]] 40 Miles we
stop & took Dinner at our 
Former [[Hollenbeck Hotel, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County, California|Hotel]] We then parted
with o[u]r Mormon Friends
& we took Car for Home
we rode through the day &
night I had a very bad night
I suffered much through the 
Night I did not sleep at all &
got up & dressed & slept a short
time

Sept 7. we rode to [[Truckee, Nevada County, California|trucy]] had
to wait for a team of Cars
to come in for us to take
we went on for 
[Slaclor] where there was
a farm

8 Sept We traveled through 
the Day through [Deserts] Hills
& plains. I had a [long and]
sick Night I hav not 
slept 30 Minutes in 48 hours

9 I arrived this Morning
sick we traveled u in 
Utah on to [[Ogden, Weber County, Utah Territory|Ogden]] & on to
[[Salt Lake City, Salt Lake County, Utah Territory|Salt Lake]] Distance on this Journey 1280 Miles.

10 I went to the office got 6 letters
1 from [[Phoebe Arabell Woodruff Moses|Bell Moses]] I wrote her one
& sent her $5 we went to the [[Salt Lake City Temple, Salt Lake City, Salt Lake County, Utah|Temple]] 
& spent 2 Hours I was poorly through
the Day

11 I sent the Day in the office Met
with a Number of the Brethrn The Mining
Company had a Meeting I wrote a Letter
[FIGURE] & To [[Newton Woodruff, b. 1863|Newton]] & sent $10, to
[[David Patten Woodruff|David]] $5 for WW & $5 for [[Abraham Owen Woodruff|Owen]]

them Now soon some $60000

13 I wrote to [[Mary A. Gilchrist|Mrs Wm Woodruff]]

some $ 160,000 payment {shorthand}
12 Saturday I spant to day at home
13 I spent the day at home poorly &
was A ttacked with Diarhea which
Lasted through the night
14 I was bad this Morning but went
to the office and we were all full
of Business on our Debts I had $60
I turned that over to Br Jack to help
as far as it went to help pay the
Interest on our Note I received

[upside-down text]in the spirit world as a pure & Holy
Apostle from Zion in the Rocky Moun-
tains. A Labor which would not
ownly prove a great Benefit to
his Fathers Household but to the
Church and Kingdom of God on the
Earth The spirit of God rested
upon me at the Closeee of this
Manifestation in a powerful maner
and bore Testimony to me of the
truth of the revelation to me of the
truth of the revelation to me
Concerning [[Abraham Hoagland Cannon|Abram H Cannon]]
copied in my Journal [end of upside-down text]

[upside-down text] while in [[San Francisco, San Francisco County, California|San fransico]] on the nght
of Tuesday Aug 18 I was very much
troubled in the fore part of the night with
Evil spirits that tried to Afflict
me finally a spirit visted me that
seemed to have power of the Evil spirits
and they departed from me 

And I
had concluded not to Attend
the Mormon Meeting for testimony
in this City but this spirit said
to me it was Wisdom for us all
to attend the Testimony Meeting as
the Saints knew we were here
& if we did not attend it would
have an unpleasant Effect upon the
Saints so I concluded to Attend
This same spirit said to me
in its communication to me
Not to grieve because of the
Depature of [[Abraham Hoagland Cannon|Abram Hoagland Cannon]]
for the Lord had called hims to
fill a vary important Mission [end of upside-down text]

Aug 15 put in passBook
$30

Friday


Aug 18th Left father [[Ezra Carter, b. 1773|Carter's]] in company with Elder Hale {shorthand}
{shorthand} and started for [[Portland, Cumberland County, Maine|Portland]] {shorthand}
{shorthand} arrived at Portland
in the evening I had an interviedw with
[Ezra Carter, b. 1804|Ezra Carter jr]] Spent the night in Portland
at [[Samuel Hale|Samuel Hales]] Portland population
about 16000

Saturday


19th we abord the Steamer
Bangor at 11AM for [[Fox Islands, Waldo County, Maine|fox Islands]] to
{shorthand}
{shorthand} we arived at [[Owls Head, Knox County, Maine|Owls Head]] at 
Sunset ^fare $3 distance & 5 miles^ {shorthand} We went aboard
of a small sloop & crossed to fox Islands 10 miles
fare 75 cts arrived at fox Isalnds at 2 oclock in the morning

Sunday


[page torn] 20th called at [[Nathaniel Dyer|Nathaniel Dyers]] & retired to rest arose 
in the morning made inquiry concerning meeting learned
there was Baptist preaching in a meeting house in the
centre of the ^north^ Island part of VinalHaven we walked
to this Island is 109 miles long & 2 miles wide contaning
about 800 inhabitants ^south Island 1000^ it takes North & South islands ^the covers^ to camps

we saw the place whare the Royal Tar was born
Vinal Haven or fox Islands is in North Latitude
44 degrees north Long ^69.10^ 89th We walked to Mr Benjamin Kents we
requested him to attend the Baptist meeting with us we
visited to see the priest & appoint a meeting & have
a hearing Mr Kent accompanied us when we arrived
at the meeting it had commenced. we consulted the Deacon 
upon the subject & made our request known that
we wished to preach to the people. he conversed with
the Baptist priest whose name was [[Gideon J. Newton|Gideon J Newton]] 
he did not object & we were invited into the stand 
& he gave out our appointment when he closed his 
meeting. Mr Newton invited us home with him
& gave us some refreshment we presented him the
[[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]] he was mild did not object
But said he would read it Mr Newton acompend 
us to the meeting house the congregation assembled 
at 8 oclock PM & with peculiar feelings I arose &
addressed the congregation from [[Epistle to the Galatians|Gal]] 1st ch 8:9 this 
was the first time that I or any Elder of the church 
of Latter Day Saints that (to my knowledg) ever arose 
before the inhabitants of aone of the [[Islands of the Sea|Islands of the Sea]] 
to preach to them the fullness of the [[everlasting gospel|everlasting gospel]] 
& the [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]] After I closed we had seven
invitations to preach we gave out two appointments
returned & spent the night with Mr [[Benjamin Kent|Kent]] distance 8 miles 
{Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] and myself had a good time in secret prayer. May God bless us on the islands and help us find the blood of} [[blood of Ephraim|Eph]]

Monday


Aug 21st on {shorthand} visited & sea shore {shorthand}
{shorthand} ^20^ said the gallant ships under sail it was a pleasant day {shorthand}
{shorthand} we visited the East part of the Island left an
Appointment for preaching at the East School house from
thence we went to the North district & preached in the 
North School house Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] spake upon the authenticity of 
the [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]] I followed him the [[spirit of God|Spirit of God]] 
rested upon us we spent the night with Mr [[Stephen Luce|Stephen Luce]] 10 miles

Tuesday


22nd visited the sea shore & Elder Hale & myself gathered 
some pebbles from the store white ot& others coulers this were 
transparent washed from the Sea our intent was to preserve 
them in memory of the Island. we accompanied Mr [[Stephen Luce|Luce]]
in a boat to ketch some fish in [[Penobscot, Penobscot County, Maine|penobscot bay]] & when
we entered it it was occupied by a magnus School of 
[[pohagen|pohagin]] fish they coverd acres it was supposed their was suff-
icent in the school to have filled 500,000 Barrels we caught 
none of them but saw & herd them rush in large bodies 
on the top of the water Numerous fish halks were busy in 
cetching & carrying off many of them From this survey we 
walked to the South District School house & I preached to a
crouded ncongregation priest [[Gideon J. Newton|Newton]] was with the number 
I preached from the authenticity of the Book of Mormon
{I was clothed with much of the [[spirit of God|spirit of God]]} we spent the night at Mr [[Benjamin Kent|Benj Kent]] 8 miles

Wednesday


23rd Walked to Mr [[Ebenezer Waterman Carver|Ebenezar Carvers]] oon the East part of the 
Island I stood on his farm & saw fifty five Islands of
the Sea & part of them inhabited & part were not & also
twenty ships under sail. We preached at night at the East 
School house {shorthand} We spent the night with [[Stephen Luce|Stephen
Luce]] Esq Distance 4 miles


[sideways text] W
W
Willford [end of sideway text]

Thursday


24th Preachd at the West School house at 7 oclock P. M
to a large congregation Spent the night at Dec [[Hezekiah Ames|Hezekiah 
Eames]] Distance of the day 8 miles

Friday


25th Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] visited the east part of the Island & preachd
at 7 PM in the school house. I visited [[Benjamin Crabtree|Benjamin Crabtree]] Esq 
& others in looking at his library & saw one account of 
[[John Calvin|John Calvin]] burning Servetus a french physition for 
differing from him in sentiment. I preached at 7PM at the
West School house & Spent the night at Mr [[Lewis Leadbetter|Lewis Leberters]] distance 5 miles

Saturday


26th Walked to Mr [[Benjamin Kent|B Kents]] {spent some time in prayer} We visited 
the sea shore bathed in salt water whare their was 
several seal swiming around us one of them 
came near us {shorthand} I went to the North
School house & preached at 7 PM Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] Preachd 
at [[Levi Dyer|Levy Dyers]] at 7 oclock I spent the night at 
Mr. [[Malatiah Luce|Maltire Luce]] Distance of the day 7 miles

Sunday


27th Sunday walked to the East School house found 
Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] I preached at 10 AM on faith after 
meeting I dined with Mr Waterman & walked
to the Meeting house & I preached to a large con-
-gregation at 5 PM on the [[Second Coming of Jesus Christ|coming of Christ]] & gave 
out five appointments for the week {shorthand} day

Monday


28th Wrote a Letter to my [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|wife]] walked to the past
office from thence to the west School house & preached at 7 PM
Spent the night at [[Hezekiah Ames|Hezekiah Eames]] distance 6 miles. We
had an interview with Mr [[Nathaniel Wooster|Nathaniel Woster]] aged 74 ^years^

he had been an inhabitant of fox Islands or Vinal-
Haven for 70 years he informed me that he had never
in life been one & half miles from Salt water or
the Sea He also informed us that there was an abond-
ance of fish & a grat variety of them in the Harbour
at these Islands he said such as, Whale, Blackfish, Shark,
Sturgeon, Cod, Pollock, Hake, Haddock, Holloboat, Shad,
Salmon, Mackerel, Bass, ^Alewives^ Alewives, Herren, Pohagen, Dolphin, Frost
-fish, Flounders, Smelt, TomCod, Grampus, Skate, Shrimp, Skid,
Cush, Bluebacks, Scollop, Dogfish, Mutton fish, Lumpfish, Squid,
Five fingers, Eeels, Lobsters, Clams, Mussles, Bincles, Crabs,
Snales, Porposes, Seat &c &c & may other not named

Tuesday


Aug 29th Preached at the north School house spent the night
at Mr [[Malatiah Luce|Malatiah Luce]] distance 8 miles

Wednesday


30th Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] Preached at the East School house
I followed him we Spent the night at Mr
[[Samuel Carver|Samuel Carver]] distance of the day 4 miles

Thursday


31st Last day of Summer {shorthand} 
visited many friends {shorthand} 
Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] & myself retired under a fir tree & sing
a song composed by Elders [[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|Marsh]] & [[Orson Pratt|Pratt]] on the last
day of Summer in 1835 The sun that declines in the far 
Western Sky, &c. We then knelt down & worship God. we 
preached in the south Schoolhouse. {shorthand}
I spent the night at Capt [[Justus Ames|Justis Eames]] distance 7 miles

[Upside down]

more fish Monk fish Nurs fish. sunfish. swordfish. Thrasher.
Cat. Whiting. Scuppoz. Tootoz. Hors mackerel. Eye fish
Groond Shark. PILOT fish. Gunner. Ling.

Friday


Sept 1st spent the dat at Capt Justus Eames preached at 
night at Mr [[Levi Dyer|Levy Dyers]] Spent the night at Mr 
Dyers Distance {of the} day 4 miles

Sunday


3rd Sunday I Preached at Capt [[Justus Ames|Justus Eam's]]
I commenced at 10 AM at the [edising] of the first
discours {shorthand}
we had an intermission & Met again at 1 PPM
I preached upon the perable of the [] of
[Lanes] and after I closed {shorthand} two offerd
themselves for baptism We accordingly repared
to the Sea Store And Elder Jonathan Hale led
them into the waters of baptsm Which were Capt 
Justus Eames & [[Betsey Hudson Ames|Betsey Eames]] his wife These were the
first Elder Hale ever Baptized & the first Baptized on 
any of the [[islands of the sea|Islands of the Sea]] in thes Last Days by 
the Elders of Latter Day Saints to my knowledge I
gave out an appointment for next Sabbath at 
Brother Eames {shorthand} 
{shorthand} I administered 
in the confermation of Brother & Sister Eames. I 
Spent the night at [[Stephen Luce|Stephen Luce]] Esq the
Distance of the day 4 miles

Willford Woodruff's
Daily Journal & travels in the ministry
Commencing at Montrose Lee County Ioway Terr
Aug 8th 1839

Monday


Sept 4th Walked to Brother [[Justus Ames|Eames]] found them rejoicing 
in God {I was attacked with a cold.} A young man came in to enquire 
what he should do to be saved I taught him as [[Peter (NT)|Peter]] 
did on the Day of Pentecost the [[spirit of God|spirit of God]] is like 
leaven through the Island. We took the parting
hand with these friends went to the Post Office
& took a Sail boat to cross on to [[Fox Islands, Waldo County, Maine|South fox 
Island]] We had a plesant time & sung on the 
way The gallant Ships &c. It was about 1 1/2 miles
across to the Island we landed on the neck & 
felt to rejoice to stand on another Island of 
the Sea to preach the gospel May God bless us 
& give us access to the harts of the people & 
souls as seals of our ministry We immediately 
gave out an appointment at School hous No. 1. 
Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] Preached on the gospel I followed 
him The [[spirit of God|spirit of God]] rested upon us We 
spent the night with Mr [[James Babbidge|James Babbidge]] my Cold increasd & lungs very sore We gave
out three appointments for meetings The distance 
of the day 7 miles

Thursday


The time had come for me to take my 
departure from my family to carry the gospel 
of Jesus Christ to the nations of [[Europe|Europe]] in fulfill
ment of the commandment of God accordingly I 
left a parting blessing with my [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|wife]] & took my fare 
well of her & other saints on the morn of the 8th Day
of OctAug 1839 & left [[Montrose, Lee County, Iowa Territory|Montrose]] & crossed the [[Mississippi River, United States|Missisippi 
River]] for the purpose of commencing my mission of 
of four about six thousand miles & I started without 
purs or scrip and that to with the fever & ague rest-
ing upon me every other day. I left in company with 
Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|John Taylor]]. We were the first of the quorum 
of the Twelve that started out on this important
mission but the rest expect to follow us immediately We 
rode from [[Commerce, Hancock County, Illinois|Commerce]] across a 16 mile prairie & spent 
the night at Brother [[Brother Merrill|Merils]] distance of the day 18

Friday


OctAug 9th rode 10 miles to Brother [[Ute Perkins|Perkins]], we passed 
through [[Carthage, Hancock County, Illinois|Carthage]] I spent the day at Br Perkins untill 12 
oclock during which time I was suffering under the power 
of the ague & fever & immediately after the fever came 
upon me I got into the waggon with Br Perkins & rode to

Tuesday
Sept 5th Left Mr [[James Babbidge|Babbidge]] & walked about
a mile & went to the top of a ^high^ ledge and stopd 
on a Smooth granite rock covering [lake]
two acres Some of the face of it was covered with 
a light soil out of which grew the pine the
whoretlebury, wintergreen ^& Same in the seam^ &c. We set dow 
^of the necks^ under the Shade of a pine for Morning 
prayers, & O, what glorious contemplations 
vibrated our souls. Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] read the 
16 chaptes of [[Jeremiah (OT)|Jeremiah]] that spake of the 
hunters & fishers that God should chuse in 
the last days to gather Israel & of a truth 
here we were on an Island of the Sea 
Surrounded by water standing upon a rock.
Where we could survey the Island which was as
as full of rocks holes & caves perhaps as any 
part of the Earth. But what had brought us here
ah to search out the [[blood of Ephraim|Blood of Ephraim]] & gather
him from thes Islands of the Sea & the
holes & caves of the rocks which were nu
merous as on thes Islands. While the Sun

[[Macomb, McDonough County, Illinois|McComb]] from thence to Br [[Don Carlos Smith, b. 1816|Carloss Smiths]] this was 
over a rough road of 25 miles & I truly suffered mu
ch this day it seemed as though I should shake to peaces in 
the waggon with a heavy fever upon me I spent the night in 
company with Br [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylor]] at Br Carloss Smiths {shorthand} 35

Saturday


10th I commenced taking a box of Sappington's Anti 
fever pills which are so highly recommended for the ague 
& fever as I do not wish to carry the disease any further 
with me. I attended meeting in the grove Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylor]] 
Preached & I followed him & although I was weak in body
yet the Lord strengthened me spent the night with [[Don Carlos Smith, b. 1816|Carlos]]

Sunday


11th Sunday this is my day to be sick with the ague & 
fever according to its usual course but blessed be the Lord I 
have esscaped it this day. I have taken 14 of the sappington
pills & they have cured me intirely of the ague to all app
earance. I attended meeting in the grove & herd a discourse 
from Elders [[John Taylor, b. 1808|J Tailor]] [[Don Carlos Smith, b. 1816|C. Smith]] & [[Samuel Smith|S. Smith]] & communed with the 
Saints & inasmuch as we were without purs & scrip, they con
tributed to our necessities to the amount of $9. One Mr [[George Miller|Miller]] 
offered himself for baptism after meeting I rode to [[Macomb, McDonough County, Illinois|McComb]] fro
m thence to Father [[John Coltrin|John Coltrin's]] & spent the night was 
weak & feeble with the exercises of the day. Distance 14 miles

Shed his beams to gladden Earth the Spirit of
God easd our souls to rejoice. Elder Hale
& myself I sat ^down^ & sung & read pryd, & rejoicd
we spake of the Ancients Prophets & Apostles
in Jerusalem and Asaia & Also [[Nephi (BofM)|Nephi]]
[[Alma (BofM)|Alma]] [[Mormon (BofM)|Mormon]] & [[Moroni (BofM)|Moroni]] ^in America^ we also spake 
of [[Joseph Smith Jr.|Joseph]], [[Oliver Cowdery|Oliver]], [[Sidney Rigdon|Sidney]]: &C. Esspecially [[Heber Chase Kimball|Kimble]]
& [[Orson Hyde|Hide]] & [[John Goodson|Goodson]] & others in [[England|England]] & in
& [[John Edward Page|Page]] &c [[Canada, British North America|Canida]]
life circumstances. While filled with these med
ations & the Promises of God we fell upon 
our knees & thanked the God of heaven & 
Prayd for all Israel not forgetting the [[Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints|Church 
of Latter Day Saints]] head nor foot. We 
plead with God for [[Joseph Smith Jr.|Joseph]] the all the Elders 
& members Esspecially our wives. our
souls rejoiced we went our way with glad 
harts. will not the rememberance of thes
things last forever esspecially untill our heads
are silverd oer with age Tell it unto your 
children's children. (This ledge is vay high we
had a fair view of most of the Island which is

Monday


Aug 12th Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylor]] Baptized Mr [[George Miller|Miller]] I spent the 
day with Br [[Zebedee Coltrin|Zebedee Coltrin]] I am gaining in strength I
spent the night at Brother [[John Vance|John Vance]]

Tuesday


13th I am still gaining strength I feel thankful to the 
Lord for his mercies unto me in this thing I spent the day at Coltrin
we have now concluded to accompany Father [[John Coltrin|Coltrin]] by 
land who is going with a two hors waggon to [[Ohio|Ohio]] & has 
offered to carry us which will assist us so much on our journey

Wednesday


14th Brother [[George Miller|Miller]] gave us a horse & we started on our jour
ney travled to the [[Illinois River, Illinois|Ill River]] & crossed the River at [[Beardstown, Cass County, Illinois|Beardsto
wn]] continued 4 miles thrugh the sand & spent the night with 
Mr Rew the distance of the day 38 miles

Thursday


15 Passed through [[Virginia, Cass County, Illinois|Virginia]] from thence to [[Springfield, Sangamon County, Illinois|Spriengfield]] 
& attended meeting with the saints. I addressed the 
Church in fiew words & was followed by Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Tailor]]
I felt wearied with my Journey as I had ownly partially 
gained my strength Distance of the day 40 mi

Friday


16th Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylor]] engaged a printer at [[Springfield, Sangamon County, Illinois|Springfield]] to print 
for him fifteen hundred copies of a brief sketch in pamphlet 
form of the persecutions & sufferings of the Church of Jesus 
Christ of Latter Day Saints by the inhabitants of the stntsate of 
[[Missouri|Missouri]] I spent the day in Springfield

it is so cut up it is supposed if the beach was measured all round the Island it wood
be one hundred miles
about 10 miles long & 5 miles wide [but Any
willant tern or void ^but up into west & points^ & is amost] one complete
ledge of rocks with the exception of a few scatterd
peaces under cultivation which been produces
good wheat & potatoes being the Staple pruduc
-tion, population about 100 inhabitants &
they get most of their living & wealth by
fishing which are vay numerous as their
is rising of fifty sorts of fish that freequent
the waters around those Islands We spent about
3 hours in reading Singing praying meditating []
singing writing & next our sug rejoicing We
[]
We preached at the School house No 2 at 7 {shorthand}
{shorthand} We spent the night
at Mr John Smiths distance 6 miles {shorthand}

Wednesday


Sept 6th I saw a great variety this day I passed over 
& viewed a pleasing Rocky scenery both on the 
beach & upland. We dined with Mr [[Benjamin Coombs|Benjamin Cooms]]
we visited his flakes of fish which contained about one 
thousand quintals of cod that were spread for drying these 
were principly caught at [[Newfoundland|Newfoundland]] from thence to 
[[Carvey|Carvers Wharf]] here we were for a moment diverted to see 
a school of Mackerel playing in the water by the side of the 
wharf while several men were [[fishing|cetching]] them with hooks
Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] & myself flung out some hooks & had no

Saturday


17 I rode to spring [[Rochester, Sangamon County, Illinois|Rochester]] with father [[John Coltrin|Coltrin]] & 
once more had an interview with some of our [[Fox Islands, Waldo County, Maine|fox
Island]] friends we stoped at Mr [[Ebenezer Waterman Carver|Carvers]] I was 
pleased with an interview with [[Abigail Waterman Carver|mother]] & sister 
[[Mary Stinson Carver|Carver]] but esspecially with [[Nathaniel Thomas|Brother]] & Sister 
[[Susanna Luce Thomas|Thomas]] who had arived at [[Rochester, Sangamon County, Illinois|Rochester]] since 
I left I had not seen him before since we part
ed in [[Indiana|india]] last winter I also saw sister [[Mary Arey Brown Babbitt|Brown]] 
who was called to mourn the loss of her husband & 
oldest Daughter Sister Brown was perfectly resi
gned I spent the night with Br Thomas {distance of the day} 8 miles

Sunday


18th Sunday I preached the funal sermon of the 
[[Ellen Agnes Bradshaw Draper|wife]] of Brother [[Zemira Draper|Zemira Draper]] who Died at 5 oclok 
PM on Saturday the 17th of Aug aged 22 years. 
(Brother [[Charles Brown|Charles Brown]] and his daughter [[Rebecca Brown|Rebecca]]
both died on the eve of the 6th day of Aug 1839 
Brother Brown Died at 11 oclck & Rebecca a 12
& were buried the next day ^both in one grave^) I accompanied the 
corps of Sister [[Ellen Agnes Bradshaw Draper|Draper]] to the grave I had an interview 
with most all of the [[Fox Islands, Waldo County, Maine|fox Island]] friends I spent the 
night with Elder [[Arnold Stephens|Stephens]] {distance of the day} 4 miles

difficulty in cetching a plenty of them. We caught 
what we wished for & went our way leaving thousands of 
them in the water ready to bite the hook. People on 
these Islands are now in the midst of haying, & some few 
began to cut their wheat. Their fruit is now ripe such 
as cherries, raspberries, grose buries, currents &
whostle buries. The inhabitants generally Welthy industrious ^healthy^
[lorest] & generous & very hospitable to Strangers. We 
preached at night in the school house NO. 4. & Spent the
night at Mr [[Benjamin Fernald|Benjamin Fernald]] distance {of the day} 5 miles

Thursday


7th Preached at the School house NO 3 at 7 to a crowded
congregation Spent the night at [[Israel Carver|Israel Carvers]]: 3. mi

Friday


8th Walked to Mr [[Luther Calderwood|Luther Calderwoods]] Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] &
myself went on to the Beach & dug a peck of clams 
& had them Cook'd for our dinner which made 
us a frugal meal. From thence we walked to james
Babbidge & preached at 7 in the School house No 1
Elder Hale preached on the [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]]. Elder
[[William Stuart Douglass|D^o^uglass]] a [[Methodist|methodist]] Priest was present. We spent the 
night with [[Joseph Carver|Joseph Clarver]] Distance 7 miles

Saturday


9th Mr [[Joseph Carver|Carver]] conveyed us across the thoroughfare 
to Mr [[John Kent|John Kents]] in a Sale Boat abot 4 miles
perused the papers that gave an account at [dissthes]
tornados of the at parterck Co St Thomas & west
Indies Distance of the day 7 mils

Monday


19th I spent most of the day visiting the Saints or most
of it I rode to Br [[Joseph Coone|J. Coon's]] at my old haditation I had some 
peculiar feelings while visiting this place W I 
next visited Brother [[Isaac Carter Odekirk|Oudercark]] & Sister Smith & 
their families. Brother Smith had gone East on a mis
sion numbers of those families were sick I lade 
hands upon them & asked the Lord to heal them
Sister [[Mary Arey Brown Babbitt|Brown]] was present She accompanied me to 
the grave of her husband & Daughter they were
both buried in one grave I then went to the house 
whare she resided with Brother [[Ephraim Luce|Luce]] I spent several 
hours with them I left a blessing with Sister Brown
& her children also with Brother Luce & family I 
then returned to Brother [[Arnold Stephens|Stephens]] from there to 
Mr [[John Alley|Allay's]] & preached the gospel of Jesus 
Christ unto them I a congregation I was 
strengthened in body & mind many were affected on 
parting with me I returned to Elder [[William Draper|Wm 
Draper's]] & spent the night distance of the day 7 mi

Tuesday


20th I was suddenly called upon in the mor
ning to return to [[Springfield, Sangamon County, Illinois|Springfield]] to attend an

Sunday


May 20th Sunday I accumpanyed the Brethren 
to the place of meeting in Varick street betw 
Vandan & Charlton which is the stated place 
of Preaching for the Saints Elder [[Orson Pratt|Pratt]] ca
lled upon me to preach to the people I 
arose & spoke to them from the parable of 
the Prophet Zenas in the Book of Mor
mon the spirit of the Lord rested upon me
a noon we dined with Brother Harderbrook 
in Carlton Street Brother [[David White Rogers|David W. Rogers]] 
dined with us brother Rogers was an inter
esting man he had been a Methodist for 
several years but had been looking 
for greater things than the church had Brother
[[David White Rogers|Rogers]] was a Teacher among the saints 
he was a true & literal desendant of John 
Rogers who was burnt at the stake he 
was the six G generation from John Rogers
We visited a woman sick with the palsy 
we Prayed for her. We again returned 
to the place of meeting. Elder [[Orson Pratt|O. Pratt]] 
delivered us a very interesting discours from 
Nephi's vision in the 3rd chapter of the first 
Book of Nephi. Their ^commund with the Saints^ was one man from [[Philadelphia, Philadelphia County, Pennsylvania|Phelid
elphier]] Attended meeting during this day & was
much believing after meeting in compeny 
with Elder [[Elijah Fordham|E H Fordham]] & Brother Rogers &
walked to father Pratts the Englishman we prayed 
with his wife & daughter who was still ill
Elder Fordham lives in Cherry Street 327

Elders Co^u^rt accordingly I returned to Springfield 
& met with the council of Elders at 11 oclock AM 
Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|John Taylor]] prefered a charge against 
Elder [[Almon Whiting Babbitt|Almon Babit]] for rejecting his teaching in 
public when it was correct & for other improper 
conduct. I was called to the chair & opened the 
meeting by prayer We herd the testimony on the 
subject & with other remarks the Day was occ
upyed untill the sitting of the sun the testimony 
was against Elder Bapbbit & he finally made 
a confession & the subject was settled. We 
had much other matters to perform & but 
little time to do it in Elder Taylor settled 
with the printer for printing his history of the
persecution of the Saints. We also sold our 
horse saddle & bridle for $23 dollars & we had 
some Donations made us by the Saints to assist us 
on our journey We took the parting hand with 
the Saints & rode to Rochester & spent the night 
with Brother [[Nathaniel Thomas|N Thomas]] I [FIGURE] wrote a letter 
to my [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|wife]] & requested her to write to me in 
[[Buffalo, Erie County, New York|Buffalo]] & [[New York|New York]] Distance 16 miles

Monday


11th Sept Spent the day visiting friends found many believing 
the gospel retirned to Brother [[Justus Ames|J. Eames]] I accompanied 
several friends to the meeting house at candle light
to hear Mr [[William Stuart Douglass|Douglass]] preach, a [[Methodist|methodist]] Priest.
He took his text in [[First Epistle to the Thessalonians|1st Thess]]. 5:21st & then commenced 
open war against the [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]] & our 
principles After doing all he could & but little at 
that he took the Book of Mormon in his hand
& declaired he was not afraid of the judgments of
God for rejecting that Book or the work. I took
the minutes of his discours, & when he closed I 
arose & informed the people I would hold a meet
ing in the meeting house on Sunday & answer 
his objections. I however rectifyed some of his 
mistakes in his presence. I spent the night at 
Brother [[Justus Ames|Eames]] distance 7 miles

Tuesday


Sept 12th We held a meeting for Baptism Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]]
led three into the waters of Baptism which was the
whole house hold of Brother [[Cyrus Starrett|Cyrus Starretts]]. Spent
the night with him distance 3 miles

Wednesday


13 Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] & myself both receieved a Letter 
from our wives [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Phebe]] wrote to me & [[Olive Boynton Hale|Olive]] to
Brother Hale We truly rejoiced in our souls to hear 
from them. I shed many tears of Joy over them 
while sitting upon Island of the Sea reading them while
the Gallad steps were passing by me Spent the night 
at Brother [[Justus Ames|Eames]] distance 7 miles

Wednesday


21st I took the parting hand with Mr 
[[Ebenezer Waterman Carver|E Carver]] & his family & [[Nathaniel Thomas|Brother]] & Sister [[Susanna Luce Thomas|Thomas]] 
& left [[Rochester, Sangamon County, Illinois|Rochester]] & rode to the end of the 7 
miles prairie & stoped several hours as father 
[[John Coltrin|Coltrin]] was vary sick from thence we 
rode to Brothe [[Elijah Cheney|Chen^i^a]] & spent the night 
Distance of the Day 28 miles

Thursday


22 We crossed a 12 mile priairie & also a 14
mile prairie we found the flies bad upon the 
horses we spent the night at the house of 
Mr Shaw's on the main branch of the Okaw 
an Indian name & a hebrew frase {distance of the day} 40m

Friday


23 crossed an 18 mile prairie & took break
fast & then rode across the 14 mile prairie to 
[[Paris, Edgar County, Illinois|Paris]] from thence to Mr [[G. Moke|G. Moke's]] Inn & spent 
the night Distance of the Day 40 miles

Saturday


24th We left the state of [[Illinois|Illn]] & passed into the 
State of [[Iowa Territory|Ia]]. We crossed the Wabash & 
spent the day of& night at Doct [[Charles Burns Modesitt|Modesett's]] 
a member of the Church of Latter Day Saints I 
was much fatigued & had a fever I had an 
interview During the evening with a Mr [[Mr. Adams|Adams]]

Thursday


Sept 14 I wrote a Letter to [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Phebe]] at Brother [[Justus Ames|Eames]] Elder 
[[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] wrote a Letter to [[Olive Boynton Hale|Olive]]

Friday


15th I wrote a Letter to my Parents in [[Connecticut|Connecticut]]
Elder Hale finishd his letter to Olive

Saturday


16th I wrote a Letter to Aunt [[Anna Hart Cossett|Anna Cosset]] {shorthand}

Sunday


17th Sunday I went to the [[Baptist|Baptist]] meeting house
& there ^met^ a large congregation assembled from 
both Islands I took up the abjections of Mr
[[William Stuart Douglass|Douglass]] against the Book of Mormon and ouor
principles I Preached 2 1/2 hours & answered every objection 
brought against us or the Book. After meeting Elder 
[[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] baptized one [[Elizabeth G. Luce Page|female]]. We then met again
& I preached to them upon the gospel Spent the night at [[Justus Ames|Eames]]

Monday


18th We wrote a Letter to Brother [[Joseph Smith Jr.|Joseph Smith jr]] 
& the Church of Latter Day Saints in [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]]

Wednesday


20th Spent the day in visiting the friends & Preached at 
night in the East School house I Preached Christs 
[[Sermon on the Mount|Sermon on the Mount]] the [[spirit of God|Spirit of God]] restd upon 
me {shorthand} We spent the night at Mr [[Abraham J. Carver|Abram Carvers]] ^6 miles^

Thursday


21 Spent the day visiting took the parting hand with Elder
[[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] he went to the [[South Fox Island, Waldo County, Maine|South Island]] I spent the night 
with Mr [[Ephraim Luce|Ephraim Luce]] distance 5 miles

[[Mr. Adams|Adams]] that had been a constant companion 
of Brother [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1814|Asahels]] for several years & appeared 
to be the most capable of giving me a correct 
account concerning him in evry point of view
of any man in the West. He informed me that 
in the main point he was vary steady & temporate
in his habits & did not believe in the principle of 
white lying or misrepresenting on order to carry on 
his business or merchantdise & got along well in 
his business untill the last year of his life he had 
bought a large quantity of Books & they Did 
not sell as well as he Expected & he was not able to 
meet his payments this was a source of much regret 
to him, & the main cause of his Estate becomeing insolvent 
During the last year of his life he manifested a 
great Desire to more fully improve his mind than 
he ever had done he read many of Thomas pains 
writings & they more fully esstablished him in the 
gospel of Jesus Christ although those writings were 
against it. he considered his arguments easily to be 
refuted. Asahel was more free in opening his mind to 
Mr Adams than to any other man consequently he more

Friday


Sept 22 I Preached at the north School house and
came forward for baptism Spent the night at 
[[Stephen Luce|Stephen Luce]] Esq distance 2 miles

Saturday


23rd Preached at the north School house 
& Baptized one. Mrs Lydia Luce {The devil tempted some but 
we got a victory on him.} Spent the night at Brother 
[[Justus Ames|Eames]] writed Mr Banks distance of the day 6 miles

Sunday


24th Sunday preached at Brother [[Justus Ames|Eames]] two discour
-ses to a full congregation Spent the night at Brother Eames

Monday


25 Left [[North Fox Island, Waldo County, Maine|North Island]] crossed the thoroughfare 
to the [[South Fox Island, Waldo County, Maine|South Island]] to Mr [[Abijah Luce|Abigah Luce]] I here 
met Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] I preached at candlelight at
the house of Mr Luce & spent the night with him 7 mi

Tuesday


26 I attended a marriage at Mr [[Jonathan Burgess|Jonathan 
Burgess]] [[Joseph W. Sylvester|Joseph Sylvester]] to [[Martha A. Burgess Sylvester|Martha Burgess]]I
preached in the School house No 2. The [[spirit of God|Spirit of God]] rested 
upon me I spent the night at Mr [[John Smith, b. 1781|John Smith's]] 
& I dreamed of seeing the great [[dragon|draggon]] or beast 
with all of his heads & horns distance 9 miles

Wednesday


27th I preached at No 4. Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] baptized 
one [[Jonathan Burgess|J Burgess]] Spent the night at Capt [[John Carver|John Carvers]] 6 miles

Thursday


28 Walked to father [[Anthony Coombs Jr.|Anthony Coombs]] Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] Baptized 
Mother [[Elizabeth Allen Coombs|Elizabeth Coombs]]. I Preached at No. 3. to a large 
congregation much as the [[spirit of God|Spirit of God]] rested upon 
me There is much of the [[blood of Ephraim|Blood of Ephraim]] among them

capable of judging of his views & feelings upon spirit
ual subjects he informed me that his mind was deeply 
engaged in the Subject called Mormonism at first 
he said but little upon the Subject but before 
his death he warmly contended for the principles 
& Defended the cause of the Latter Day Saints whereas
it was assailed. [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1814|Asahel]] (in one sens of the word) was not 
himself but another man During the last four months 
of his life he was vary absent minded & overwhelmed in 
Deep study & thought for hours together, at times he wo
uld ride half a day by the side of Mr [[Mr. Adams|Adams]] & not 
utter a word & at other times he would speak to him 
two or three times before he would notice him or 
speak to him he lost his former cheerfulness & during 
those four months he more freequently spoke of 
his friends & relatives than before esspecially myself 
& most of Fathr family he was making preperations 
to go east & was ownly hindered by his sickness & 
Death. he freequently spoke of Death & of the uncer
tainty of life he was teacher in the Sunday School 
of the Prysbeterian Church for a length of time in 
[[Terre Haute, Vigo County, Indiana|Terre Haute]] though not a member of the Church

{they know [[illegible]] [[it/that]] [our ancestor]} great interested in the preceding after meeting
two boat loads of us returned to Mr [[Benjamin Coombs|Benjamin
Coombs]] by water & while the Seamen were diping 
the ready oar Elder Hale joined me in singing the gallant 
ships &c. Spent the night at Mr Coombs distance 7 miles

Friday


29th Took the parting hand with the friends & walked
to Mr [[Joseph Carver|Joseph Carvers]] He carried us across in ^[retired to an usal place for prayer an a reall has a good time]^
a Sale boat to the North Island We spent the night
at Brother [[Cyrus Starrett|Sterretts]] distance of the day 10 miles

Saturday


30th We retired aside from the abodes of men and
clensed our feet in the pure water of the sea against 
[[Gideon J. Newton|Gideon J. Newton]] as a testimony against him for
rejecting our testimony & the [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]] &c
Spent the day in visiting the friends & the night at Brother
[[Justus Ames|Eames]] 5 miles

Sunday


Oct 1st Sunday preached at Brother [[Justus Ames|Justus Eames]]
Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] Baptized [[Martha A. Burgess Sylvester|one]] We organized a small 
Branch of the church to the number of twelve & par
took of the [[sacrament|Sacrament]] with them This was the first 
time we ever communed with the Saints or the Islands of the Sea We was blessed with a good 
time. We took the parting hand with the Saints 
as we were about to rleave the Islands to return 
our family's Spent the night at Brother Eames

by any means he had freequently argured against 
the principle of dancing schools but yet he attended 
a part of a quarter During this peculiar state of 
mind & also some parties but Mr Adams thought 
he would not have done it if he had been perfectly 
himself Mr Adams was absent from Terre Haute 
(During Asahels sickness & Death) selling Books 
for him. Asahel wrote him toowo letters & Mr Adams 
judging from the contents of the letters that Asahel 
was growing wors Immediately returned to Terre 
&Haute & on his arival found that Asahel one of 
his most intimate & best friends on Earth was 
Dead & buried he immediately inquired into his 
sickness & death & he thinks that he would have been 
more comfortable if he had been in a private family
& been kept from exposing himself to cold & damp 
air as he was in some Degree while under the opera
tion of medicine. Mr Adams also confirms the 
statement that his loss was deeply felt in the 
west by all of his acquaintance & that those peculiar 
traits which Asahel possessed that interested so man
ny in the East had the same affect in the West

Oct 2nd We took the parting hand with Brother 
Eames & family & went aboard of a sloop
to be conveyed to Thomaston on the mainland
that we might go on our journey to our friends
&c Capt Voluntine Eames may generously
offered to convey us alone in his sloop one excited
the immitative. The wind was against us, We reachd
shore at the setting of the sun took the parting had
with Capt Eames he promised to obey the gospel when
I returned. Spent the night in Thomaston with Mr
Morse distance of the day 36 miles

Tuesday


3rd Walked from [[Thomaston, Knox County, Maine|West Thomaston]] to [[Warren, Knox County, Maine|Warren]] 8 miles 
to [[Waldoboro, Lincoln County, Maine|Waldoboro]] 8. to [[Nobleboro, Lincoln County, Maine|Nobleboro]] 9. to [[Wiscasset, Lincoln County, Maine|Wiscasset]] 9. to 
[[Bath, Sagadahoc County, Maine|Bath]] 12 miles crossed at the steam ferry into Bath & 
spent the night at the house of [[William Swanton Crooker|Wm S. Crooker's]] {distance} 46 m

Wednesday


4th Spent the day in Bath & attended the [[Baptist|Baptist]] conven
tion & preached at Early candlelight to a large 
congregation of the Citizens of Bath in Pierces 
hall The people gave good attention & wished to hear ^further^

Thursday


5th walked to [[Brunswick, Cumberland County, Maine|Brunswick]] 10 viewed the colledges to [[Freeport, Cumberland County, Maine|free
-port]] 9. to [[North Yarmouth, Cumberland County, Maine|North Yarmouth]] 6. to [[Portland, Cumberland County, Maine|Portland]] 11. miles
Spent the Night in the City of Portland at Mr [[Samuel Hale|S Hale]] 36 miles

Friday


6th dined with [[Ezra Carter, b. 1804|Ezra Carter jr]] {my brother-in-law} then walked 
Hale tells from Olive
to [[Scarborough, Cumberland County, Maine|Scarborough]] whar I was again privileg'd of greet
my [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|wife]] & father Carter & his household Spent the
night with [them] distance of the day 10 miles

Saturday


Oct 7th Spent the day visiting the Saints in [[Saco, York County, Maine|Saco]] & spent 
the night at Father [[Ezra Carter, b. 1773|Carters]] distance 23 miles

Asahel maintained ^that^ the cause of the Latter 
Day Saints was worthy of a thurough investig
ation & ought to be carefully searched into. Mr 
Adams was in Asahels employ untill his death 
& at the Administrators sale he purchased
$1000 Dollars worth of his Books & is now 
supplying Asahels former customers. 
Mr Adams gave me some letters Directed from 
Asahel to him Distance of the Day 20 mi

Sunday
25th Sunday I was exeeding feeble & weak 
the weather was hot & it had an affect upon 
me the Thermoneter stood 90 in the shade 112 
in the sun I walked to the grave yard to visit 
Brother [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1814|Asahels]] grave, it exhausted me much
I spent the day at the Docters [FIGURE] I wrote two 
letters one to Sister [[Sarah Brackett Carter Foss|Sarah Foss]] & the other
to Sister [[Eunice Hart Woodruff Webster|Eunice]] I had a vary restless night

Monday

26th I rode out of [[Terre Haute, Vigo County, Indiana|Terre Haute]] 5 miles to 
Mr [[John Coltrin|John Coltrins]] & spent the night I felt 
some better in health 5 miles

I mailed [[John Taylor, b. 1808|John Taylor's]] pamphlets to 
the following persons

Sunday


Oct 8th Sunday rode in company with Elder 
[[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Hale]] from [[Scarborough, Cumberland County, Maine|Scarborough]] to [[South Berwick, York County, Maine|South Berwick]] Elder
Hale Preached at candlelight at Mr [[Moses Cooper|Moses 
Coopers]] I followed him We found Sister [[Sophia Cooper|Sophiah 
Cooper]] Strong in the faith of the Saints 33 miles

Monday


9th The time had now come for me to take the 
parting hand with Elder [[Jonathan Harriman Hale|Jonathan H Hale]]. We 
had travled together about 2000 miles during the
Season. I accompanied him about a mile on 
his journey. we retired to a grove & knelt down 
& prayd together & we had a good time & after com
-mending each other to God we took the parting 
hand {shorthand} he bent his way for [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]]. & while I return 
to the [[islands of the sea|Islands of the Sea]]. I preached at Mr [[Moses Cooper|Coopers]] 
in the evening & spent the night with him

Tuesday


10 took the parting hand with Mr [[Moses Cooper|Cooper]] & his hous
-hold & rode to [[Scarborough, Cumberland County, Maine|Scarborough]] & spent the night 
at Father [[Ezra Carter, b. 1773|Carters]] {with my [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|wife]]} Distance of the day 33 miles

Wednesday


11th Spent the day in writing at Father [[Ezra Carter, b. 1773|Carters]]

Maine [[Ezra Carter, b. 1773|Ezra Carter]], [[Ezra Carter, b. 1804|Ezra Carter jr]]
[[Sarah Brackett Carter Foss|Sarah Foss]], [[Luther Scammans|Luther Scammons]], 
Tennessee Col [[Solomon Copeland|Solomon Copeland]] 
& [[Seth Utley|Seth Utley]]. N Y. [[Azmon Woodruff, b. 1802|Azmon Woodruff]]

Tuesday


27th We rode through Williamstown & plesent- 
garden & other Towns & spent the night {distance of the day} 33

Wednesday


28th We passed through [[Stilesville, Hendricks County, Indiana|Stilesville]], [[Belleville, Hendricks County, Indiana|Bellville]], & [[Bridgeport, Marion County, Indiana|Bridge
port]] & spent the night with Mr Jesse Coombs a
vary generous {shorthand} man distance 31 miles

Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylor]] had a poor turn & fainted to the 
ground he soon recovered & was well at evening

Thursday


29th We passed through [[Indianapolis, Marion County, Indiana|Indianapolis]] the capitol of 
the State & rode two miles & stoped But this was
a gloomy day to my Soul & Body both The enemy 
made a powerful grasp upon the life of Elder
[[John Taylor, b. 1808|John Taylor]] he fainted several times & it 
seemed as though he would die consequently 
we were obliedged to stop. We called for a few hours 
in a house by the way side. we then took him into 
the waggon & drove to Eldridge Elder [[Horace Sunderlin Eldredge|Elder-
ridge]] & spent the day nursing Elder Taylor he 
took a course of Tomsonian medicine

Friday


Aug 30th Father [[John Coltrin|Coltrin]] exchanged horses 
with Elder [[Horace Sunderlin Eldredge|Eldridge]] Brother [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylor]] let 
brother Eldridge have 100 of his pamphlets 
& through the mercy of God Elder Taylor 
with the rest of us was enabled to 
continue our journey we passed through 
[[Cumberland, Hancock and Marion Counties, Indiana|Cumberland]], [[Greenfield, Hancock County, Indiana|Greenfield]], Kentstown, 
[[Middletown, Henry County, Indiana|Middletown]] & to [[Louisville, Henry County, Indiana|Louisville]] & once 
more had the privilege of once more
seeing the family of Elder [[James Townsend|James Tow
nsend]] Brother Townsend was not at 
home himself we spent the night with 
his family Elder Taylor & myself was 
both about sick for we had rode 40 miles 
over a rough road & we were terribly 
shaken in our weak state

Saturday


31st We still felt disposed to try to continue 
our journey we passed through [[Cambridge City, Wayne County, Indiana|Cambridge]] & 
[[Dublin, Wayne County, Indiana|Dublin]] at which place Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylor]] procured 
some medicine of Doct Farnham he was vary 
sick we continued to [[Germantown, Wayne County, Indiana|Germantown]] & was 
obliedged to stop & spend the day & night in

consequence of Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylors]] sickness he suffe
red much he appears now to have the billious 
fever & we fear settled upon him I felt 
quite Ill myself this was a Dark & gloomy 
Day may the Lord have mercy upon us & not
suffer our way to be hedged up I pray {distance of the day} 14 m

Sunday


Sept 1st 1839 This is the first Day of fall 
Sunday Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylor]] felt much better we 
concluded to spend the day in the place & 
preach to the people, it was a Germon settlement
I delivered unto them a discourse on the first 
principles of the gospel & other subjects Elder Taylor 
followed me & spoke untill he was quite exhausted 
not realizing his bodily weakness & I became 
chilled myself & returned to Mr [[Mr. Waltz|Waltz]] Inn & 
I immediately was taken with a shake of the 
ague & was followed by a high fever which 
lasted me mostly through the night

Monday


2nd This was a paneful day to my feelings in 
some respects Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylor]] is wors, has a high 
billious fever, & cannot journey it is now 
evident that he will have a course of the fever
Father [[John Coltrin|Coultrin]] is to continue his journey &

Elder Taylor must be left & it was painful 
to think of parting with him & leave him sick a 
thing that I should not do was I able to take 
care of him myself but as my health would 
not permit of this being vary feeble in body 
Elder Taylor advised me to continue my jou
rney with father Coltrin & make the best of 
my way to [[New York|New York]], & accordingly I did so
& after committing him to God I took the 
parting hand with him & left him in [[Germantown, Wayne County, Indiana|Germantown]] 
Wane County, Indiania, in the hands of 
a merciful God, & a kind & benevolent family
who promised to do every thing in their power to 
make him comfortable untill his recovery 
which I have full confidence to believe they will 
do. This place is within 12 miles of Elder [[James Townsend|J
Townsend]] in [[Louisville, Henry County, Indiana|Louisville]]. We rode from Mr 
[[Mr. Waltz|Waltz]] Inn to [[Richmond, Wayne County, Indiana|Richmond]] & out of the State 
of [[Indiana|Indiana]] into the State of [[Ohio|Ohio]] I passed through 
the ^town^ State of [[Eaton, Preble County, Ohio|Eaton]] whare my wife suffered much 
(as we journied west last winter) with the brain 
fever I noticed the house in particular

whare we spent four days in to whare [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Phebe]] 
was healed by the power of God & of faith. 
We passed through Eaton & spent the night at Mr 
[[David Heck|David Hecks]] Distance of the day 45 miles

Tuesday


Sept 3d I rode through [[Dayton, Montgomery County, Ohio|Dayton]] 14 miles to [[Springfield, Clark County, Ohio|Springfield]] 
24 miles to [[Brighton, Clark County, Ohio|Briton]] 13. & put up for the night at the 
Inn of Mr Buckharts I am again delivered 
from the ague & fever I have had none of it 
sin[c]e the Shake on Sunday Distance 46

Wednesday


4th We rode to [[Columbus, Franklin County, Ohio|Columbus]] the capitol of the 
State of Ohio here we left the National rode 
& continued to [[Blendon Township, Franklin County, Ohio|Blendon]] & spent the night 
at the Inn of [[Mr. Osborn|Osborn]] ^whare Mrs [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Woodruff]] was taken sick on Sunday^ Distance of the day 41.

Thursday


5th Passed th[r]ough [[Mount Vernon, Knox County, Ohio|Mt Vernon]] & spent the night 
at [[Monroe, Butler County, Ohio|Monroe]] distance of the day 41

Saturday


7th passed through [[Jackson, Jackson County, Ohio|Jackson]] & [[Guilford Township, Medina County, Ohio|Guilford]] & 
[[Brunswick, Medina County, Ohio|Brunswick]] & to [[Strongsville, Cuyahoga County, Ohio|Strongville]] in which here 
in resided father [[John Coltrin|Coltrins]] family of Sons &
daughters & their was much rejoiceing on 
their return which ends my journey with 
them as they are at [tone] spent the night with Brother ^[[P. Body|P Body]] 30m^

Sunday


Sept 8th 
I spent the day at Brother [[P. Body|P bodies]] I wrote 
a lengthy letter to [FIGURE] Brother [[Ozem Thompson Woodruff, b. 1804|Thompson Woodruff]] 
& requested him to write to me at [[New York|N.Y.]]

Monday


9th I spent the day at Father [[John Coltrin|Coltrins]] folding my 
pamphlets & I found on nurmerating them 
that I had 460 of Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylors]] pamphlets 
that I receieved from him spent the night with [[P. Body|P body]]

Tuesday


10th I left [[Strongsville, Cuyahoga County, Ohio|Stronsville]] & rode with father [[John Coltrin|Coltrins]] 
to [[Cleveland, Cuyahoga County, Ohio|Cleveland]] & went on board the Robert Fulton
bound for [[Buffalo, Erie County, New York|Buffaloo]] we had a severe gale & a vary rough 
lake most all were sick on board We run into 
fairport harbour & spent the night amid a hard storm 
I rode 17 miles by land & 30 by water the while distance 47

Wednesday


11th The storm continues & the lake foams with such 
violence that we could not move out of the harb
our with any safety it was a dul day to me while cro
wded in the midst of a company of deck passengers

Thursday


12th The captain left the harbour with his boat at 
6 oclock AM. the wind still was high & the lake rough thro
ugh the day we could not make any harbour untill 
we reached [[Buffalo, Erie County, New York|Buffalo]] which was at midnight the Steam-
boat run unto a schooner (before entering the harbour)

which tore the gangway fenders to atoms of the Fulton,
& instantly broke off the gibboom of the schooner; But 
I was truly glad to reach Buffalo after lying three days & 
nights from [[Cleveland, Cuyahoga County, Ohio|Cleveland]] to Buffalo $3.50 {distance of the day} 163 miles

Friday


13th I took passage at [[Buffalo, Erie County, New York|Buffaloo]] for [[Albany, Albany County, New York|Albay]] on board the Col 
Worth of the New York & Buffalo line on the [[Erie Canal, New York|Erie Canal]] at 
1 1/2 cts per mile for 365 miles viz from Buffalo to Albany 
We left Buffalo at 5 oclock AM & rode to [[Lockport, Niagara County, New York|Brockport]] distance 90

Saturday


14th Rode to [[Palmyra, Wayne County, New York|palmira]] near the place whare the book 
of Mormon was found I was sick with the chills 
& fever distance of the day 50m

Sunday


15th Rode to [[Canton, St. Lawrence County, New York|Canton]] We had 4 preachers of the 
day on board the boat they spoke of the Book 
of Mormon & misrepresented it & also the char
-acter of the Saints I had the chills & fever to 
day & was feble in body 56

Monday


16th Rode to [[Syracuse, Onondaga County, New York|Sarycuse]] & to [[Rome, Oneida County, New York|Rome]] & had the 
chills & fever to day 60m

Tuesday


17th Rode to [[Utica, Oneida County, New York|Utica]] & to [[Fort Plain, Montgomery County, New York|fort Plain]] had fever 53

Wednesday


18th Rode to the Acqueduct I had an exceding sick 
day of chills, fever, faintness, &c distance 58

Thursday


Sept 19th Rode to [[Albany, Albany County, New York|Albany]] mostly through 
locks I felt feble had the chills & fever I called 
at the Hartford & Albany stage house & took the
stage at 10 oclock in the evening & rode all night 
& untill 11 oclok next day & arived at Newmuch
borough 50 miles the whole distance 64m

Friday


20th rode to [[Avon, Hartford County, Connecticut|Avon]] & spent the night with Aunt
[[Helen Woodruff Wheeler|Wheeler]] I suffered much in the Stage with 
the fever & Ague Distance 40

Saturday


21st Rode from [[Avon, Hartford County, Connecticut|Avon]] to [[Farmington, Hartford County, Connecticut|Farmington]] Ct 
& once more had the happy privilege of behol
ding a [[Aphek Woodruff, b. 1778|father]], [[Azubah Hart Woodruff|Mother]], & [[Eunice Hart Woodruff Webster|Sister]], in the flesh 
face to face & spent the day at fathers 
house I had no chills nor fever to day 
but spent the day plesantly 6 mi

Sunday


22 Sunday spent the day at fathers house
in the evening I took a walk with Sister 
[[Eunice Hart Woodruff Webster|Eunice]] to Mr [[Chauncy Hill|Chauncy Hills]] he had lost 
his wife [[Mary Ann Hill|Mary Ann]] was much out of health
Monday to

Wednesday


23, 24, 25, I spent these days at [[Aphek Woodruff, b. 1778|fathers]] I was still qu
ite ill I had an interview on the 25 with Aunt 
[[Beulah Hart|Bulah H]]

Thursday


26th I rode with [[Beulah Thompson Woodruff, b. 1782|Mother]] & Aunt [[Beulah Hart|Bulah]] to 
Uncle [[Adna Thompson Hart|Adna Hart's]] & we found Adna sick 
& nigh unto death & probably will not live 
but few days. I here had an interview with
Sister [[Betsey Cossett Alvord|Cossett]] I felt quite ill while at Adnas 
we returned home & Sister Cossett accompanied
us. Brother [[Dwight Webster|Dwight Webster]] was at fathers house 
hed called to have an interview with me I
