was truly glad to see him he tarried about 
three Days & when he left he was more esstab
lished in the faith & determined to go forth 
& do his duty & honor the Priesthood which was 
confirmed upon him {distance of the day} 7
Friday to

Saturday


27, 28 I still continued at [[Aphek Woodruff, b. 1778|fathers]] house was 
quite Ill I took the parting hand with Bro^ther^ 
[[Dwight Webster|Webster]]

Sunday


29 Sunday spent the day at [[Aphek Woodruff, b. 1778|father's]] I had 
an interview in the evening with Brother 
[[Ozem Thompson Woodruff, b. 1804|Ozem Woodruff]]  I was truly glad to see 
him he was strong in the faith & determined to 
do the will of God & desireous to go to the Zion 
he was expecting to work for father several days

Monday


Sept 30th [FIGURE] I wrote a letter to [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Phebe]] I spent the 
day at [[Aphek Woodruff, b. 1778|fathers]] I have a light turn of the 
chills & fever dayly

Tuesday


Oct 1st I spent the day at [[Aphek Woodruff, b. 1778|fathers]] & wrote 
a letter to Elder [FIGURE] [[John Taylor, b. 1808|John Taylor]] & Mr 
[[Mr. Waltz|Waltz]] We had a number of friends in 
the evening called to see us ie cousin [[Betsey Cossett Alvord|Betsy 
Cossett]] [[Jennett Stedman|Jennet Stedman]], & among the number 
was Mr [[Chauncy Hill|Chauncy Hills]] {shorthand}

Wednesday


2d I [FIGURE] wrote a letter to [[Philo Vining|Philo Vining]] & one 
to Sister [[Hannah Day Hart Woodruff|Hannah Woodruff]] & spent the time 
at [[Aphek Woodruff, b. 1778|fathers]]

Thursday


3d I spent the day at [[Aphek Woodruff, b. 1778|Fathers]] I was blessed 
with the happy privilege of once more 
administering the ordinance of baptism 
to one of my friends. I repaired to the 
water about the Setting of the Sun acco
mpanied by a few friends & I administered 
the ordinance of Baptism to cousin 
[[Betsey Cossett Alvord|Betsey Cossett]] in [[Farmington River, Hartford County, Connecticut|Farmington River]]
in the same place whare father & his hou
sehold & other friends were Baptized the year before
Journal 1837

Friday


Oct 4th I spent the day at [[Aphek Woodruff, b. 1778|fathers]] 
house I walked in the evening to [[Jennett Stedman|Jennett 
Steadmans]] & spent several hours in conv
ersation. [[Chauncy Hill|Chancy Hills]] is some delirious 
& it is feared that he will not live long but few
days & it is some feard also that the storms 
of Adversity that are falling upon [[Mary Ann Hill|Mary Ann 
Hills]] will carry her to the grave soon, 
& while speaking of the afflicitons of others I 
will return to ourselves on the 27th day of Sept
my Grandmother [[Anna Hart Thompson, b. 1756|Anna Thompson]] wife of [[Lot Thompson, b. 1752|Lot Thoms^on^]]
departed this life. Aged 84 years

[UPSIDE DOWN TEXT]
Singular [[Mercy Thompson Andrus|Mercy Thompson]], [[Samuel Thompson, b. 1709|Samuel Thompson]], & [[Lot Thompson, b. 1752|Lot Thompson]] 
allot one family & [[Anna Hart Thompson, b. 1756|Anna Thompson]] all died at 84 years



Also on this 4th day of Oct Uncle Adna Hart 
died at 2 oclock PM. Aged 43 years
So our relatives go into Eternity one after
another & truly may all such admonitions
teach us to be ready for the coming of the Son
of Man

Saturday


5th 1839 I was called upon to attend the funeral 
sermons of Uncle [[Adna Thompson Hart|Adna Hart]] when I arived at
his house (accompanied by [[Beulah Thompson Woodruff, b. 1782|Mother]] & Sister [[Eunice Hart Woodruff Webster|Eunice]])
the Neighbours soon began to assemble &
I had an interview with many friends that I had not

seen before for a long time such as Sister 
[[Hannah Day Hart Woodruff|Hannah Woodruff]], Ezra Hart, [[Philo Vining|Philo Vining]], 
besides a large congregation of the Neigh
bours in the regions round about. Adna felt 
before his death that he had not lived as he ought f
or the last few years of his life, but yet before 
his death he felt to repent of all his sins & said 
& felt that he was perfectly willing to die & his friends 
felt a great evidence that it was well with him. 
After singing & prayer I addressed the congregation 
with such remarks as I thought the Subject
required & dissmissed the congregation &
I took the last look at the corps which was 
vary plesent & it was conveyed to the graveyard
to the graveyard & buryed from the Subject of
many friends & Neighbours. But I did not
attend myself. but after conversing a few
moments with Philo Vining upon the things
of the Kingdom of God & also learning Sister
[[Betsey Cossett Alvord|Betsey Cossett]] express her joy at having revievd
baptism for the remissions of her Sins I 
took the parting hand with those friends & returned 
with Mother & Sister E to [[Farmington, Hartford County, Connecticut|Farmington]] {shorthand} 8 mile

[BETWEEN LINES]
I thank the Lord for his goodness to me this day for delivering
me from the chills & fever for this is the first day I have missed of late

Sunday


Oct 6th Sunday spent the day at [[Aphek Woodruff, b. 1778|fathers]]. I had 
a plesent walk with Sister [[Eunice Hart Woodruff Webster|Eunice]] in viewing 
the rivers & fields of my youth &c.

Monday


7th I took the parting hand with [[Aphek Woodruff, b. 1778|father]], [[Beulah Thompson Woodruff, b. 1782|Mother]], & [[Eunice Hart Woodruff Webster|Sister]], 
& took the Stage to [[Hartford, Hartford County, Connecticut|Hartford]]. & went on board 
the Steamer Cleopatra for the city of [[New York City, New York County, New York|New York]] 
at 2 oclok P.M. & we arived at the City NY. at 6 ocl
ock next morning the whole distance of the day 170

Tuesday


8th I called at the Store of my Brother in Law
[[Ilus Fabyan Carter|Ilus Carter]] in Bleacker street 118 corner of woster 
from thence to Brother [[Richard Burdge|Richard Burdge]] 41 King street & 
to Br [[William Acker|William Acker]]. Charlton street No 65. I spent 
the day with Brother Burge I had an interview with 
Elder's [[Samuel Mulliner|Mullener]] & [[Alexander Wright|Wright]] I was glad to see 
them. 9th I visited Brother [[James Pratt|James Pratts]] family 
in wats streat 69. I also visited Elder [[Jacob W. Jenks|Jacob
W. Jenks]] the captain & owner of Sloop Sea
gul that plays continuely between [[New York|New York]] 
& [[Sing Sing, Westchester County, New York|singsing]]. Thus we begin to find the Saints
among the Slips &c. Elder Jinks informed me
that a letter had just arived from Jerrusalem to the
Jews in New York stateing that there is now stading
in Jerrusalem 1,44,000 of the Jews {shorthand} 3

Thursday


Oct 10th [FIGURE] I recieved a letter from Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|John 
Taylor]] I left the City of [[New York City, New York County, New York|N.Y.]] & took steam Boat 
Francisko for [[Sing Sing, Westchester County, New York|Singsing]], Sisters Cr [[Miriam Haight Wandell|Wandell]] & Sister
[[Lucy Buell Eager|Lucy Eager]] accompanied me to Singsing We dined at 
the Inn of Mr [[Thomas Eager|Thomas Eager]]. I had the chills 
& fever I had every attention paid me by
Sister Eager. I called upon Brother [[John Royce|John Royce]] 
& spent the night distance of the day 36 miles

Friday


11th I spent the day with Brother [[John Royce|Royce]] I 
had a hard turn of the chills & fever I was
with the Saints in prayer meeting at Br Royce
house Elder's Jacob Jenks, D Samuel Mu
llener I had a plesent interview with those Saints

Saturday


12th I visited Elder [[Jacob W. Jenks|Jenks]] at his Sloop & then 
walked up a hard hill (as [[Sing Sing, Westchester County, New York|Singsing]] is a vary hilly place) 
& visited Brother Washburn & brother Cox & 
spent the night with Br Washbrun (chills & fever)

Sunday


13th Sunday the Saints met at Br Washburn
I addressed them in the fore part of the day I
had the chills & fever in the afternoon but met 
with the Saints in the evening & broke bread 
unto them. My mind is much interested these days 
in the gathering of the Jews for they are now fast 
fulling the Scriptures by returning to [[Jerusalem|Jerrusalem]]

Monday


14th I walked down the Hill to Br [[John Royce|Royce]] & spent the day I again had the chills & fever my mind was 
unusually impressed this morning about my family I pray the Lord to support them in all their 
trials sickness or afflictions 1 m

Tuesday


15 I spent the day at Br [[John Royce|Royce]] in reading the church history of John Lawrence Mosheim D. D. I read all 
under the 4th century during the reign of Constantine & also the first part of 2nd century

Wednesday


16th I spent the day at Br [[John Royce|Royce]]. I missed my chills & fever

Thursday


17th I spent the day reading History I am improving in health I have not had chills for three days
Sister [[Sister John Royce|Royce]] has nourished me up much to my advantage

Friday


18th Spent the day at Br [[John Royce|Royce]]

Saturday


19th I took the Parting hand with the saints in singsing. I went on board the sloop seagul 
at 8 oclok & arived in [[New York|New York]] at 11, but 3 hours on the way they tore the sail against the bomb [boom]
of a ship. I had a plesant conversation with Capt [[Jacob W. Jenks|Jenks]] 36

Sunday


Oct 20th Sunday I met with the church in 
[[New York|New York]] & spoke in the fore part of the day 
I felt thankful for once more meeting wit 
the Church in the Cityagain  I met with them in the eve
ning I had a plesant interview with Elder 
[[Lucian Rose Foster|Foster]] he presides over the church

Monday


21st I called upon Br [[Ilus Fabyan Carter|Ilus Carter]] from 
thence I went to Sister [[Ellen Graham|Ellen Grahams]]
[FIGURE] I recieved a Letter from [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Phebe]]
in 88 Bowery Street 88 spent the night 351 Broom ^St^

Tuesday


22 I crossed the East River or Sound & Preached at 
night at the house of Elder Stones & spent 
the night at Brother Sniders

Wednesday


23d [FIGURE] I wrote a letter to [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Phebe]] & spent the
night with Br Foster 351 Broom Street

Thursday


24th I was feble in Body I spent the day at 
Sister [[Ellen Graham|Grahams]]!!!! To my great joy I have 
just herd that Elder [[Parley Parker Pratt|P P Pratt]] has arived in
this city to day with his family & a number 
of the Twelve are expecting to be here soo^n^

Friday


25th I had an interview with Br [[Parley Parker Pratt|P P Pratt]] 
& also with Brother [[Hiram Clark, b. 1795|Clark]] who arived in the 
city to day & also with other Brethren

Saturday


Oct 26 I spent the day at Sister Grahams 
[FIGURE] I wrote a letter to Sister [[Eunice Hart Woodruff Webster|Eunice]]. & in the 
evening I attempted to visit Brother [[Richard Burdge|Burge]] in King street 
41. I walked from Bowery to Broadway & took stage to 
stop at king st but the driver did not understand me 
& he left me a mile from Brother Burge & in 
walking to the place being weak in Body I was 
flung into a great perspiration & I took a severe 
& dangerous cold which setteled upon my lungs I 
spent the evening at Brother Burge Brother [[Parley Parker Pratt|Parley]] & 
a number of other Elders was presant

Sunday


27th Sunday I attended meeting at the Green
wich Academy in King Street 93. which is
the general place of meeting of the Saints. Elder 
[[Parley Parker Pratt|P. P. Pratt]] preached 3 discourses during day & eveni
-ng which was plain & interesting

Monday


28th I spent the day at Br McClains my cough 
is still severe. Three men called in the evening 
(one of which was lame) to have Elder [[Parley Parker Pratt|Pratt]] 
heal him that they might have a Sign in order 
to believe the work of God but a Sign they 
did not get I had an interview with Brother 
[[Selah Lane|Lane]] I spent the night at Brother [[John Albright|Albright]] ^94^ King

Tuesday


29th Oct I spent the day at Brother [[John Albright|Albright's]] I 
sent a package to [[Ilus Fabyan Carter|Ilus]] at his store By Brother [[Hiram Clark, b. 1795|Clark]] 
that was put into my hands by Brother [[Parley Parker Pratt|Parley]] from 
[[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Phebe]]. My cold is still severe but the fever & Ague 
appears to have left me

Wednesday


30 I walked to Elder [[Parley Parker Pratt|P P Pratts]] abiding place for
a season Charlton Street 109 in the rear from 
thence I walked to Brother MCClains in Spring Street
to [[Ilus Fabyan Carter|Ilus F Carters]] 118 Bleacker corner 
of woster from thence to Brother [[Richard Burdge|Burge]], King 41 
& made some arangements with thee Brethren that 
were to ship for [[England|England]] on the morrow viz Elder's 
[[Hiram Clark, b. 1795|Clark]], [[Alexander Wright|Wright]], & [[Samuel Mulliner|Mullener]]. & then to Brother
Albright's 94 King St & spent the remainder of the
day

Thursday


31st [FIGURE] I wrote a letter to Brother [[Luther Scammans|Luther Scam
mans]] & sister [[Sarah Brackett Carter Foss|Sarah Foss]]

Friday


NOV 1st I accompanied three Elders viz
Clark, Wright, & S. Mullener on board 
the packet Ship Tarolinta Capt Smith, bound for 
[[Liverpool, Lancashire, England|Liverpool]], they took Steerage passage & looked 
quite comfortable. After committing these [Decor] 
Saints unto God I took the parting hand with

them I was expecting to go with them but finally 
thought it wisdom to wait untill more of the 
quorum of the Twelve came so that we might 
hold a conference in [[New York|New York]] before we crossed
to England. May the Lord grant those brethren a safe 
passage I pray. I travled over the City much 
During the day Sister [[Mary Ann Frost Pratt|Pratt]] had a Sick day with 
the chills & fever his two children have it also

Saturday


2d [FIGURE] I wrote a letter to Brother [[Nathaniel Thomas|Nathaniel
Thomas]]. I copied a short extract from a paper 
as follows Moses Montifier's Brother in Law to Rothch^ild^ 
lately visited Egypt & made three proposals 
to the pacha of Egypt 1st to esstablish 
a bank in Egypt with a capitol of $10,000,000 
of dollars. 2d To purchase lands in Syria 
for the Jews. 3d To make the oath of the 
Jews admitable through Syria & palestine

Sunday


3d Sunday I met with the Saints Br [[Parley Parker Pratt|Pratt]] prea
ched fore & afternoon, the evening was spent in 
hearing from a Number of Elders Brother Benedict
was presant from Connecticut

Monday


4th I visited [[Ilus Fabyan Carter|Ilus]], [[Parley Parker Pratt|Parley]], & a number of 
other friends it is election to day

Tuesday


Nov 5th I left [[New York|N. Y.]] crossed the South ferry 
[[Brooklyn, Kings County, New York|Brooklin]] & took the rail car & passed thro
ugh Ganecee & on to [[Hempstead, Nassau County, New York|Hempsted]] at which 
place the car stoped I walked 2 miles to 
the toll gate kept by Brother [[Selah Lane|Selah Lane]]
I spent the night with Brother Lane. I 
had a fair view of the country during the 
days travel which was on [[Long Island, Queens County, New York|Long Island]] the 
surface of the earth is vary level some
resembling the Illinois prairies. We 
had a leary storm during the night {distance of the day} 23 miles

Wednesday


6 I spent the day at Brother [[Selah Lane|Lanes]]
I held a meeting in the School house in [[Hempstead, Nassau County, New York|South 
Hempsted]] & spent the night at [[Benjamin Reymond|Benjamin Reymons]]

Thursday


7th I spent the day at Brother [[James Whaley|James Whaley]]

Friday


8th I held a meeting in [[Hempstead, Nassau County, New York|Hempsted]] at the Inn 
of Mr [[John Ackley|John Ackley]] & returned to Br [[James Whaley|Whaley]] 6 m 
I saw [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Phebe]] in affliction {shorthand}? in a dream I did not see [[Sarah Emma Woodruff|Sarah Emma]]

Saturday


9th [FIGURE] I wrote a letter to Elder [[Milton Holmes|Milton Holmes]] 
& spent the day at Brother [[James Whaley|Whaley's]]

Sunday


10th Sunday I rode to [[Rockaway, Queens County, New York|Rockway]] & preached in the 
fore part of the day at Mrs D. Mott's & in the after
noon at the house of Lawrence Bond. & in the 
evening again at Mrs [[Mrs. D. Mott|D Motts]] 6 miles

Monday


Nov 11th I spent the day at Mrs [[Mrs. D. Mott|D. Motts]] & in the eve
ning I walked to Mr [[Jacob Brower|Jacob Brower's]] & spent the eve
ning a number of the family belonged to the chu
rch. I had a dream During the night I had an inter
view with [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Phebe]] but did not see [[Sarah Emma Woodruff|Sarah Emma]] I travled 
some distance with Judge [[Elias Higbee|Higby]] in a hard storm I 
also saw [[David Wyman Patten|David Patten]] {shorthand}
{shorthand}

Tuesday


12th I walked to Mrs [[Mrs. D. Mott|D. Mott]] & spent the day. Mrs D. Mott
is a Widow but a Lady of the most splendid talent
& extensive information She had lost 5 sons and
a kind husband & had herself been may times to the
gates of Death but was muracilesly spard as a stady
monument alone for some purpose she manifested
a gairest degree of interest in spread of the fullness of the
gospel {shorthand} As I returned this mor
ning Mrs Mott was morning the loss of a young lady
that died last night by the name of Elizabeth Smith
two years ago her married day was set but
on that day her companion Died by the name
James Piersalls & his Brother visited her & had
her marriage day again set & she died aged 18
I rode to [[Benjamin Reymond|Benj Reynons]] preach[ed] at his house 
& returned to Mrs D. Mott & spent the night 12

Wednesday


Nov 13th I took a walk this morning in the 
[[Rockaway, Queens County, New York|Rockway]] Burying ground & my mind was [bea]
to many Serious reflections this burnging
ground contains one certain grave eight rods
in legth in which was lade ^Also 30 found after the war^ 125 ^total 155^ bodies all
at the same time they lost their lives by being 
wrecked on Rockway beach by the Ship Mexico 
on the 1st day of January 18,37 And were intered on 
the 5th day. In viewing the Burying ground I also
say the grave of Mr David D. Mottjun which stone
bore the following lines. Sacred to the memory
of David D. Mott Jun who Died March 19 18,38 in the
60 year of his age [FIGURE] The memory of the Just is blessed [prov]
Ere the well my Dear & loving wife! Fare thee well my friends!
What gone forever! Seen no more, forever I thy loss deplore [FIGURE]
I spent the day at Widow [[Mrs. D. Mott|D. Motts]] The Lord is again 
restoring unto me my health for which I feel exee
ding thankful, praise the Lord O my Soul for all his
loving kindness unto the Sons of men. I had
the happy privilege of an interview with Elder 
[[Orson Pratt|Orson Pratt]] he spent the night with me

Thursday


14th We visited Mr [[Jacob Brower|Browers]] & preached at night 
at the house of Mrs [[Mrs. D. Mott|D. Mott]]

Friday


Nov 15th We preached at night Mrs [[Mrs. D. Mott|D. Motts]] to a 
large congregation many are believing
we spent the night at Mrs D. Mott

Saturday


16th I left Mrs [[Mrs. D. Mott|D. Motts]] at [[Rockaway, Queens County, New York|Rockway]] & walked 
with Brother [[Orson Pratt|Pratt]] to [[John Pettit|John Pettets]] from thence
we took a boat & had a sail to the main beach we
saw a wreck of a ship that was flung upon the Shore 
after returning Mr Pettets conveyed me to [[Greenwich Point, Greenwich, Fairfield County, Connecticut|Greenwich 
p[o]int]] & I spent the night Distance of the day 12m

Sunday


17th Sunday I preached three times at Mr [[Benjamin Reymond|Reymonds]] & 
rode to Mr [[John Ackley|John Ackley]] & spent the night I had 
an interview with Mr [[Edward Doughathy|Edward Doughathy]] 3m

Monday


18th rode to [[New York|New York]] with Mr [[John Ackley|Ackley]]. I spent the 
night or evening at Brother [[Orson Pratt|P. P. Pratts]] with a n
umbers of Elders [[Benjamin Winchester|Benjn Winchester]] among the 
number also a Gentleman from England a mem
ber of Joanna Southcoats Society &c I recieved 
a Letter from [[Eunice Hart Woodruff Webster|Eunice]] distance of the day 23

Tuesday


19th CONFERENCE in [[New York|New York]] I had an inter
view in the morning with Elders [[Samuel James|James]] & [[Albert Brown|Albert 
Brown]] I met in Conference with the Elders 
& Church according to appointment & after spending 
the day in transacting such business as was 
necessary {shorthand} I spent the night at [[John Albright|Albrights]]

Wednesday


Nov 20th I again sat in conference with my Brether
in the first part of the day but at 2 oclock Elder [[Orson Pratt|O Pratt]] 
& myself left the conference & in company with 
Elder [[Samuel James|James]] we took the steem boat Monmouth for 
[[Middletown Point, Monmouth County, New Jersey|Middletown]] at which place we travled being 30 m We 
then took the Stage & rode to [[Freehold Township, Monmouth County, New Jersey|Freehold]] 10 m & spent the 
night the distance of the day 40m

Thursday


21st We walked 8 miles & rode 8 to Brother [[James Ivins|James Ivins]] 
from thence to [[New Egypt, Ocean County, New Jersey|New Egypt]] 7 miles & stoped at Mr [[Thomas Harrison|Thomas 
Harrison's]] I preached in the school hous to a large con
gregation from Hosea 3:2 last virses I spent the night at 
the house of [[Abram Vintice|Abram Vintice]] {distance of the day} 23m

Friday


22 Elder [[Orson Pratt|Pratt]] & myself attended a Debate in the methodist 
meeting house between Mr Spear {a methodist preacher} and
Elder [[Samuel James|James]] it was the 5th day of the debate & it 
closed I rode 7 miles & spent the night with [[James Ivins|J. Ivins]] 7m

Saturday


23 I rode 3 miles & held a meeting in the cream 
ridge Brick Cchool house & also in the evening
Elder [[Orson Pratt|O. Pratt]] preached & I followed him I spent 
the night at the house of Mr [[James S. Lawrence|James S. Lawrence]] 
the whole household were believing {Lawrence and [[Daniel Tilton|Tilton]] were of the first class} 3m

Sunday


24th [FIGURE] Sunday I held meeting at the school house
I also wrote a letter to [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Phebe]] quite lengthy {shorthand} 
$1. {dollars in money} We had a severe storm I spent the night 
at the house of Mr [[George Woodward|George Woodward]]

Monday


25th [FIGURE] I wrote a letter a letter to Sister [[Eunice Hart Woodruff Webster|Eunice]] I preached 
at the Cream Ridge Brick School house at night & rode 
home with Brother [[James Ivins|James Ivins]] & spent the night with him ^4 m^

Tuesday


Nov 26 I Preached at the Brick School house & returned 
& spent the night with [[James Ivins|J Ivins]] 6 miles

Wednesday


27th I preached at the Brick School house & spent the 
night with Elder [[Samuel James|James]] at the house of Mr [[Daniel Tilton|Daniel Tilton]]
I had another attack of the chills & fever During the nig
ht it was brought on by being vary warm while preaching 
& immediately chilled afterwards 4 miles

Thursday


28th I spent the day at Mr [[Daniel Tilton|Tiltons]] & also the night & had 
a dream while upon my bed, & in my dream I saw [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Phebe]] my
wife & notwithstanding we rejoiced much at having an inter
view with each other yet our embraces were mixed with sorrow 
for after conversing with her awile about her domestic affairs 
I asked whare [[Sarah Emma Woodruff|Sarah Emma]] was (our ownly child) Phebe says (weeping {and kissing me}) she is dead. We sorrowed a moment & I awoke {shorthand}
{shorthand}

Friday


29th I spent the day & night with Brother [[John Woodward|John 
Woodward]] reading a Debate between a Un
iversalist & Prysbeterian

Saturday


30th in company with Elder [[Samuel James|James]] I held a 
meeting at Mr [[George Myres|George Myres]]

Sunday


Dec 1st Sunday I Preached at the brick school house
& communed with the Church & rode to [[Hornerstown, Monmouth County, New Jersey|Horners Town]] & Elder [[Samuel James|James]] Baptized two
I spent the night at Mr [[William Woodward|Wm Woodward]] ^5m^

Monday


Dec 2d I spent the day at Mr [[William Woodward|Woodwards]] I 
[FIGURE] wrote a letter to Sister [[Betsey Cossett Alvord|Betsey Cossett]] & 
spent the day & night in Hornerstown

Tuesday


3rd Stormy day I spent the day at Mr [[William Woodward|Wm S. Woodward]], walked 
to the school house at night through the mud {shorthand} I
spent the night at {shorthand} John Woodwards {distance of the day} 3m

Wednesday


4th Attended a meeting at the Brick School house Elder 
[[Parley Parker Pratt|P P Pratt]] preached to a large congregation I spent the 
night at Brother [[Samuel More|Samuel More's]] 2 miles

Thursday


5th [FIGURE] I wrote a letter to Elder [[John Herrett|John Herrett]] & walked 
to [[New Egypt, Ocean County, New Jersey|New Egypt]] & preached to a large congregation 
& spent the night with Mr [[Abraham Burtis|Abram Burtis]] 3

Friday


6th I walked to [[Hornerstown, Monmouth County, New Jersey|Hornerstown]] & spent the night 
with Brother [[James L. Curtis|James Curtis]] {distance of the day} 3m

Saturday


7th [FIGURE] I wrote a letter to Brother [[Dwight Webster|Dwight 
Webster]] I walked to the school house & attended
a proper meeting

Monday


9th I spent the day conversing with Doct [[Josiah Ells|Ells]] ^{shorthand}^

Tuesday


10 I spent the day in reading the Researches and Missionary 
labours among the Jews Mohamedans & other sects by the
Rev Joseph Wolff
During his travels between the years 1831 AND 1834 (it is interesting

Wednesday


Dec 11th I took the parting hand with Elder 
[[Samuel James|James]] & {shorthand} [[James Ivins|James Ivins]] & left at one 
oclock A.M. & rode 16 miles to [[Freehold Township, Monmouth County, New Jersey|Freehold]] I there 
took the stage & rode to [[Middletown Point, Monmouth County, New Jersey|Middletown point]] 12 miles & then
took steem boat wave to Middletown point
12 miles & ther the Steem Boat ware to 
New York. I called upon Elder [[Parley Parker Pratt|Parley P. 
Pratt]] in Mott street No 58 whare I had an inte
rview with him & also Elder [[Joseph T. Ball|Ball]]. I then wal
ked to the Post Office whare I obtained three
letters two for myself & one for Elder
[[Orson Pratt|O. Pratt]] from his [[Sarah Marinda Bates Pratt|wife]] Sister Pratt stated 
[FIGURE] that my [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|wife]] & [[Sarah Emma Woodruff|child]] were both get
ting better. One letter was from Sister [[Eunice Hart Woodruff Webster|Eunice]] 
Dated Dec 7rt {shorthand} The other letter was 
from Elder [[Milton Holmes|M. Holmes]] Nov 17th I found the streets 
of [[New York|Newyork]] full of Soldiers preparing to go 
to the [[Albany, Albany County, New York|Albany]] war to fight some of the cit
izens of their own State, thus wars & rumours of 
wars are heard. I attended meeting in the evening 
in Grand Street in the Columbian Hall, (rent $9 dollars
per Day) & herd a lecture from Elder [[Parley Parker Pratt|P. P. Pratt]] 
on the authenticity of the Book of Mormon & 
the origin of the American Indians (distance {of the day} 58

Thursday


Dec 12 I mailed papers to Father [[Aphek Woodruff, b. 1778|Woodruff]], Father 
[[Ezra Carter, b. 1773|Carter]], & ^2^ my [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Wife]]. I attended a conference in 
Mott strt 58 at P. P. Pratt on the case of Elder 
[[Joseph T. Ball|Joseph Ball]] & as a number of accusations were 
brout against him & spent the night at Brother 
[[Brother Symon|Symons]]. I had an interview with [[Ilus Fabyan Carter|Ilus Carter]] 4.

Friday


13th [2 FIGURES] I wrote a letter to [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Phebe]] & marked
it ({shorthand}) Elder [[Theodore Turley|Turley]] 
also wrote to his [[Frances Kimberley Turley|wife]] I again met in confer
ence at 7 oclok at Elder [[Orson Pratt|Pratts]] in 58 Mott street
We had an interesting time in our conference 
I spent the night with Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylor]] at Brother 
[[Brother Symon|Symons]] 3 mile

Saturday


14th [FIGURE] I wrote a Letter to Sister [[Eunice Hart Woodruff Webster|Eunice]]
& answered an important question Walked 
to Brother [[John Albright|Albrights]] & spent the night however 
before retiring to rest I walked about 1 1/2 miles into
Cedar Street in order to view {for the first time in my life)
a city fire, the fire was great it commenced in 45 cedar
street & consumed it with all its contents & also 49th 
both of which were large buildings filled with 
cotten & dry Goods the loss estimated at $300,000 dollars 
it was rainy, I left the fire raging at 12 at night & retired to rest ^5 miles^

Sunday


Dec 15th Sunday I met with the Saints in the Columbian Hall 
No 263 Grand street & preached in the fore part of the day & 
Elder [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylor]] preached in the afternoon Elder [[Parley Parker Pratt|Pratt]]
preached in the evening I spent ^the night^ with Elder Taylor at 
Brother [[Nathaniel Holmes|Holmes]] 3 miles

Monday


16th [FIGURE] I went on Board the Oxford a packet ship
& engaged my passage to [[Liverpool, Lancashire, England|Liverpool]] on the 19th inst 
I also [FIGURE] wrote a letter to [[Ezra Carter, b. 1773|Father]] & [[Sarah Fabyan Carter|Mother Carter]]
I spent the evening in making preperation for 
our departure {distance of the day} 6 miles

Tuesday


17th [FIGURE] I wrote a letter to [[Phebe Whittemore Carter Woodruff|Phebe]] containing a 
short address to [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Brother]] & [[Margaret Thompson McMeans Adkins Smoot|Sister Smoot]] I attended 
meeting at night at the house of Brother [[Henry William Naisbitt|Nizbot]] 
in Houston Street. we had a Spiritual meeting
[[Parley Parker Pratt|P P Pratt]] prophesied that the history of the [otrlads]
that the twelve in filling this  mission [streat] 
he knowen to all nations. I spent the night 
at Brother [[Brother Simon|Simons]]. We went on board the
packet Ship Oxford & second our passes
for Liverpool as it ward sail on the 19th

Wednesday


18 I laboured hard all day to prepare for 
our sailing voyage three of us [carred on]

Oct Dec
baggage on board viz Elders [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylor]] [[Theodore Turley|Turly]], 
& myself, Elders Turley & myself slept on 
board

Thursday


19 The Ship moved out into the stream & [order]
& the day was spent amid the greatest conf
usion bustle & fuss that ever I witne
ssed for they had taken on board many 
more passengers than births to lodge in 
& the cabin was store full of chests & 
Boxes, trunks, barrels, & beds &c & many 
quarrelling for what they called their rights

Friday


20th Bustle & confusion [be merces] 
the ship is still at anchor. at 12 oclok she spre
ad her canvass & set sail assisted a few miles by 
a Steem Boat She Sailed well through the night
^[FIGURE] With 64 passengers in the steerage while 40 was her lawful number
she had 15 cabin passengers Also Capt [[John Rathbone|John Rathbone]], 1st Mate 
Yates, 2d mate Jones, one carpenter & 26 sailors making 109 souls 
in all. Fare for steerage $15, for cabin fare $140 including wines 
$120 without^

Saturday


21st A Stiff breeze & fair wind but most all on 
board are sea sick. We see a Sail south of us
She left [[New York|New York]] at the Time we did She is bound 
for [[London, Middlesex, England|London]]

Sunday


22d Sunday most are still sick a high wind through 
the day, & a high gale at night the boat reeled & 
pitched Badly

Monday


Oct ^Dec^ 23d Sea vary rough & winds high many 
still are sick our cabin is crouded & unhole^some^

Tuesday


24th The Sea runs mountains high & look 
like the Hills & valies of [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]]. While pitch
ing from the top of the mountains were into the 
troath of the Sea she would ship water I got 
wet, yet I sat upon deck untill late in the 
evening but though it was winter it was 
not vary cold

Wednesday


25th A calm in the morning but the Ship rocked 
bad upon the dead swells the wind soon rose 
& we Sailed fast through the day & night

Thursday


26 A rough sea & strong breeze we sailed fast

Friday


27th Fair winds Sail fast a number of short squalls
we had got over our sea sickness & have good appetites

Saturday


28th A vary rough Sea most of the day. We saw a large 
school of porposes & Blackfish all around the Ship. 
We had a calm in the evening

Sunday


29th Sunday a plesant morning ^thugh the day^ & a light Breeze

Monday


30 A rough Sea a severe gale at night, the Ship rocked 
& pitched to Such a degree it was with difficulty 
that we kept our births while at the same time trunks 
Boxes, & barrels were tumbling about the cabin this with
the noise of the officers & Sailors reefing & leting a Sail
with the help of the wind amond the [right] made much confusion

Tuesday


31st sea still vary rough sails under closs Reef clou^dy^ 
weather this is the last day of 1839 their is not much 
to interest the mind while taking a voyage at sea
excepting the rolling Billows which are majestic for one
is freequently many Days without the sight of Land, or Sun,
or open a Sail at sea & must be crouded together with
many passengers in a cabin like logs or stay upon
Deck in the spray wind or stern &c.

Wednesday


JAN 1st 1840. so time rolls along
vary rough Sea, high winds, Blustering & cloudy

Thursday


2d The Sun rose clear it being the first time we 
have seen it for five days, We had a calm. We saw
a vessel for the first time since we left [[New York|N.Y.]] it 
was stern of us, Elders [[John Taylor, b. 1808|Taylor]], [[Theodore Turley|Turley]], & myself 
sat down on the anchor & had a cruck of Buter^nuts^

Friday


3d A good day fair Sailing a fair ^ go[o]d breeze.
We were in full view of two Sail one fore & the 
aft of us, ee soon overtook the one before us &
spoke to her, as we past her at a rapid rate as we
were again about 10 or 12 [k]not an hour. The Oxford first
raise the union colors ie British & Americas & she raisd
the British Colors we then raised the American Colors in
the Oxford & made out our Longitude & presentd it to her

which was 34.40, We dounf her to be a British Brigg
Sailed from [[Halifax, County of Halifax, Nova Scotia, British North America|Halifax]] 20 days at Sea Bound for 
[[Liverpool, Lancashire, England|Liverpool]] She made out her Long to be 33.30 noting
one [Decpel] 8,10 miles difference from the

Saturday


4th Fair weather, Wind right aft & a stiff Breeze we
sailed fast, They butcher hogs & sheep on board

Sunday


5th Sunday rough Sea, High winds & rain in the morn
ing, Sea & winds more calm at noon. We saw a large 
school of porposes, a calm & plesent evening which we 
spent on Deck viewing the stars & ocean

Monday


6th A plesent morning & a calm, but having 12
sails spred we travled about 3 miles an hour

Tuesday


7th We have a dead calm to Day in Long 17.40 
We spoke a Scottish Bark named Georgeana from [[Leith, Edinburghshire, Scotland|Leith
Scotland]], bound for Granada a west India Island, this her 7th day 
at Sea her Long 17,40. A number of Birds Such as Sea
guls ^were flying around our Ship^ the passengers shot several of them & they fell dead 
into the water. We saw a large School of porposes and 
Black Fish some of the Blackfish were supposed
to be 20 feet in length they would roll on top of water 
all around the

Wednesday


8thA go[o]d stiff breeze arose about 1 oclok A.M. & 
we sailed well through the day. A lighted tar Barrel 
was set afloat from the Ship at night which appeard ^brilliant at See^

Thursday


Jan 9th Cloudy & Cold, Smooth Sea & fair breeze
it grows Coldier as we draw nearer to land
We are about entering the St George channel or
the mouth of it & of course we are not far from
land. !! Ho!! Ho the cry of land, land is herd from mast 
head, We rushed on to the fore castle & after strain
ing our eyes to look a few moments we got sight 
of it. It was the [[Ireland|Irish]] coast laying three points to our lee bow 
this is the first land we have seen for 20 Days or in other words
we have been 20 Days out of sight of land. At 8 oclock P.M. the
revolving lamp at the lighthouse at cape clear came in full view
The whole company of passengers were much disturbed 
at night by the quarrelling of several wicked women

Friday


10th The mountains of the [[Ireland|Irish]] Coast are in full view 
& Also 6 or 7 Sail, The weather is cloudy & rather cool 
we have a good wind & sail fast We have a plesant 
evening we walked the decks untill 9 oclok & view^ing^ 
the light houses &c.

Saturday


11th We have a heavy gale commencd about 1 oclok 
in the morning & we were in danger having 
the [[Wales|Welch]] coast on one side & the [[Ireland|Irish]] on the 
other their was a great bustle on board & noise 
on board from the Captain mates & Sailors 
& wind & [wens] alltogether, they reachd the pilot
pilot

ground at daylight & raised colors for a pilate a
pilate boat soon appeared & came along side 
& gave us a pilote & he informed us that the 
Steem Ship Liverpool had not yet arived & their
was a tremendous Slant from one end to the
other of the Oxford for the Liverpool startd 5 fays 
before the Oxford & the Oxford had beat her & the
Independance [ament] arivd yesterday & she left
[[New York|New York]] 10 days before us, but the pilate had no 
sooner got on board than the Steem Ship Liverp^ool^ 
hove in sight over our stern the pilate ordered 
the sails to be spread notwithstanding it was blow
a gale as soon as the [canyads] wis spread
we gained of the Liverpool & their was many Sail
upon our right & Left hand their was much 
bustle among the passengers in shaving, washing & 
preparing to go on shore &c. [[Liverpool, Lancashire, England|Liverpool]] soon was 
in sight & we reachd the Liverpool deck a few minutes
before the Steem Ship Liverpool & also the packet ship
Independance the term of 30 minutes We went into
the City & visited Several Noted places such as Liverp^ool^
^[FIGURE] I wrote 3 Letters one to Phebe one to P. P. Pratt on to I Carter^
New Market costom House, Lord Nelsons Monume^nt^ 
&c. we spent the night in Clarks Street of the [bermi
ny ten carves]

Sunday


Jan 12 ^Sunday^ We took Breekfest {shorthand} it is true we eut & usd
used a peace of Bread for a plate & our fingers for knives 
& forks & charged high for it at that. I attended Church
at St. Pauls Church & St Thomas Church I also
attended meeting in Pitt Street Methodist Chapel. I spent
the night at [[M. Seymour|M Seymour]] no 7 in Rotunda Place
Waterloo Road. Distance from New York to Liverpool 3,500 miles
13th This day was attended with great confusion as the
contents of our trunks had to go through the hands of
the custem House Offices which was attended with
expertise & tramble after going through this bustle
We took the cars to Preston {shorthand} where to our
great joy we greard Elder Willard Richards & other
Saints We spent the night with Eldr Richards
distance of the day 32 miles
I am now In the field preperd to go about
my Masters business I [priy] God to ann me
for the Battle & give me the spirit of my mis
sion the procedings of my travels in the minis
try in England I shall record in another Book
from this time forth

[UPSIDE DOWN]
me that he was serious in
telling me After I was on
the Boat and could not get off
that he should not be respon-
-sible for the result of the
cruise and that I must catch
the Landing at a Jump
Fortunately however I was saved 
from total loss by almost a mira-
-cle of good luck. Asahel's Journal

[UPSIDE DOWN]
and Allen Playing cards
Mrs Dole presuming I was
hunting fun and not the bed
gave me leave ^to^ be at home so
I got into business once more
Played Batchelor with them
untill 10
Jan 12th
The Ferry Man at Clinton took 
especial care to impress me
with the fact that he was happy
to treat strangers and particularly
those who were civil with every
variety of impolitness. If I had
been a Dog I could have yelped
or a Hod I could have grunted
as it was I bit my lips and 
attended to my Horses and
Carriage which were in
imminent danger from his
seeming determination to convince

[UPSIDE DOWN]
he lacks confidence and holds
his tongue.
This is one of the comforts in
partnerships.

I left Town in time to drive
to Doles where I put for the
night. On the way I stopped
to warm at Peeks and receieved
some very wholesome advice
to get be nighted somewhere
near Lyons for an excuse to
spend the night in company
with Miss Lyon his daughter
This was ingenious but as I could
not discover the propriety I rejected
the idea.
Early in the evening in attempting
to go to bed I got into the Kitchen
where were Mrs Noble Miss
Harriett Dole Mr Newman

[UPSIDE DOWN]
Jan 11th This morning find
Smith unsociable I left the Store
last night unlocked expecting his
return soon as he had gone
out while I was preparing to
go visiting. And did not mention
that he would be absent through
the evening. I left when I got
ready. He was in bed when
I returned and arose to let
me in chiding me for not telling
him that I was going away
Doubtless his mood to day originated
in this insident. he probably
either blames me for not telling
him that I was going out at the
same time that I had not been
in the store an hour during the
day or he thinks I blame
him for leaving without in time
acting is to me and hence

[UPSIDE DOWN]
Mr Mullen, an acquaintance was
kind enough to favor me with an
introduction to his sister to Miss
Lyon and to Miss McKinsley, by
which good fortune I was enabled 
to pass the night pleasantly
I returned to Town in the morning
highly gratified with an entertainment
which had cost me so little emb-
-arrasment and left me this side
up.
The evening of Jan 10th I spent
at Mrs Coles. Misses Catharine 
and Dorothea entertaining with
all possible good will. We told
each others fortunes. Played cards
talked sentiment, a little sense and
more nonsense concluded we liked
each other pretty well and
should be glad to see each other
now and then and quit.

[UPSIDE DOWN]
of hearts for sighs, or rather
more likely of sighs for hearts
And I am quite sure that one
sweet kiss from one of the fairest
of damsels went forth begging
sympathy where it should not,
I did not choose to dance
but one of my companions (it 
was William) that to trip the
fantastic toe with a Young Belle
of a neighboring Town and
accordingly we find our Young
Hero at a suitable time bowing
most obsequiously before the fair
one and with breast swelling 
high in Expectation we behold
him extending his arm with the
modest request that Miss would
dance with him. No-I thank
ye I jest has been dancing!!

[UPSIDE DOWN]
Friday ensuing the first of Jan. 7
I went up to Doles. in company
with Horace Blinn, William
Warren and Smith to attend
a Ball in honor of the Glorious
Eighth. The company was large
and quite miscellaneous The 
object appeared to be. The great-
-est possible quantity of Amusement
estimated by the greatest gross
amount of dancing squeezed out
of the occasion, and it was
attained, for during the Twelve
hours I remained there. There 
was no cessation of hop skip
and jump excepting the hour
allotted to supper.
No hearts I believe were lost though
there was a good deal of flow of
soul. There might indeed have
been some exchanged made-

[UPSIDE DOWN]
In the course of the ensuing week
I changed my place of boarding to
the Table of my friend Mr Irish
I was induced to do so partly on accord
of my conveniencce, but mainly because
I was pleased with the dociety of the
family. My Irish did not wish
boarders but took me out of regard
for my wishes And perhaps be-
cause he did not choose to deny my
request He said "there seems to 
be a perfect understanding between
you and Mrs Irish" And I accepted 
of his a place at his Table because
I had then pressed the matter
to far to recede. I have since
regretting this step for I fancy
that I am considered as acting
upon the principle that "It is
useless to have a friend unless we
use him."

[UPSIDE DOWN]
Jan 1 1837
New Year happened on Sunday
F. M. Irish came the the Store
and proposed going to Church with
me And to this singular circumstance
was added another, still more surprising,
in the fact that Mr Smith my
partner offered to join us! And we
all went to the Court House and
heard Elder Bennett from N.Y.
but Alas poor Smith! he was
so stricken in conscience for his
presumption that he found no peace
untill he made atonement at the
Dutchmans Coffe House.

I passed the evening at the house 
of Mrs Coles mostly in the company 
of Catharine & Dorothea.

Containing an account of my travels in the
Ministry as a member of the Church of
Latter day Saints, of
18.35 & 1836.

On the night of the last day of Dec & of the year of our Lord 1835 
I Perused my Journals & found it to contain the following account of my 
travels & procedings in the year of our Lord 1835 commencing the 13th
of January 1835 making one year 12 days excepted


Travled three thousand two hundred & forty eight miles 3248 miles 
divided in the following manner From the 13th of Jan to the 28th of June travled 1808 m
While holding the office of A Priest 212 miles in [[Missouri|Missouri]] with Elder [[Henry Brown|H Brown]] 212


656 miles in the [[Arkansas Territory|Arkansas Territory]] 608 with Elder Brown & 48 Alone 656 miles


940. miles in [[Tennessee|Tennessee]] 760 miles with Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Warren Parrish]] 180 Alone 940 m


Travled from the 28th of June to the 31st of Dec after holding the office of An Elder 
in the States of [[Kentucky|KY]] & Tenn principly alone 1440

 1440 miles
The sum total 3248 miles


I held one hundred & seventy meetings divided in the following manner 170 meetings 
While a Priest 10 with Elder Brown 56 with Elder Parrish & 4 Alone 70
And 100 after holding the office of an Elder. Principly alone 100

 
3 I Baptized forty three 8 While A Priest & 35 While an Elder 3 Were [[Campbellite|Campbellite]] Speakers 43 baptised


And was A Partner with Elder Brown in Baptizing 2 in the Arkansas
And A Partner with Elder Parish in Baptizing 18 Persons In Tenn & KY


4 I Procured twenty subscribers for [[Latter Day Saints|M[essenger] & Ad[vocate] ]] While an Elder & 4 while A Priest 24 
& 2 subscribers for the Star 2

I Procured seventy three signers to the [[petition|Petition]] to the Governor of [[Missouri|Missouri]] 73
for [[redress of wrongs|redress of wrongs]] done the Church by the [[Jackson County, Missouri|Jackson Co]] mob
10 in Missouri 56 in [[Arkansas Territory|Arkansas]] & 7 in [[Tennessee|Tenn']] While A Priest


I wrote eighteen Letters 8 while A Priest 10 while an Elder & receieved 10. 18 L[etters]


I ordained two Teachers and one [[Deacon|deacon]] 3 ordained


I [[expelled|expeled]] Seven members from the Church but not While hope remained 7 Expeled


I held three debates or save answers When Publicly opposed 3 debates


Three companies in the form of mobs gathered together against me at one time 
the company consisted of about fifty men led by a [[Baptist|Baptist]] Priest. 3 mobs


The before mentioned is the account of my procee^d^bings in the year of 1835 which has 
bourn its report to heaven of me and all other men & could it not have bourn more 
Welcome news. Ah it cannot be recalled the Sable shades of night have allready 
spake the departure of 1835 And the Queen of the night is issueing forth her
brilliant light to wellcome the Dawn of 1836 which approaches us in a calm to go 
out in a storm. O momentious and important year which will hurl thy millions 
to the tomb & shake Kingdoms & bespeak a God in Israel. O God enable my 
heart & hands to be clean for A year to come. When God speaks who can but [[prophesy|Prophesy]]


Elder Willford Woodruff
W. Woodruff Day Book
Wilford Woodruffs Journal for 1836

Friday


Jan 1st 1836 Friday Spent the day at Brother [[Levi Taylor|Levi Taylors]] [[Blood River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Bloody]] KY.

Saturday


2 Wrote A Letter to Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|W Parrish]] containing 200 lines in answer to his 
Dated Nov. 29th 1835 Which I receieved on the 1st of Jan 1836

Sunday


3 Preached on the Lords Day at [[Joseph Chumbley|Joseph Chumbleys]] returned to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]]
and spent thee week studying Kirkhams English [[grammar|Grammer]]

Sunday


10 Sunday met with the Saints at Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumbleys]] & returned to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] 
And spent the week studying

Saturday


16 Saturday Rode to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] distance 10 miles

Sunday


17 Sunday Preached at the Academy after [[Parson Pott|Parson Potts]] returned to [[Solomon Copeland|Col]] 4m

Monday


18 Rode to Mr [[William Ross|Roes]] Preached at his house at 12 oclock then rode to [[George Washington Brandon|George W
Brandons]] Preached at his house at night procured 1 subscriber for [[Latter Day Saints|M[essenger]. A[dvocate].]] 16m

Tuesday


19 Rode to & crossed the mouth of [[Big Sandy River, Henry County, Tennessee|Sandy]] at Authors ferry to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] 24

Wednesday


20 Rode to Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumbleys]] 1 mile

Thursday


21 Rode to [[James Hendricks|James Hendricks]] from thence to Brother Clapps [[Terrapin Creek, Calloway and Graves Counties, Kentucky|Taropen]] 30 miles

Friday


22 Rode to Father [[Joseph Greenwood|Greenwoods]] Preached at his house then rode to Br [[John Camp|Camps]] 7 miles

Saturday


23 Jan Preached at Br [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapps]] & [[priesthood blessing|blessed]] 10 children in the name of Jesus Christ then rode 
to [[Clarks River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Clarks river]] distance 12 miles then & collected $7.00 dollars for the [[house of the Lord|house of God]] at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]]

Sunday


24 Preached at Br [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Thomases]] Sunday & blessed 6 children after I
closed meeting A [[Baptist|Baptist]] Priest [[William Willson|William Willson]] arose and invited us to attend
a meeting of theirs & cleer ourselves of things which they had alledged against us
I answered him before the People & remarked that I was surprised to see them 
take the Liberty of the Country into their own hands to try American Citizens by

Monday


25 Rode to [[James Martin|James Martins]] Preached at his house also at night distance 12

Tuesday


26 Rode to Br [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Thomas'es]] Preached at his house 12 miles

Wednesday


27 Rode to [[Stephen Brady|Stephen Braidy's]] distance 24 miles

Thursday


28 Preached at [[Stephen Brady|Stephen Braidy's]] the rode to Mr [[John Freeman|Freemans]] distance 14 miles

Friday


29 Preached at [[John Rowlett|John Rowlett's]] [[priesthood blessing|Blessed]] 3 Children & rode to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] 5 miles

Saturday


30 Rode to Br [[Samuel Smith|Smith]] Preached at his house rode to Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumbley's]] distance 3 mile

Sunday


31 Sunday Preached at Brother [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]]

Monday


Feb 1st Rode to Br [[Brother Davis, Tennessee|Davis'es]] 10 miles collected $5.00 dollars for building the [[house of the Lord|house of God]]

Tuesday


2 Rode to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] 10 miles & receieved A letter from President [[John Whitmer|Whitmer]]

Wednesday


3 Rode to [[David Cranshaw|David Cranshaws]] 14 miles

Thursday


4 Rode to [[John Jackson|J Jacksons]] Preached at his house distans 14 miles

Friday


5 Rode to [[Lewis Barker|L Barkers]] Preached at his house from thence to Mr [[Anthony M. Tittle|Tittles]] 
Preached at his house distance 10 miles

Saturday


6 Rode to Br [[Joseph Fry|Frey's]] Procured 1. subscriber for M & Ad 10 miles

Sunday


7 Sunday Preached at Br [[Joseph Fry|Frey's]]

Monday


8 Feb Rode to Mr [[Irvin Jordan|Jordan]] Preached at house distans 12 miles

Tuesday


9 Rode to Mr [[Asa Dodds|Dodds]] Preached at his house after closing meeting [[Parson Cure|Parson 
Cure]] arose & red A letter from A mob man in [[Jackson County, Missouri|Jackson]] opposing the Latter 
Day Saints I answered him & the Scene closed by Sisters [[Lucy Ann Fry Angell|Lucy Ann]] & [[Susanna Catherine Fry Matlock|Susannah 
K Fry]] singing the Sectarian Cudgel then rode to Father [[Joseph Fry|Fry's]] 15 miles

Wednesday


10 Rode to Sister [[Polly Barnett Jennings|Barnetts]] after spending the day in coppying my Journal 3 miles

Thursday


11 Rode to Br [[Joseph Fry|Fry's]] Spent the day in writing 3 miles

Friday


12 Spent the day in coppying my Journal & Rode to Sister [[Mary Barnett Matlock Barnett|Matlock]] 2 miles

Saturday


13 Rode to Brother [[Joseph Fry|Fry's]] 2 miles & there found Elder [[Elias F. Wells|Elias F. Wells]] & Elder [[Daniel Cathcart|Daniel
Cathcart]] who had returned with him in order to attend the Conference with us at [[Kentucky|KY]] 
& it was a Plasing interview to us all 3m

Sunday


14 Sunday Rode to Br [[John Walker, Tennessee|Walkers]]. Preached at his house then travled to Sister [[Polly Barnett Jennings|Barnet's]]

Monday


15 Spent the day at Sister [[Mary Barnett Matlock Barnett|Matlock's]] to attend the sale of her Property after the ^5 miles^
Death of Deacon [[Caswell Matlock|Caswell Matlock]] Who died Dec 24th Aged 27 Years I solicited Contributions 
through the day for the building of the [[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]] at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] Ohio & 
Procured $15.50 cts from the Honourable men & Saints to be applyed to that purpose 
then rode to Br [[Cade A. Crawley|C A Crawley]] distance 10 miles
Also collected $9.50 cts for Building the house of the Lord & contributed $6.00 dollars myself for the same purpose

Tuesday


16 Rode to Brother [[Albert Petty|Petty's]] Preached at his house. 10 miles & Wrote A Letter 
to [[John Whitmer|John Whitmer]] & [[Jared Carter|Jared Carter]] & sent them two subscribers for [[Latter Day Saints|M[essenger] & Ad[vocate].]]
& 8 [[baptized|baptised]] since Dec 1st 1835 & sent them in the Letter $40.00 dollars & an 
account of $5.00 dollars that I sent in [[Seth Utley|Seth Utley's]] Letter. $45.00 dollars the whole 
$6.0 dollars was for papers & $39.00 for building the [[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]] at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]]

Committee of the Nauvoo House Dr to W. Woodruff for labour in the provision store

  
 Nov
 24th I commenced labour in the provision store of the Nauvoo House this day was absent part of the day from this date to Jan 16th 1842 I attended on the Store daily as circumstances required   
 Jan
 17th 18th & 19th I worked butchering cutting up hogs tending store &c   
 21 spent the day in the store   
 20 L Woodworth Dr to 178 feet of 1 1/2 inch plank at 2 1/4 cents foot 
3.50   
 25 to one days work in Store   
 Feb
 1st To one days work drawing stone & in Store     



Care of the Store 2th & 7th
  
 W. Woodruff was called to take charge of the Printing Office in Company with Elder Taylor on the 3rd of Feb 1842 which closed my labours in the Nauvoo provision store making two months & seven days from the times I commenced labour in the Store to the time of leaving spending as much time in the Store as was required but without any agreement on the price of labour

Wednesday


Feb 17th Rode to [[George Washington Brandon|George W Brandons]] in [[Texas, Henry County, Tennessee|Texes]] distance 25 miles Preached at his house at night

Thursday


18 Preached at [[George Washington Brandon|G. W. Brandons]] at 12. oclock then rode to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] 14 miles

Friday


19 Rode to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] & receieved A Letter from Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Warren Parish]] Dated Jan. 31st 1836
Which I [[read|redd]] them with great delight then rode to [[Samuel Edney|Samuel Edneys]] distance 18 ml

Saturday


20 Rode to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] from thence to [[John Gainer|J Gainers]] 4 miles

Sunday


21 Rode to the [[Sulphur Wells Academy, Henry County, Tennessee|Academy]] Preached after [[Parson Pott|Parson Potts]] then rode to Mr [[Thomas Frazier|Fraziers]] 
from thence to Mr [[William Lewis Lowther|Lowthers]] Preached at his house then rode to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] 10 mil
procured 1 Subscriber for [[Latter Day Saints|M[essenger] & Ad[vocate].]]

Monday


22 Rode to Widow [[Widow Young|Youngs]] Preached at her house from thence to Brother [[Levi Taylor|Taylor's]] ^10 miles^

Tuesday


23 Rode to Br [[Samuel Smith|Smith's]] Preached at his house {Elder Cathcart took the lead of [meeting]} 2 miles

Wednesday


24 Rode {in company} with {Elder} [Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]] & [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] & {Deacon} [[Abraham Owen Smoot|A O Smoot]] to Br [[Simeon Hendrickson|Simeon Hendricks]] 20 miles

Thursday


25 Rode to Br [[Oliver Drown|Drown's]] 3 miles

Friday


Feb 26. 1836 Met in Conference at Brother [[Lewis Clapp|Lewis Clapps]] on [[Terrapin Creek, Calloway and Graves Counties, Kentucky|Taropen]] Calaway Co KY. 
according to Appointment & proceded to order[.] Elder Willford Woodruff was 
called to the Chair and [[Daniel Cathcart|Daniel Cathcart]] appointed Secretary. the conference was 
was opened by Prayer by President Woodruff. Elders Present Willford Woodruff. [[Elias F. Wells|Elias 
F Wells]] [[Daniel Cathcart|Daniel Cathcart]] Teachers [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Benjamin Clapp]] [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Daniel Thomas]] & Deacon [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Abram O Smoot]] 
President Woodruff arose & re^a^d the [[covenant|Covenant]] of the Church & commented some upon it 
after Which a voice was taken upon ordinations of some ones Who came foreward for 
ordination & it was carried by a clear voice after which President Woodruff Proceded 
to ordain [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Abram O Smoot]] Elder & [[Benjamin Boydston|Benjamin Boydstu^n^]] Elder. [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Daniel Thomas]] & [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Benjamin 
Clapp]] Priest's & [[James Allen|James Allen]] Teacher & [[Henry Thomas Jr.|Henry Thomas]] & [[John Camp|John Camp]] Deacons

Credit to the Committee for provisions received at their hands or at the store

After Which Seven branches of the Church was represented Prest Woodruff represented 1 at [[Eagle Creek, Benton County, Tennessee|Egle 
Creek]] Benton County Tenn. 15 in good standing. 1 at [[Chalk Level, Benton County, Tennessee|Chalk Level]] 21. in good standing in
[[Benton County, Tennessee|Benton Co]] Tenn. one on [[Cypress Creek, Benton County, Tennessee|Cyprus]] in Benton Co Tenn 9 in good standing. one called the Academy 
branch in [[Henry County, Tennessee|Henry Co]] Tenn 8 in good standing. one on [[Blood River, Henry County, Tennessee|Bloody River]] Henry Co Tenn 11 in 
good standing. one on [[Terrapin Creek, Calloway and Graves Counties, Kentucky|Taropen]] Branch in [[Calloway County, Kentucky|Calloway Co]] KY 24 in good standing. [[Damon Creek, Calloway County, Kentucky|Damonds
Creek]] branch KY. 8 in good standing & represented 7 remaining members scatered abroad 
all in good standing. The whole number 103 member in good standing. We then Proceded 
to appoint ed a Conference at Br [[Seth Utley|Seth Utley's]] [[Chalk Level, Benton County, Tennessee|Chalk Level]] Benton Co Tenn on Saturday 
& Sunday the 28, 29 of May closed by Prayer by Elder Abram O Smoot


After Conference Closed We had an intermision of 30 minits & met again wh^en^ 
Elder [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]] taught the church the [[Word of Wisdom|Word of Wisdom]]. I followed him upon the 
same subject which closed the duties of the Day After dividing our circuit 
in the following manner Elders Cathcart & Boydstun labour together in KY. & Elder
Woodruff & Elder Smoot [[labor|labour]] together in [[Tennessee|Tenn]]. & Elder [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] take A [[mission|mishion]] by 
himself & all to meet at the Academy near Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] Tenn on the 3rd of Aprail 1836

Saturday


27 Preached at Br [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapps]] & was followed by Elders [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]]. [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]]. [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]]. & 
[[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] & then rode to Br [[Johnson F. Lane|Johnstons F Lane]] ^4 miles^ Who had moved from [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] 
Tenn. to [[Terrapin Creek, Calloway and Graves Counties, Kentucky|Taropen]] KY. distance 4 miles. & Procured $23.00 dollars from the Brethren 
for the building of the [[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]] at Kirtland Ohio

Sunday


28 Sunday Rode to Father [[Joseph Greenwood|Greenwoods]] Preached at his house then rode to Br [[James Allen|James Allens]] 
distance 6 miles Sister [[Margaret Ann Loy Clapp|Margarett Clapp]] was instantly healed by the [[laying on of hands|laying on of hands]]

Nov 15 Cr to John Hodson for one days work 100   
 Do John Hodson Dr to 1 bushel Corn 33   
 Do bought one lb Candles 18 3/4   
 Do Do 1/2 bushel hare 25   
  Br Freeman gave me a load of wood   
 * Do Borrowed of Br Tracy 2 lbs 41 mails for lathing   
* 16th
 Borrowed $20 dollars of Mamtire Luce in silupp for which I gave my Note payable on demand   
 Do I Bought four Acres of Land of Zera Pulsipher Joining his house on the township line I agree to pay him $12 per acre of the other two which makes $24 dollars still due him to be paid a year from this date he is to give ma a bond for a deed 18 1/4   
 Do J. Hodson Dr to One bushel of lime   
 17th I sold five acres of Land to Mary Pitt belonging to Daniel S. Miles for which she paid $50 dollars in gold which I delivered to Zerah Pulsipher, who with the others of the comittee will give her a bond for a deed   
 20th
 I assisted D. S. Miles in selling 16 acres of his lot at $10 per acre in Section 32   
 Do I Bought lot five acres of land in Section 32 of Daniel S. Miles for which I am to give my obligations when I get a bond for a deed at $10 dollars per acre   
 Do bought 7 lbs of nails 87 1/2   
  & two chickins 18 3/4

Monday


29 Feb Rode from Br [[James Allen|Allen's]] with Brothers [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]]. [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] & [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]] to Mr [[John Clapp|John Clapp's]] on 
the [[Little Obion Creek, Graves County, Kentucky|Little Obine]] Graves Co. KY. distance 24 miles

Tuesday


1st March 1836. Tuesday Preached at [[John Clapp|John Clapps]] it being my [[birthday|birth Day]] making me 29 years of Age

Wednesday


2 Rode to Mr [[Rice Cobb|Rice Cobb]] at [[Mayfield, Graves County, Kentucky|Mayfield]] distance 12 miles Preached at Mr Cobbs & Was 
followed by Elder [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]]. Was kindly receieved by the People & we left other appointments 
& then rode to Br [[Henry Thomas Jr.|Thomases]] [[Damon Creek, Calloway County, Kentucky|Damonds Creek]] KY. 14 miles the whole distance 26 miles

Thursday


3 Spent the Day in visiting the Saints & spent the night with Elder Boydstun & [[Celia Parker|Celah Parker]]

Friday


4 held a meeting at Br [[Henry Thomas Jr.|H Thomases]] Elder [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]] opened the meeting
& I followed him & then rode to Br [[James McCartney|James MCcartney]] with Elder [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] 2 miles

Saturday


5 Rode to Mr [[James Martin|James Martins]] Preached at his house at night I followed Elders [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]] 
& [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] distance of the day 12 miles

Sunday


6 Sunday Preached at [[James Martin|James Martins]] to a large congregation I followed Elder [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]] 
after meeting we rode to Br [[Henry Thomas Jr.|Thomases]] distance 12 miles

Monday


7 Spent the day at Br [[Henry Thomas Jr.|Thomas's]] & Preached at night at Daniel Thomases Was followed by 
Elder [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]]

Tuesday


8 Rode to [[Henry H. Martin|Henry H Martins]] Preached at his house I followed Elder [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]]. 14 miles

Wednesday


9 Rode to [[Stephen Brady|Stephen Brady's]] Preached at his house upon the authunticity of the [[Book of Mormon|Book of 
Mormon]] & then rode to Mr [[John Freeman|John Freemans]] distans 18 miles

Thursday


10 Preached at [[John Rowlett|John Rowlets]]

Friday


11 Rode to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] distance 4 miles
Collected $13 dollars for building the [[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]]

Dec
 10th J. Hodson assisted me in the evening   
 13th Cr to Mr Alread to drawing wood 
37 1/2

  lent Clements 4 dozen of shingle nails

100

Saturday


12 March 1836 Spent the day at Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] in writing Writing Wrote two Letters one to President 
[[John Whitmer|John Whitmer]] & the other to Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Warren Parrish]]. I sent President [[John Whitmer|Whitmer]]
$20 dollars of money $4. dollars for  [[Latter Day Saints|M[essenger] & Advocate]] & $16 dollars for building the 
[[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]] at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] & one Subscriber for M & Ad. I Also sent Elder 
[[Warren Farr Parrish|W Parrish]] $20 dollars for the house of the Lord making $40. dollars in both 
Letters I also gave them all an account of the Conference $36 dls for house & $4. for Papers

Sunday


13 Preached on Sunday at Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] communed with the Saints[.] after meeting visited 
Sister [[Mary Chumley|Chumbley]] who lay apparently upon A bed of death But was resigned 
to the will of God & After bidding her farewell I left in company With Elder 
[[Abraham Owen Smoot|Abram O Smoot]] who has now commenced to travel with me to Preach 
the gospel of the Son of God may the Lord bless us and enabled us to do 
much good rode to Mr [[John Landers|John Landers]] Preached at his house on the Authenticity
of the [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]] & after meeting closed had a debate with [[Parson Pott|Parson Potts]] 6 miles

Monday


14 Preached at the school house by Brother [[Brother Davis, Tennessee|Davises]] Baptized one rode to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] 6 miles

Tuesday


15 Rode to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] had an interview with Br [[Isaiah Benton|Benton]] distance 10 miles

Wednesday


16 Rode to Mr [[David Cranshaw|Cranshaws]] distance distance 14 miles

Friday


18 Rode in company with {Elders [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] and [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]]} to Br [[Albert Petty|A Pettys]] distance 2 miles

Saturday


19 Rode to Mr [[Mr. Sanders|Sanders]] Preached at his house distance 10 miles

Sunday


20 Sunday rode to Br [[Joseph Fry|Joseph Frys]] on [[Eagle Creek, Benton County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]] Preached at his house distance 18 miles

Feb 2nd Borrowed 13 lbs flour of Albert Petty   
 3rd Cr to J Hodson & Wm Pitt one days work whitewashing   
 Do Borrowed of E Robinson 2 bushels Corn & Cash 25 cts

Monday


21st March Spent the day at Br [[Joseph Fry|Frys]] Writing in company With Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|A O Smoot]]

Tuesday


22 Spent the day in writing rode in the evening to Sister [[Mary Barnett Matlock Barnett|Matlocks]] {with Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] and [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]], and [[Sarah Fry|Susan Frey]]}

Wednesday


23 Spent the day visiting the Saints & the night at Sister [[Mary Barnett Matlock Barnett|Mary Matlock]]

Thursday


24 Took the parting hand of the Saints on [[Eagle Creek, Benton County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]] {and} rode to {Brother [Carl's] and [[Samuel Walker West|West's]] and rode to} [[Seth Utley|Seth Utleys]] 15 miles

Sunday


25 Rode to Br [[Thomas Hubs|Thomas Hubs]] {with Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]]} distance 1 mile (Elder [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] baptized 1 {person})

Sunday


26 rode to Br [[Samuel Walker West|Wests]] Preached at his house was followed by Elders [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] 
{shorthand} distance of the day 6 miles

Sunday


27 Sunday Rode to Br [[Albert Petty|A Pettys]] Preached at his house followed by Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] the Spirit 
of God rested upon us. rode to Br [[Abel B. Wilson|Wilsons]] & then Walked with a number of friends to 
Mr Camps to attend a Methodest meeting Parson Garr Preached their meeting closed with a shove 
I then returned With the Saints and spent the night at Mr [[Anthony M. Tittle|Tittles]] distance of the day 10 miles

Monday


28 Spent the day in reading & writing & Preached at night at Mr [[Anthony M. Tittle|Tittles]] had much of the Spirit 
of God I was followed by Elder [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] We warned them of the Judgments of God Soon after
meeting was dissmissed Miss [[Elizabeth Wilson|Elizabeth Wilson]] was attacked with sickness Br [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] &
myself assis^t^ed her through the night We thought she would soon depart but the Lord was mer
ciful unto her Elizabeth was a lady possessing a generous heart a refined mind a towering &
expanded thought celebrated for her accomplishments & the knowledg & art she possessed
in presenting her qualifications to the clearest advantage She had much influence in the
society of her acquaintance esspecially her sect

Tuesday


29 Walked to Mr [[William Malin|Malin's]] to attend the the ordinance of baptism which was administered 
w by Elder [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] unto Mrs [[Nancy Higgins Tittle|Tittle]] we then returned to Mr [[Anthony M. Tittle|Tittles]] I wrote A Letter 
to Elder [[Calvin H. Nicholson|Calvin H Nicholson]]. I spent the night waching with Miss [[Elizabeth Wilson|Elizabeth Wilson]] notwiths
tanding her low state of health I had an interesting edefyin & plesant discours from & with her upon
spiritual subjects {She acknowledges us to be servants of God and that our precepts and doctrine are supported by the} word {[[word of God|of God]] and that we possessed the greater light in these [[last days|last days]]}

Wednesday


30 {I took the parting hand with Miss [[Elizabeth Wilson|Elizabeth Wilson]] and} Rode to Br [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] from thence to 
Mr [[George Washington Brandon|Brannons]] in [[Texas, Henry County, Tennessee|Texas]] {with Elder [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]]} Preached at night at Mr Phares'es distance of the day 30 miles

Thursday


31 I baptized 2 George W Brannon & his sister then rode to Mr [[William Ross|Wm. Roe's]] Preached at
his house then rode to Mr [[Mr. Lightner|Lightners]] Preached at his house {I followed Elder [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]]} distance 7 miles

Friday


Aprail 1st Rode from Br [[George Washington Brandon|Brannons]] to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] distance {shorthand} 14 miles

Saturday


2 Rode to Br [[James Young|Young's]] {with Elder [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]]} Brothr [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] rode to Bloody I {shorthand} wrote
A Letter to Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrish]] at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] Ohio {I sent him the} Prospectus {of} mormonism from 
the [[Methodist|methodist]] Paper printed at [[Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee|Nashville]] {also} other {examples from the same paper} 3 miles

Sunday


3 Rode to the Academy {with} Br [[James Young|Young]] on Sunday had no meeting {shorthand} rain we 
was soon Joined By Elders [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]], [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]], & [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] {shorthand} we Rode 
to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland's]] Whare I l learned from {Elders} Boydston & Smoot that there
began to Be discords {and hard feelings} some branches of the Church in consequence of 
the teachings of Elder Cathcart Which I was sorry to hear distance of the day 6 miles

Monday


4 as it was thought wisdom to go different ways I took the Parting hand
With my Brethren & started to visit the Churches that were left in commoti^on^ 
by unwise procedings of {shorthand: Elder [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]]?} I rode to Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Joseph Chumley]] entered his 
hous but found Sister [[Mary Chumley|Mary Chumleys]] Place was vacant her spirit had gone to 
the [[paradise|Paradis]] of God She Died in the triumphs of faith in the [[new and everlasting covenant|New & Everlasting 
Covenant]] on the 24th of May 1836 Aged 59 Years I then rode to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] 10 miles

Tuesday


5 Rode to B [[Samuel Smith|S Smiths]] Preached at his house rode to Br [[Levi Taylor|Tailors]] distance 4 miles

Wednesday


6 rode to [[James Hendricks|James Hendricks]] from thence to Br [[Stephen Brady|Bradys]] & to Br [[Johnson F. Lane|Lanes]] distance 22m 
here I began to learn the commotion & darkness the Taropen Branch of church was in 
created by the conduct & preceps of Elder [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]] I strove to remove the evil

Thursday
Aprail 7th Rode to Br [[Simeon Hendrickson|Simeon Hendricks]] & Spent the day in teaching them & strivings 
to reinstate them into their former faith and fellowship which had been shaken
by wrong constructions upon the Law of the Church &c. By Elder [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]]
these are days of trial Who is weak & I am not weak Who is offended and I 
burn not O my God give me wisdom & spirit to feed the flock and proclaim 
against every evil Spirit. held a debate at night With Mr [[Alfred Loy|Alfred Loy]] I warn him of Judg^ment^

Friday
8 Rode to Father [[Joseph Greenwood|Greenwood's]] Preached at his house at 12 oclock Also at Br [[Stephen Brady|Bradys]] 
at candle light and then rode to Br [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapps]] distance of the day 8 miles

Saturday
9 Spent the day in visiting the Saints Striving to unite them in love truth & faith 
Preached at night at Br [[John Camp|Camps]] had much of the [[spirit of God|Spirit of the Lord]] upon me

Sunday


10 Sunday Preached at Br [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapps]] & communed with the Saints I felt to rejoice to find 
the Saints beginning to be united in faith and love as they were before they were divided by the 
fals precepts and example of Elder [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]] rode to Br [[Jefferson Turnbow|Jefferson Turnbow's]] 2.mile

Monday


11 Rode in {company with} Br [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Benj Clapp]] to Ph [[Feliciana, Graves County, Kentucky|Felisan^n^a]] Graves Co KY. Preached at night at 
Mr [[Joseph Lasswell|Joseph Lasswell's]] was kindly receieved By him through the night distance 22m

Tuesday


12 had an interview with Doct J Wyett Preached in Felisanna at 12 oclock rode to Mr 
[[Southerlin H. Johnson|Southerlin H Johnson's]] Preached at his house {in the [[spirit of God|Spirit of God]] from the gospel in [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]] Some were believing}
Got one subscribers for  [[Latter Day Saints|M[essenger] & Advocate]] distance of the day 6 miles

Wednesday


13 Rode to [[John Clapp|John Clapp's]] {with} Br {[[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapps]] where I took the parting hand} Preached at his house 10 miles

Thursday


14 Rode to [[Rice Cobb|Rice Cobbs]] Preached at his house {and} rode in company with Mr [[Joshua Shelton|Joshua Shelton]] 
to his house Preached at Mr [[Joshua Shelton|Sheltons]] at night distance of the day 16 miles

Friday


15 Left Mr [[Joshua Shelton|Sheltons]] {and} rode to Mr [[David Hodge|David. Hodges]] Preached at his house distance 8 miles

16 Rode to Br [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Daniel Thomas'es]] Preached at his house at night {on the} 14 ch[apter] 12 v[erse] {of} Rev[elation] distance of 14 miles

Monday


18 Rode to Br [[Henry Thomas Jr.|H Thomas'es]] spent the day at his house

Tuesday


19 Rode from Br Thomas'es to [[Levi Taylor|L Taylors]] on [[Blood River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Bloody]] and there Glorious to here I learned 
that Elder [[David Wyman Patten|David Patten]] (one of the twelve Apostles of Jesus Christ chosen in these [[last days|last 
days]]) had arived was at Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland's]] in 8 or 10 miles of me from Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] I rode 
to Mr [[John Freeman|Freemans]] from thence to [[John Rowlett|John Rowlett]] whare I had an interview with Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|O 
Smoot]] it was A happy joyful & Glorious meeting he had Been with Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] & his 
wife for several Days Past Br [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] related the news to me from Br Patten which 
was glorious in the first degree he gave me an account of the [[endowment|endowment]] at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] 
Ohio the heavens was opened unto them in their asseumbly [[angel|Angels]] & Jesus Christ 
was seen by them Jesus Christ sitting at the right hand of the [[Heavenly Father|Father]] 
administered unto them in person also informed me that Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrish]] (& his 
wife) one of the first [[Seventy|seventy]] with some other of the first Elders was about to
visit us & also the second seventy was chosen & that I was one of the number. 
O God prepare me for the battle while combating error with everlasting truth 
the above are great blessings indeed. Distance of the Day 30 miles

Wednesday


20 Preached at [[John Rowlett|John Rowlett]] & rode to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] 5 miles

Thursday


21th Rode to Mr [[John Gainer|John Gainers]] Whare I was Privleged with a happy interview with 
Elder [[David Wyman Patten|David Patten]] Also Sister [[Phoebe Ann Babcock Patten Bentley|Patten]] his wife[.] Br Preached I followed him 
rode after meeting {in company with Elders Patten [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] and Sister Patten and [[Leonora Cannon Taylor|Taylor]]} to Br Taylors {shorthand} 16 miles

22 rode to Br [[Samuel Smith|S Smiths]] {with Elders [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] and [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]]} 2 miles

23 rode to Br [[Levi Taylor|Tailors]] Preached at his house {shorthand} 2 miles

{I followed Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]]} I baptized one & confirmed two by the waters rode to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland's]] 13 miles
{shorthand}

Aprail 25th Spent the Day at Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland]]

Tuesday


26 rode to Mr [[David Cranshaw|Cranshaw's]] {with [[David Wyman Patten|Elder]] and [[Phoebe Ann Babcock Patten Bentley|Sister Patten]]} Preached at his house distance 12 mile

Wednesday


27 Baptized. 3. persons had a good time travled to Br [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] {shorthand}14 mile

Thursday


28 travled to Br [[Albert Petty|Pettys]] {and returned} to Br [[John Jackson|Jackson]] Preached at his house Br [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] took the 
lead of the meeting Elders [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & myself then rode to Br [[Seth Utley|Utleys]] from 
thence to Br [[Abel B. Wilson|Willson]] 12 miles

Friday


29 Rode to Br [[Seth Utley|Seth Utley's]] {Spent the night at his house Distance} 4 miles

Saturday


30 Rode {with Elders [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]]} to Mr [Mr Short|Short's]] Preached at his house {shorthand} {distance} 12 miles

Sunday


May 1st Sunday rode to Col [[Irvin B. Carnes|Irvin Carns]] Preached at his house {I followed Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]]} then rode to Br [[Abel B. Wilson|A B 
Willson's]] Preached at his house I followed Br Patten {I had the [[spirit of God|spirit of God]] and of [[prophecy|Prophecy]]} I Prophesied to 
the people ^of^ the Judgments of God that await them after meeting I walked to Mr [[Anthony M. Tittle|Tittles]] and 
Preached the word to him & he arose and I Baptized him at the midnight hour {distance} 14 miles

Monday


2 Rode to [[James Merrick|James Merick's]] Preached at his house {shorthand} distans of the day 6 miles

Tuesday


3 Rode to Father [[Joseph Fry|Frey's]] {with Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]]} distance 10 mile

Wednesday


4 Preached at Father [[Joseph Fry|Frey's]] at candle light Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] took the lead of the meeting

Thursday


5 Spent the day at Father [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] copying my Journal & studying the HEBREW {with Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]]}

Friday


6 Spent the day studying & writing at Br [[Joseph Fry|Fry's]]

Saturday


7 Travled to Sister [[Polly Barnett Jennings|Barnett's]] {with Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]]} 3 miles

8 Sunday Preached at Sister [[Polly Barnett Jennings|Barnetts]] Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] took the lead of the meeting rode 
to Br [[John Walker, Tennessee|Walkers]] Preached at his house 1 mile

Monday


9 rode to Brother [[Joseph Fry|Frey]] Wrote A Letter to my Parents then rode to Br [[Cade A. Crawley|Crawleys]] 10 m

Friday


13 Rode to Br Petty's Preached at his house {Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] Preached in the [[spirit of God|Spirit of God]]} I Baptized 3 persons after meeting ^5 miles^

14 Rode to Col [[Colonel Rutherford|Rutherford's]] Preached at his house distance of the day 10 miles
