15 Crossed [[Tennessee River, United States|Tennessee River]] {with Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]]} rode to Mr Rogers Preached at his house on Sunday 
to a large congregation {Elder Patten} Preached {I followed him} after meeting we rode to Br Seth Utley 16 miles

Monday


16 Spent the day visiting the Brethren & the night at Br [[Abel B. Wilson|Willsons]] {distance of the day} 4 miles

Tuesday


17 Baptized [[Margaret Tittle Anderson|Margaret Tittle]] She was healed by the [[laying on of hands|laying on of hands]] rode to [[Cade A. Crawley|C A Crawle^ys^]] 14 miles

Wednesday


18 Left [[David Wyman Patten|Br]] & [[Phoebe Ann Babcock Patten Bentley|Sister Patten]] at Br [[Cade A. Crawley|Crawleys]] & Walked to Mr Beards {He rejected my testimony} from thence 
to [[James Marrier|James Marrich]] {shorthand} from thence ^to^ Esq [[Irvin Jordan|Jordans]] distance of the day 10  miles

Thursday


19 Waalked to Br Fry's from thence to Sister [[Mary Barnett Matlock Barnett|Matlock's]] I their found eLder [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] & return^ed^ 
to Br [[Joseph Fry|Frys]] whare we was soon Joined By [[David Wyman Patten|Br]] & [[Phoebe Ann Babcock Patten Bentley|Sister Patten]] {Distance of the day} 12 miles

Friday


20 Spent the day at Br [[Joseph Fry|Fry's]] in writing & walked in company with Elder [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] 
to Sister [[Mary Barnett Matlock Barnett|Matlocks]] whare we spent the nigh 2 miles

Saturday


21 Spent the day at Sister [[Mary Barnett Matlock Barnett|Matlocks]] Studying {[George] Barnett polished my shoes}

Sunday


22 Sunday walked to Br [[Joseph Fry|Fry's]] to attend meeting according to appointment which commenced at 10 AM ^oclock^
Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] Preached three discourses {The} 1st from the Parable in the fore Part of the 20 Ch Math 
the 2nd from Ephe 1st Ch 10 Vers & 3rd from the Authenticity of the [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]] after the 
close of the last discors Mr Rose rejected the testimony given & called on Br Patten to [[raise the dead|rase 
the dead]] that he might believe Br Patten rebuke'd him sharply for his infidelity & unbelief we 
then communed with the Saints I then retired from the scene {shorthand} with Elders Patten & [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] 
to a stream of pure water & cleansed our hands & feet & testified against that people who had 
threatened us & rejected our testimony from time to time We delivered them into the hands of 
God & the destroyer ownly reserving the Saints & their friends {O God, thy will be done.}

Monday


23 May Travled to Br [[Cade A. Crawley|Crawley]] from thence to Br [[Anthony M. Tittle|Tittle's]] with Elder [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] 10 mil

Tuesday


24 Spent the day visiting the Saints [of] the Cyprus branch of the Church the procedings 
of the day were as follows Travled to Mr [[Joseph Ash|Joseph Ash]] & found the family much
shaken in their faith 3 of which were members of the Church they were shaken 
by the conduct of Br [[John Jackson|John Jackson]] who was a teacher in the church but had denied the
faith and now become [[hostile|hostile]] from thence to Br [[Albert Petty|Pettys]] from thence to Mr J Jackson he 
was absent found his wife Sister [[Katherine Jackson|Jackson]] turning from the faith & desireing to leeve the church 
walked from thence to Br [[John H. Williams|Howard Williams]] ^he^ had lost faith & desired to leave the Church 
his wife Sister [[Martha West Woods Williams|Williams]] Also Sister [[Nancy Wood|Nancy Wood]] both were [[unbelieving|unbelieving]] & a prospect of their 
leeving the Church & this by the influence of John Jackson We then returned to Mr Jacksons 
had an interview with him he denied all his former faith & pretentions he raged much was 
filled with the spirit of anger wrath {and the devil]} he rejected our testimony {and denied the revelations of Christ} We left 
his house at 10 oclock at night & went to a stream of Pure water & [[cleansed|clensed]] our hands & 
feet & testified unto God against him that our [[garments|garments]] might be clear of his blood {shorthand}
{shorthand} We then walked to Br Pettys &
spent the notes night distance of the day 12 miles

Wednesday


25 Walked to Br [[Abel B. Wilson|Wilsons]] distance of the day 3 miles

Thursday


26 Walked to Br [[Samuel Walker West|West's]] with Elder's [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] & [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] 1.mile

Friday


27 Elder [[David Wyman Patten|D. W. Patten]] held a conference or an interview at Br [[Samuel Walker West|West's]] With Elders [[Daniel Cathcart|D Cathcart]] 
[[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] & myself to inquire into my our teaching & found Elder Cathcart had tought wrong We 
then travled to Br [[Seth Utley|Seth Utleys]] whare we was soon Joined by Brothers [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]], [[James Allen|Allen]], & [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Thomas]]
from [[Kentucky|KY]]. Also Elders [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] & our Beloved & worthy Brother [[Warren Farr Parrish|Warren Parrish]] who ha^d^
came direct from [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] Ohio. to attend the conference & labour in the South for the season it
was a happy interview 2 miles

Saturday


May 28 At a conference convened at Br [[Seth Utley|Seth Utleys]] agreeable to appointment on the 28 day of 
may 1836 Congregation called to order & Elder [[David Wyman Patten|David W Patten]] nominated & seconded 
to officiate as chairman & Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Warren Parish]] secretary. Opened by [[singing|singing]] & Prayer & 
Proceded to business. The chairman made some preliminary remarks touching the object & 
order of the meeting & called upon the official members to inform the conference in what mann
er they had [[taught|tought]] also their present faith in the [[fulness of the gospel|fulness of the gospel]] as contained in the 
[[Bible|bible]] [[Book of Mormon|book of mormon]] & book of [[Doctrine and Covenants|doctrins & covenants]] Elder W. Woodruff was called upon 
to offer us his feelings upon the subject which he did to our entire satisfaction the chairma^n^ 
then called upon all the official members present to rise upon their feet if they concured in what 
Elder Woodruff had said the vote was unanimous also the church concured in the same. [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Benjami^n^ 
Clapp]] Priest then arose represented [[Terrapin Creek, Calloway and Graves Counties, Kentucky|Taropen]] Branch which consists of 28 members in godd 
standing [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas| Daniel S. Thomas]] represented the [[Clarks River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Clarks River]] branch consisting of 9 members in good 
standing Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|A O Smoot]] represented [[Blood River, Henry County, Tennessee|Blood river]] branch consisting of 10 members in good stand^ing^ 
Elder Woodruff represented the Academy Branch consisting of 10 members in good standing 
with the exception of their not altogether observing the [[Word of Wisdom|word of wisdom]] Deacon [[Abel B. Wilson|A B. Wilson]] 
represented the [[Chalk Level, Benton County, Tennessee|Chalk Level]] branch consisting of 27 members in good standing with the excepti^on^ 
of some few who have been shaken of late by the [[ungodly|ungodly]] conduct & teaching of [[John Jackson|John Jackson]] 
which was a Teacher in the [[Cypress Creek, Benton County, Tennessee|Cyprus]] branch but has now [[apostatized|apostatized]]. Elder Woodruff represe
nted the [[Eagle Creek, Benton County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]] branch consisting of 15 members in good standing Also [[Cypress Creek, Benton County, Tennessee|Cyprus]] branch consist
ing of 10 members 3 of which have apostatized John Jackson their Teacher is one of the number 
3 are [[disaffected|disaffected]] & 4 in good standing Also 7 members scattered abroad not recognized with 
any branch. [[John Jackson|John Jackson]] was expeled by the conference Sister [[Katherine Jackson|Jackson]] & [[John H. Williams|Howard Williams]] had 
their names withdrawn from the church by their request & the voice of the church

Deacon [[Abel B. Wilson|Abel B Wilson]] & [[Jesse Turpin|Jesse Turpin]] was ordained Priest & [[Albert Petty|Albert Petty]] Teacher 
under the hand of Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|W Parish]] the move was made by the chairman & a unanimous vote 
given by the church for the above ordinations A vote called & unanimously carried that Elder 
[[Elias F. Wells|Elias F Wells]] shall receieve a letter of [[commendation|commendation]] to the Church in [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] Congregation 
dissmissed by singing With the blessing of God An action was Prefered against Elder [[Daniel Cathcart|D Cathcart]] 
by Elder Wells for [[unchristian conduct|unchristiaian conduct]] & the conference of official members repaired from 
Br [[Seth Utley|Utley's]] to Br [[Samuel Walker West|West's]] to try the case Elder Cathcart was convicted of unchristian conduct & 
[[false teachings|fals teaching]] & being led by [[evil spirit|evil spirit]]s which was supported by strong testimony he confess^ed^
& acknowledged his faults & asked [[forgiveness|forgivness]] which was granted him on conditions that 
he would repair the wrongs Which he had done in the different branches of the church Which 
he Promised to do he was then [[restored to fellowship|restored to fello^w^ship]] thus closed the procedings of the day

Sunday


May 29th Sunday met at Br [[Seth Utley|S.Utley]] at 10 AM. according to appointment Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|W Parrish]] 
Preached in the former Part of the day & Elder [[David Wyman Patten|D. W. Patten]] in the latter Part they both 
Preached in the [[power of God|Power]] & & [[spirit of God|spirit of God]] although threatened by wicked men we were not harmed

Monday


30 Travled with Elders [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] & [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrish]] to Br [[Joseph Fry|Frys]] Preached at his house Elder Parish 
Preached & was followed by Elder Patten & both filled with the [[power of God|Power of God]] 10 mil

Tuesday


31 Spent the Day at Br [[Joseph Fry|Frys]] & found it to be the most interesting & important & instructive 
day of my LIFE dor on this Glorious DAY I was ordained unto the [[Melchizedek Priesthood|High Priesthood]] under
the hands of my Beloved Brethren. VIZ Elders [[David Wyman Patten|David W Patten]] & [[Warren Farr Parrish|Warren Parrish]] I
was Also ordained as one of the Second [[Seventy|Seventy]] & [[sealed up unto eternal life|sealed up unto eternal LIFE]] my
ordination was requested by the PRESIDENCY of the church at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] Ohio their 
was glorious things Pronounced upon my head in my ordination by [[prophecy|Prophecy]] & Revelation 
some I will mention which are as follows that although my enemies would strive to

May 4th Bough Wellim Clayton cr by 2 sacks 2 1/2 $ 125  
 8 Wm Clayton Dr to 2 3/4 Butler

take my life & confine me in dungeons & Prisons yet they should not have Power over
me but in the name JESUS CHRIST I should be delivered out of the hands of my enemies 
& they should not have power over me & that men would bow at my feet & worship
me If I did not say to them do it not & that Kings would bow unto me & Princes give me 
their hands & that I should Baptize them into the [[kingdom of God|Kingdom of God]] & that I should be 
blessed on the EARTH When my head blossomed with age & If I desired it I should 
remain on the Earth untill the [[Second Coming of Jesus Christ|comeing]] of the Savior & that God would give me 
the desire of my heart & that God had had his eye Upon me all my life long to 
prepare me for this work YEA {even when my spirit was playing around the [[throne of God|throne of God]] in eternity} that I should 
travel to the Nations of the [[earth|Earth]] & the Islands [[islands of the sea|of the sea]] to Proclam the [[word of God|word 
of God]]. When these & other Blessings were Pronounced Upon my head I was 
filled with the Power & [[spirit of God|Spirit of God]] as a witness to the truth of the same
O MY GOD THE [[Eternal Father|ETERNAL FATHER]] I ASK THE IN THE NAME OF JESUS CHRIST 
TO PREPARE ME FOR THY USE AND GIVE ME THE SPIRIT OF MY [[mission|MISHION]]


I also on this 31st Day of May Wrote a Letter to President [[Oliver Cowdery|O Cowdery]] [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]]
containing one subsccriber for [[Latter Day Saints|M[essenger] & Ad[vocate] ]] & $2 dollars for M & Ad this Letter contained 
the substance of the two Letters I mailed for Kirtland dated March 12 1836 
Which we suppose are lost I sent this Letter & money by the hand of 
Elder [[Elias F. Wells|Elias F Wells]] who was going direct to Kirtland I took the Parting hand
with our Beloved Brother Wells may God give him a safe return to Kirtland


While holding the Office of an Elder from the 28th of June 1835 to the 31st of May 1836 I Travled 2557 Miles & held 
182 meetings. Baptized 48 Persons. [[priesthood blessing|Blessed]] 19 children. Ordained 2 Elders 2 Priest 3 Teachers 3 Deacons Procured 23 Subscribers 
for M & Ad & 2 for the Star $91 dollars for the [[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]]. Wrote 18 Letters held 7 debates 2 conferences 5 healed under my hand 3 mobs came ^against^ me

A true copy of a licence conveyed to me from [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] Ohio


TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN


THIS certifies that Willford Woodruff has been receieved into the [[Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints|Church of Latter Day 
Saints]] organized on the sixth of April in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and thirty and has 
been ordained an elder according to the rules and regulations of said church and is duly authorized to [[preach the Gospel|preach 
the gospel]] agreeably to the authority of that office. From the satisfactory evidence which we have of his 
good moral character and his zeal for the cause of righteousness and diligent desire to persuade men to 
forsake evil and embrace truth we confidently recommend him to all candid and upright people as a 
worthy member of society. We therefore in the name and by the authority of this church grant unto this 
our worthy brother in the Lord this [[letter of commendation|letter of commendation]] as a Proof of our fellowship and esteem: praying 
for his success and prosperity in our Redeemers cause. Given by the direction of a conference of 
the Elders of said church assembled in Kirtland Geauga County Ohio the third day of March in
the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and thirty six


[[Joseph Smith Jr.|JOSEPH SMITH]] Chairman
[[Frederick Granger Williams|F. WILLIAMS]] Clerk
Kirtland Ohio. May 2nd 1836


This certifies that the within (Above) [[license|Licence]] was recorded on the 2nd Day of May 1836 
in Kirtland Ohio in the Licence Records Book A. Page 97


[[Thomas Burdick|THOMAS BURDICK]]


Recording Clerk

Wednesday


1st June Spent the day at Br [[Joseph Fry|Fry's]] in writing I took the Parting hand with Elders [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] & ^[[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]]^

Thursday


2 The time had now come for me to take the Parting hand with the saints on [[Eagle Creek, Benton County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]] 
& the regions round about & Perhaps for the last time untill [[gathering of Israel|I^s^rael is gathered]] 
Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & myself took the Parting hand with Elder [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]] & Father
[[Joseph Fry|Frys]] houshold Who had long entertained the Saints kindly it was an affectin^g^ 
scene then travled to Br [[Cade A. Crawley|Crawleys]] from thence to Br [[Abel B. Wilson|Wilsons]] & after conversing 
an hour with them I took the Parting hand with Br Wilson & his family 
{[[Elizabeth Wilson|Elizabeth]] gave me} much {encouragement that she would become a Saint and go to Zion with her father O God I ask thee in the name of Christ to save the family[.]} 
from thence to Br [[Anthony M. Tittle|Tittle's]]. Parted with his family from thence to Br [[Samuel Walker West|West]] from thence 
to Brother [[Albert Petty|Pettys]] Whare I spent an hour with the Precious saints of God & supped 
at the table of this Israelite in whom their is no guile in company with the saints 
& [[David Wyman Patten|Br]] & [[Phoebe Ann Babcock Patten Bentley|Sister Patten]] & Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrish]] after supper I took the Parting hand With these 
Beloved friends I say Beloved for God Knows they occupy a conspicuous Place in
my heart & returned to Br West whare I spent the night distans of the day 20 mi

Friday


3 Took the Parting hand with Br [[Samuel Walker West|West]] & his family & rode on Jude a [[horse|beast]] of Br Wests 
to Br [[Seth Utley|Utleys]] & took the Parting with him & his family then rode to [[Tennessee River, United States|Tennessee River]] 
Crossed at Wills'es Ferry from thence to Mr [[Jesse Roggers|Rogger's]] Preached at his house Wrote a
letter to {Miss [[Elizabeth Wilson|Elizabeth Wilson]]} upon the subject of Religion distance of the day 16 miles

Saturday


4 Rode from Mr [[Jesse Roggers|Roggers]] to Mr [[William B. Ament|William B Aments]] at the [[Rolling Mill, Stewart County, Tennessee|rolling mill]] Steward County 
Tenn travled over a rough country for the distance of 40 miles

Sunday


5 Sunday Preached at Mr [[William B. Ament|Aments]] to a respectable Congregation was solicited to leave 
another appointment rode after meeting through [[Dover, Stewart County, Tennessee|Dover]] & crossed Tenn River at
mouth of [[Big Sandy River, Henry County, Tennessee|Sandy]] from thence to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] on [[Blood River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Bloody]] distance 30 miles

1842

Monday


6 June Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] & [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrish]] arived at Br [[Levi Taylor|Tailor's]] in the morning & I rode in company 
with them to [[James Hendricks|James Hendricks]] Elder Parrish tarried & Elder Patten rode with me 
to Br [[Johnson F. Lane|Lanes]] whare we spent the night {Distance} 20 miles

Tuesday


7 Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] came to Br [[Johnson F. Lane|Lanes]] & we all rode to Br [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapps]] to attend meeting. Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] 
Preached on the Law of the Church & Elder Parrish on charity & the gifts or [[body of Christ|body 
of Christ]]. I & Elder [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] testified to the truth distance of the day 5 miles

Wednesday


8 Rode in company with Elders [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]], [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrish]] & [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] & other Brethren to Br [[Henry Thomas Jr.|H Thomas^es^]] 
on [[Damon Creek, Calloway County, Kentucky|Damonds Creek]] KY distance (Father [[Lewis Clapp|Clapp]] & other healed under our hands) 12 miles

Thursday


9 held a meeting at the school house Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] Preach at 11 AM & Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrish]] at 
2 PM when Elder Parrish closed Elder Patten arose bound the Law & [[sealed|Scealed]] the 
testimony & Prophesied upon the heads of some of the [[ungodly|Ungodly]] People who were Present
we then repaired to the water & Elder Patten Baptized 2 one was Father [[Henry Thomas, b. 1758|Henry Thomas]]
A [[American Revolution|Revolutionary]] soldier & served under [[George Washington|George Washington]] (numbers of sick were healed)

Friday


10 Took the Parting hand with Elders [[Elias F. Wells|Wells]] & [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] as on this morning. Br Wells starte^d^ 
for [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] I also took the Parting hand with Elders [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] & [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrish]] who was going 
to middle [[Tennessee|Tennessee]] while I & Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] labour in [[Kentucky|KY]] & meet at the conference

Saturday


11 Spent the day copying my Journal Preached at 5 oclock AM at [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Daniel Thomases]] & communed
with the Saints

Sunday


12 Rode With Br [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Daniel Thomas]] to Mr [[Thomas Bond|Thomas Bonds]] Preached at his house {on Sunday}. [[Calloway County, Kentucky|Calaway 
County]] KY. then rode to [[James Martin|James Martins]]. distance of the day 15 miles

Monday


13 Rode to Mr [[Josias Short|Josias Short's]] Preached at his house had much of the Spirit of God 3 miles

Tuesday


14 Rode to & Preached at Mr [[David Carter|Davids Carters]] Preached at his house [[Graves County, Kentucky|Graves Co]] KY 5 miles

Wednesday


15 Rode to Mr [[William J. Hodge|William J Hodges]] [[McCracken County, Kentucky|Mccracken County]] KY 8 miles

Wm Parsons Cr

  
 April 2 Wm Parsons Cr By one quarter of an acre of land & a dwelling house in Lot No 2 in Block No 12 in wells Addition sold to me the 2d dec 1841 for one hundred dollars $100.00 one half to be paid in cash & the other half in trade

Thursday


16 June Rode to [[Paducah, McCracken County, Kentucky|Paducah]] Mccracken Co KY Preached at night at the co^u^rt house to an attentive 
congregation Spent the night with Brother [[Isaiah Benton|Isaiah Benton]]. distance of the Day 10 miles

Friday


17 Rode to [[William J. Hodge|William J Hodges]] 10 miles

Saturday


18 Preached at the Public meeting house

Sunday


19 Sunday Preached at the meeting house Br [[Isaiah Benton|Benton]] spoke after me {shorthand}

Monday


20 Rode to [[Josias Short|Josighah Short's]] Preached at his house had a good time found many believing 12 m

Tuesday


21 Rode to Br [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Thomases]] visited the Saints had a severe cold on my [[lungs|longues]] distance 12

Wednesday


22 Rode to Br [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp's]] was verry unwell {with a cold} distance of the day 12

Thursday


23 Preached to the Saints at Br [[John Camp|Camp's]] Whare I was Joined by Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] had a good time

Friday


24 Rode in Company with Brothers [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]] to Mr [[Jeremiah B. Murphy|Jeremiah B Murphys]] 25 miles

Saturday


25 Rode to [[Dresden, Weakley County, Tennessee|Dresden]] Preached in the [[courthouse|Cort house]] then rode to Mr Mcclure's Preached at 
his house distance of the Day 8 mile

Sunday


26 Sunday Preached at the Cort house in [[Dresden, Weakley County, Tennessee|Dresden]] Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & Br [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]] followed me 
then rode to Mr [[John Bowers|John Bowers]] Preached at his house distance of the Day 10 miles

Monday


27 Rode to the Baptist meeting house on [[Thompson Creek, Weakley County, Tennessee|Thompson's Creek]] in Consequence of lies from 
Parson [[Parson Browning|Browning]] the [[Baptist|Baptist]] shut the doors against us Parson Browning appeared 
angry at me & my brethren for rectifying his errors & falshoods I asked the privileg 
to Speak to the People either from the fence or a Stump or cart or in the streat 
one man gave us liberty to stand on his land opposite of the meeting house We 
assembled & Preached to the People & was blessed with the [[spirit of God|Spirit of God]] We then 
rode to Mr [[Randolph Alexander|Randolph Alexander]] [[Weakley County, Tennessee|Weekly County]] Tenn distance of the day 15 miles

Tuesday


28 After Selling a [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]] to Mr [[Randolph Alexander|Alexander]] we rode to Mr [[Alexander McKinzie|Alexander MCkinzies]] 
in [[Weakley County, Tennessee|Weekly Co]] Tenn distance 20 miles

Nov 18 Wm Parsons Cr By   
  14 four stick of timber at 8 cts $ 1 12   
  to 2 peacs Railting 45

Thursday


30 Spent the day at Mr [[David Crider|Crider's]] I {and Brothers Smoot and Clapp went to the woods to pray the power of God stay on us I was filled with the spirit of prophecy I sealed} up {my brethren and prophesied on their heads great blessings by the Spirit of God}

Friday


July 1st Preached at Mr [[David Crider|David Criders]] and spent the night with Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] at a Baptist 
Priest's A Mr Bradford a [[Presbyterian|Predestinarian]] though rather inclining to the faith of Mr [[Hardy Hunt|Hunt]] a fanatic 
who called himself [[Moses (OT)|Moses]] & (Bradford) [[Aaron (OT)|Aaron]] (Hunts visitors were speckled birds it is said

Saturday


2 Rode to Mr [[Randolph M. Gilbert|Randolph Gilberts]] [[Weakley County, Tennessee|Weekly Co]] Tenn distance of the day 25 miles

Sunday


3 Sunday Preached at the Green hill School house in [[Carroll County, Tennessee|Carroll Co.]] Tenn. to a large respectable 
congregation on the authenticity of the [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]] Also Preached at 5 PM at Mr 
[[William McClesky|William H MClesky]] the People were much stired up many were our friends some
believing & some accused us of being [[abolitionist|Abolitionist]] I red the 7th No of the [[Latter Day Saints|M[essenger] & Ad[vocate] ]] which put 
to silence those [[falsehoods|falshoods]] I obtained 2 subscribers for M & Ad. 6 miles

Monday


4 Rode to Mr [[Martin Maxwell|Martin Maxwell]] Preached at his house upon the [[parable|Parable]] of the vineyard spake 
by the Prophet [[Zenos (BofM)|Zenas]] Spent the night at Maxwells had much conversation with a company 
of [[Atheist|Atheist]] esspecially their celebrated leader Mr [[Mr. Cathy|Cathy]] retired to bed at 12 oclock & was
attacked with a fever. Pain in the breast & soreness of [[lungs|longues]]. in [[Carroll County, Tennessee|Carroll Co]] Ten 3 miles

Tuesday


5 Arose in ill health & rode to Mr [[Randolph M. Gilbert|R Gilberts]] with Br [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]] from thence to the [[Baptist|Bapti
st]] Meeting house By Mr [[Samuel Winn|Winns]] in which house we held a meeting according to appointment 
I followed Br Smooth & Clapp by making a few observations Spent the night at Mr Winns 7 miles

Wednesday


6 My health some improved rode to [[Jeremiah B. Murphy|Jeremiah B Murphys]] [[Weakley County, Tennessee|Weeakly Co]] Tenn {distance of the day} 15 miles

Thursday


7 Took the Parting hand with Br [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]] who returned holm Spent the ^Got 2 subscribers {for} M & Ad^
Day in writing wrote Wrote three Letters one to [[Randolph M. Gilbert|R Gilbert]] one to [[Alexander McKinzie|A McKinzie]] & one to [[David Crider|David 
Crider]] & then rode to Mr [[John Bowers|John Bowers]] 2 miles

Jan 10th

Friday


8 July Arose in the morning sick with the french [[measles|Measles]] attended a meeting at Mr
[[John Bowers|Bowers]] at 11AM Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] Preached I followed him with some remarks. We
then rode to an appointment at 4. PM at [[Randolph Alexander|R Alexanders]] I lay abed while Elder 
Smoot Preached I arose And made some remarks when he closed spent a 
sick night and in much Pain distance of the day 6 miles

Saturday


9 Arose refreshed in some degree and rode to [[Boydsville, Weakley County, Tennessee|Boydsville]] from thence to [[Terrapin Creek, Calloway and Graves Counties, Kentucky|Taropen]] 
whare I found Br [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] with the church & I Purused the 7th NO of [[Latter Day Saints|M & Ad]] {Distance} 25 mile

Sunday


10 Sunday held a meeting with the [[Terrapin Creek, Calloway and Graves Counties, Kentucky|Taropen]] Branch & communed with the Saints at
Brother [[Lewis Clapp|Clapps]] then rode to Br [[Lindsey Anderson Brady|Braidy's]] whare we spent the night in company with 
[[Johnson F. Lane|Brother]] & [[Matilda Kelly Lane Clements|Sister Lane]] with their son Warren [[David Patten Lane|David Patten]] 4 miles

Monday


11 Rode to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylor's]] on [[Blood River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Bloody]] distance of the day 20 miles

Tuesday


12 Rode to [[John Freeman|John Freemans]] & returned to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylor's]] distance 8 miles

Wednesday


13 Wrote two Letters one to [[Abel B. Wilson|Abel B Wilson]] & the other to Elder [[Elias F. Wells|Elias F Wells]]

Thursday


14 Wrote a Letter to President [[Oliver Cowdery|O Cowdery]] [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] Sent him 9 subscriders for M & Ad 
and gave him an account of my Proceding and wrote sum on the [[Abolition|Abolition]] question
{[you/your] [illegible] is the [illegible]}

Friday


15 Receieved a Letter from [[Warren Farr Parrish|Warren Parrish]] dated [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] Ohio April 20th 1836 
Communed with the Saints at Br Tailor's & injoyed a good meting

Saturday


16 Rode with Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] from [[Blood River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Blood River]] Henry County Tenne to Cumberland [[Rolling Mill, Stewart County, Tennessee|rolling mill]] 
Stewart Co Tenn we crossed [[Tennessee River, United States|Tennessee River]] at [[Thomas Wynns Ferry, Stewart County, Tennessee|Winn's ferry]] distans of the day 40 m

Sunday


17 Sunday Preached at Mr [[William B. Ament|Aments]] Tavern at 11.^oc^AM Also at 3 PM to a large congregation 
Sold a [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]] Procured 3 subscribers for [[Latter Day Saints|M & Ad]] Spent the night at the 
[[Rolling Mill, Stewart County, Tennessee|rolling mill]] at Mr William B Aments

1843 settelled up to this date

  
 June 26 Hiram Kimball Dr to 4 Fac Similes 50   
 Dec 4th 1843 Cr To City order $37. 20   
 Nov 1st 1843 Hiram Kimball Dr to Advertising 3.62 1/2   
  Leather Notice 1 sgn & in   
 Nov 1st To Advertising wanted A Young man 1 sqr 8 in 3 62 1/2   
 Nov 8th To Advertising Work 1 sqr 7 in $325 3 25

 Dec 8th To one order 45   
 15 To 12 appeals 50   
 Jan 9th To 2 copies of Times & Season 4 00   
 25th To Bringing Lochies garland 1 25   
   $53. 90 1/2     Settled the above Aug 24th 1844

Monday


18 July Rode to Mr [[Elisha Askew|Askeue's]] ferry Br [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & myself rowed ourselves & horses across the [[Tennessee River, United States|Tennessee 
river]] in the ferry boat after droping one oar into the river & having to use another [[broken|broaken]] one 
we landed with a circulation of Blood & blistered hands from thence we passed through the 
Texas forded [[Big Sandy River, Henry County, Tennessee|Sandy]] at the at the sholes Elder Smoot Swam the river I crossed below from thence 
we rode to Mr [[Thomas Frazier|Thomas Fraziers]] Spent the night with him distance of the day 35 miles

Tuesday


19 Rode to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Solomon Copeland]] [[Henry County, Tennessee|Henry Co]] Tenn Whare I learned that Elders [[David Wyman Patten|David Patten]] 
& [[Warren Farr Parrish|Warren Parrish]] had addressed a Letter to Col Copeland Stating that the Sheriff & 
& other officers of [[Benton County, Tennessee|Benton County]] Tenn had issued a writ or [[warrant|warrant]] against them 
& myself the crime [[alleged|alleged]] against us was that we had taught that Christ would [[Second Coming of Jesus Christ|come]] 
in this generation & that we said some individuals would receieve the [[Holy Ghost|Holy Ghost]] i twenty
four hours But as I was absent myself I was not taken but Brothers [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] & [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrish]] 
was taken by an [[armed|armd]] company say 50 in number they were bound under $15.00
fifteen hundred dollars [[bond|bond]] which Brothers [[Seth Utley|Seth Utley]] & [[Albert Petty|Albert Petty]] was their [[bondsman|bondsman]]
on Tuesday following they appeared at court Pled their own cause like [[Paul (NT)|St. Paul]] &
was cleared by the Law for their was no cause of guilt found in them but when the
ungodly mob found the Law would not condemn them they desired to beat them but they were
not permited O thou God of Israel stretch fourth thy hand & save thy Saints O America
hide thy face in Shame & disgrace as the day dawns While thy Sons are Persecuting beating
& Putting to death the Latter Day Saints of God for worshiping God after the dictates of
their own conscience for thou wast built upon the Pillars of freedom Rode from Col Copelands
to Br Tailors after visiting the Academy branch of Church ditance of the day 10 miles

Dec 4, 1843 Hiram Kimball Cr Pay

  
  12 350 Brick at $5 per thayed $61 75   
 19th By 3900 at $5. $19 50   
   $87 25   
   53 90   
   27 35   
  Due on Settlement 92 43     
Settld the Above August 24th 1844

Wednesday


20 July Rode to Br [[Lindsey Anderson Brady|Linzy Braidy's]] distance of the day 20 miles

Thursday


21 rode to a Br [[John Camp|John Camps]] held a Prayer meeting at his house 4 miles

Friday


22 Wrote a Letter to Sister [[Margaret Thompson McMeans Adkins Smoot|Margaret Atkinson]] spent the night at Br [[Alfred Loy|Loys]]

Saturday


23 Took the Parting hand with the Saints rode to [[Randolph Alexander|Randolph Alexander's]] [[Weakley County, Tennessee|Weakly Co]] Tenn 20

Sunday


24 Sunday Preached in the grove by Mr [[Randolph Alexander|Alexander's]] to a large congregation & some believed

Monday


25 Rode to Mr [[John Bowers|Bowers]] Preached at his house spent the night at [[Jeremiah B. Murphy|Jeremiah Murphys]] found
them much believing as well as others distance of the day 6 miles

Tuesday


26 Rode to [[Alexander McKinzie|A. Mckinzies]] spent the night at Mr [[Mr. Hue|Hues]] [[Weakley County, Tennessee|Weakly Co]] Tenn 16 miles

Wednesday


27 Preached at Mr [[Mr. Hue|Hews]] & rode to [[David Crider|David Criders]] [[Gibson County, Tennessee|Gibson County]] Tenn 14 mi

Thursday


28 We herd that a [[mob|mob]] was intending to come against us on Saturday & Sunday

Friday


29 Rode to [[Trenton, Gibson County, Tennessee|Trenton]] Gibson Co Tenn returned to Mr [[David Crider|Criders]] distans 14 mile

Saturday


30 Saturday Preached at [[David Crider|David Criders]] on the Book of Mormon {shorthand}

Sunday


31 Sunday Preached at [[David Crider|D. Criders]] to a large Congregation no mob appeared but I
Baptized Mr David Crider amid darkness, blindness, scoffs, snears, & the [[prejudice|Prejudices]] 
of ungodly men We confirmed him in his family circle I spake with tongues {shorthand}

Monday


Aug 1st Rode to Mr [[Randolph M. Gilbert|R Gilberts]] [[Weakley County, Tennessee|Weakly County]] Tenn distance of the day 25 mile

Tuesday


2 Took JUDE (The [[horse|Mare]] that I had been riding for the last year Which belonged to Br 
[[Samuel Walker West|Samuel West]]) out of the stable to ride to the Green Hill School house to attend our 
appointment & found her vary lame stiff & sick some called her sickness a founder
others the bots others [[poison|Poison]] &c. I rode Jude to meeting & Preached after meeting
I rode her to Mr [[William McClesky|William H Mcleskey]] distance to & from meeting 4 miles which 
was the last time that I or any other Person ever did or ever will ride her in time she
grew wors through the evening. We gave her Sweetend milk & allum water for the bots

1842 Stephen Perry Dr   
 Dec  To 1 load of Corn   
 Jan 20 1843 To 1 load of Corn   
 April 14 To 1 Hym Book 50   
 May 17 Mr Carmdael Dr to Cash to apply on Note   
   3 20   
  To cash 2 00     [sideways text] Settled [end of sideways text]

Wednesday


3 Aug Arose & found Jude still worse we gave her a dose of week [he] Br
[[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] Went to attend a previous appointment for Preaching I tarried to attend 
to Jude my sick beast I led her 1/4 of a mile to Mr Robert Gilberts who was a
horse docter but the mare soon began to fail there was many observations relative
to her decease she soon fell & struggled for about an hour in agony uncommon with
beast & died I opened her found her body clear of bots but full of froth Water
& decay & no one present understood her desease thus ended the life of JUDE
a beast Who hath carried me thousands of miles to Preach the gospel of Jesus 
Christ Also hath carried other Elders many miles on the same errand I am now left
on foot may I be reconciled to all the Providences of God returned to Mr Mcleskeus

Thursday


4 Travled to Br [[Jeremiah B. Murphy|Murphy's]] in 2 1/2 miles of [[Dresden, Weakley County, Tennessee|Dresden]] Weakly Co Tenn 14 miles

Friday


5 Travled to Mr [[Randolph Alexander|Alexanders]] distance 5 miles

Sunday


7 Sunday Preached at Mr [[John Bowers|Bowers]] from 8.9:10:11 chapters of Romans Spent the night at Br Murphys 5 miles

Monday


8 Wrote a Letter to Elders [[James Blakesly|James Blakesley]] & [[G. Dutcher|G. Dutcher]]

Tuesday


9 Wrote a Letter to Br [[David Crider|David Crider]] & rode a [[horse|hors]] of Br [[Jeremiah B. Murphy|Murphy's]] in company with Brother [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] 
to [[Terrapin Creek, Calloway and Graves Counties, Kentucky|Taropen]] KY distance of the day 25 miles

Wednesday


10 Rode to Br [[Levi Taylor|Tailors]] on [[Blood River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Blood River]] distance of the day Wrote a Letter to Br [[Samuel Walker West|West]] 20 miles

Thursday


11 Rode to [[John Gainer|John Gainer's]] Whare I had a happy interview with [[David Wyman Patten|Br]] & [[Phoebe Ann Babcock Patten Bentley|Sister Patten]] Who had just been 
driven from [[Benton County, Tennessee|Benton Co]] Tenn by a [[lawless|lawless]] [[mob|mob]] becaus of pure religion Elders Patten & [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrish]] were 
both hunted by the ungodly [[rabble|rabble]] from place to Place untill Elder Parish left for [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] & Elder Patten 
came to Mr Gainers [[persecution|Persecutions]] rages among the gentiles Behold the [[signs of the times|signs of the times]]. {Distance of the day} 10 miles

Friday


12 Aug Rode in company with Elders [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] & [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] from thence to [[Jonathan Moore Gilbert|J. M Gilbert]] Esq. {distance} 35 mi
Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] informed us that [[Benton County, Tennessee|Benton County]] mob had formed themselves into an independant 
company to beat & Kill the Elders of latter Day Saints if they came into that County Will not 
God be avenged upon such a nation as this O God save thy Saints while [[Babylon|Babylon]] falls

Saturday


13 held a meeting at the Gouldsbys meeting house [[Weakley County, Tennessee|Weekly County]] Tenne Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] Preached I followed him 
rode from meeting to Mr [[John Green|John Greens]] distance of the day 6 miles

Sunday


14 Sunday Preached at the meeting house Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] Preached two discourses upon the 
[[last dispensation|last dispensation]] & gathering from [[Epistle to the Ephesians|Ephe]] 1st 10 After Preaching a contribution was asked for 
me to assist me in Paying Br [[Samuel Walker West|West]] for his [[horse|mare]] which Died in my hands or care the People 
gave me $8.56 eight dollars fifty six cents then rode to Esq [[Jonathan Moore Gilbert|Gilbert's]] Br Patten Preached to the 
People after meetings we Parted with Br Patten & rode to [[Randolph M. Gilbert|R Gilberts]] & spent the night {distance of the day} 6 miles

Monday


15 Rode {with Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]]} to Mr [[Mr. Summers|Summers]] distance 3 miles

Tuesday


16 Preached at the Gouldsbys meeting house & we baptized one Mrs [[Nancy Summers|Summers]] Elder[[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] administered
the ordinance of Baptism to Sister Summers distance of the day 6 miles

Wednesday


17 Rode to Br [[Jeremiah B. Murphy|Murphy's]] 2 miles North of [[Dresden, Weakley County, Tennessee|Dresden]] Weekly Co Tenn distance of the day 16 miles

Thursday


18 Spent the day at Br [[Jeremiah B. Murphy|Murphys]] Writing

Friday


19 Left Br [[Jeremiah B. Murphy|Murphy's]] horse with him & walked to Mr [[Randolph Alexander|Alexander's]] distance of the day 4 miles

Saturday


20 I sat under the Preaching of Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] at Mr [[Randolph Alexander|Alexanders]] after meeting Mr Alexander & his 
[[Myrza Nix Alexander|wife]] came forward for Baptism which was administered unto them by Elder Patten 
after Baptism I took the Parting hand With Elder Patten & returned to Brother [[Randolph Alexander|Alexander's]]

Sunday


21 Sunday Preached at Br [[Randolph Alexander|Alexander's]] from Jer 31ch 22v

Monday


22 Walked to [[Boydsville, Weakley County, Tennessee|Boydsville]] from thence I lost my way But arived in the night at Brother [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapps]] 
vary weary & thankful to find a shelter distance 22 miles

Tuesday


23 Aug Preached at Br [[Lindsey Anderson Brady|Braidy's]] Brothers [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]], [[Isaiah Benton|Benton]], ^&^ [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]] followed me the [[spirit of God|Spirit of God]] 
rested upon us Br [[Isaiah Benton|Benton]] informed us that Elder [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] had receievd a Letter from 
Zion under the hand of Elder [[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|Marsh]] bringing the [[intelligence|inteligence]] that the Saints 
were about to leave [[Clay County, Missouri|Clay County]] and colonize by themselves in consequence 
of a mob that was arising against us & also that Elder Marsh was about 
to visit us probably be at our Conference Brothers Lewis & Benjamin Clapp
& Hendricks & Braidy gave me $5 dollars each making $20 to Pay Br
West for the beast that Died in my hands spent the night at Br Braidys 4 m

Wednesday


24 Travled to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] Whare I found Br [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]] who had a Letter for 
me on perusing it I found it was from my Parents I was rejoiced to hear 
from them the Letter informed me about many friends distance 20 miles

Thursday


25 Wrote two Letters one to My Parents in [[Connecticut|Connecticut]] & the other to [[Joseph Hart, b. 1787|Joseph Hart]] 
an uncle in [[Springfield, Hampden County, Massachusetts|Springfield]] Massachusetts

Friday


26 Spent the day in writing at Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]]

Saturday


27 Rode to [[John Freeman|J Freemans]] & returned to Br [[Levi Taylor|Tailors]] distance 9 miles

Sunday


28 Sunday Rode to [[Thomas Frazier|Thomas Fraziers]] Preached at his house to a large congregation a par of which
was composed of a [[mob|mob]] yet not much disturbance returned to Br [[Levi Taylor|Tailors]] distance 20 miles

Monday


29 Walked to Br [[Albert Smith|Smith's]] & was in company with Elders [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]] & [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] at night we ware 
unexpectedly called upon to go to [[Joseph Chumbley|Joseph Chumbley's]] to have an interview with President [[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|Thomas 
B Marsh]] who came in company with councillor [[Elisha Hurd Groves|Groves]] by order of the [[high council|High Council]] of Zion
to visit the Church in the South to loan monies to purchase lands in Zion We had a spiritual interview 
then returned to Br [[Levi Taylor|Tailors]] for the night 4 miles

Feb 1st 1843

Am Robert commenced Work at W Woodruff
At the abe dat

Rosilla Carter comenced work for
W woodruff March 7th 1843





  
 March 16 Rosilla Carter Dr to 1 pair of shoes 2 00   
  paid the above account May 5th 1843    
 May 12th 1843 Edward Oaks Dr to    
 4 1 Times & Seasons & Neighbor 4 00   
 Jan 25 1844 To Times & Season vol 5 1 99   
  To Tms & Seasons Vol 4 stand 2 25

Tuesday


Aug 30 Visited the Academy Branch of Church Spent the night at Br [[Robert Davis|Davis'es]] 14 miles

Wednesday


31st Rode to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] & returned to Br [[Levi Taylor|Tailors]] on [[Blood River, Henry County, Tennessee|Bloody]] whare I found Presidents 
[[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|Marsh]] & [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] had a happy interview with them distance of the Day 30 miles

Thursday


Sept 1st Travled with Elders [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]] & [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] to Br [[John Camp|Camp's]] [[Terrapin Creek, Calloway and Graves Counties, Kentucky|Taropen]] KY 22 miles

Friday


2 Rode in company with the Saints to attend the Conference at Br [[Henry Thomas Jr.|Henry 
Thomas'es]] [[Damon Creek, Calloway County, Kentucky|Damonds Creek]] Calloway County KY on Friday Sept 2nd 1836 12 miles


A true copy of the procedings of the Tennessee Conference at their meeting 
on [[Damon Creek, Calloway County, Kentucky|Damond's Creek]] Calloway County KY Sept 2nd 1836


Minutes of the procedings of the general Conference of [[Tennessee|Tennessee]] held on [[Damon Creek, Calloway County, Kentucky|Damonds 
Creek]] Calloway County Kentucky Sept 2nd 1836


Elders Present. President [[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|T. B. Marsh]]. President [[David Wyman Patten|D. W Patten]], [[counselor|Councellor]] 
[[Elisha Hurd Groves|E. H Groves]]. Elders W. Woodruff. [[Abraham Owen Smoot|A. O. Smoot]]. & [[Daniel Cathcart|D. Cathcart]] ^[[Benjamin Boydston|Benj Boydstun]]^ President. Marsh 
was duly called to the chair. [[Randolph Alexander|R. Alexander]] was chosen clerk. The Conference 
was opened by singing & Prayer after which the Priest's were called upon to repr
esent their respective Branches. Priest [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Daniel Thomas]], Represents the [[Damon Creek, Calloway County, Kentucky|Damond's 
Creek]] branch who arose & stated that one by the name of [[Henry Thomas, b. 1758|Henry Thomas]] had been added 
since the last Conference none [[expelled|expeled]] this branch is strong in faith & grows in grace
Priest [[Lewis Clapp|Clapp]] represents the [[Terrapin Creek, Calloway and Graves Counties, Kentucky|Taripen]] Branch & stated that one by the name of [[Lewis Allen, Kentucky|Lewis Allen]] 
had been added since the last conference none expeled this branch growing in grace 
with their faces set [[Zionward|Zion ward]]—

Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|A. O. Smoot]] represents the [[Blood River, Henry County, Tennessee|Blood river]] branch in good standing strong in faith & grow^ing in grace^
President [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] represents the [[Sulphur Well, Metcalfe County, Kentucky|Sulphur Well]] Academy Branch in good standing two been 
added since last Conference [[Lewis Copeland|Lewis]] & [[Robert Copeland|Robert Copeland]] & one been expeled from the 
above named Church by the name of [[Emily Dyer|Emily Dyer]]. Also represented three members near 
[[Wyetts Mills, Calloway County, Tennessee|Wyett's Mills]] in good standing. Also the [[Chalk Level, Benton County, Tennessee|chalk levil]] branch in good standing growing
in grace & truth & numbers the same as at the Last Conference, & the [[Eagle Creek, Benton County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]] branch 
in good standing numbering the same as at the last Conference [[Cypress Creek, Benton County, Tennessee|Cyprus]] Branch in a more 
thriving condition than heretofore numbering the same as at the last Conference Also 
four others members in good standing scattered abroad Also three in [[Henderson County, Tennessee|Henderson County]]
near the [[Sulphur Springs, Ohio County, Kentucky|Sulphur Springs]] Baptized since the last Conference Baptized under the hand 
of Elder [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]] Elder Woodruff represented six members in good standing 
in [[Thompson Creek, Weakley County, Tennessee|Thompson's Creek]] branch in [[Weakley County, Tennessee|Weekly County]] Tennessee Who were baptized 
since the Last Conference under the hands of Elders Patten. Woodruff & Smoot
The Conference then took into considerations the Propriety of calling on the Presidency 
of the Seventies by Letter or otherwise for ministers of the gospel from their 
quorums to fill the vacances for Preaching in this region of Country. Wharefore it 
was motioned seconded & carried that Presidents [[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|Marsh]] & [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]], write to 
the said Presidents for six faithful labourers to be sent from their quorums into this 
part of the country. And further resolved that whareas Elders Woodruff & others are
about to leave this region of country for [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] & Zion President Marsh & Patten
write also to the [[Presidency of the High Priesthood|Presidency of the High Priesthood]] at Kirtland requesting them to send 
fourth to this region of country an High Priest of their quorum to watch over this church
in its several branches

Be it further resolved s[ai]d [[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|Marsh]] & [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] Prepare & send a Petition to the Editor 
& Proprietor of the [[Latter Day Saints|Saints Messenger and Advocate]] requesting him to publish in 
addition to the Messenger a Monthly Periodical large enough to contain all the 
interesting or edifying Letters from the Elders abroad. When Conference ajourned 
to 10 oclock next Day Conference met Sept 3rd according to ajornment opened 
by singing & Prayer the case of [[Lucinda Benton|Lucinda Benton]] was Presented who was found 
to have been illegally [[cut off|cut off]] Wherefore she was restored in [[full fellowship|full fellowship]] 
untill she could get a fair trial. A short address was delivered from the chair 
on the necessity of the Tennessee Conference keeping a church record of all the
names belonging to the several Branches of said Conference And also the 
necessity of each branch sending a Priest to represent their branch & to bear the names 
before the general conference of all who have been added since the Last Conference 
& any that may have been [[blotted out|blotted out]]. Further resolved by the Conference that 
the Church Purchase Books to keep a general record of the church. Also that Brother 
[[Johnson F. Lane|Johnston F. Lane]] be chosen & appointed clerk & ordained to the office of an Elder to 
keep the general Church record of the Tennessee Conference accordingly J. F. Lane 
was ordained to the Office of an Elder Also [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Benjamin Clapp]] & [[Randolph Alexander|Randolph Alexander]]. 
Ware each ordained to the office of an Elder the above were ordained under the hands 
of President [[David Wyman Patten|D. W Patten]] Also Br [[Lindsey Anderson Brady|Linzy Braidy]] was ordained under the hands of Priest 
[[Isaiah Benton|Benton]] to the office of a deacon. Conference adjourned untill 2.PM. then met according 
to adjournment opened by singing & Prayer after which a sermon was deliverd by
Counsellor [[Elisha Hurd Groves|Groves]] & followed by President [[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|Marsh]] & then adjourned untill 10 oclock next morning. Met

Sunday


Met Sept 4.th opened by singing & Prayer & a discours deliverd by President [[David Wyman Patten|D W Patten]] from these 
words repent & believe the gospel [[Mark (NT)|Mark]] 1st 15 after which 5 presented themselves for baptism

the congregation repaired to the water whare the ordinance of baptism was administered unto
five persons by President [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]]. Then the people returned to the house & a sermon was deliverd 
by President [[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|Marsh]] on the gifts & graces of the Church after which the [[Lord|Lords supper]] 
was administered & those that were baptized were confirmed by the [[laying on of hands|laying on of hands]] 
of Counsellor [[Elisha Hurd Groves|Groves]] & this interesting Conference closed by singing & Prayer
[[Johnson F. Lane|Johnston F. Lane]] Clerk. Thomas B. Marsh President


[[Elisha Hurd Groves|Elders Grooves]] & [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] [[healed|healed]] by the laying on of hand


As Elder W Woodruff is about to leave for [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] & has been labouring for the 
last year & a half with the churches included in the Tennessee conference & stands in 
need of clothing & money to return to Kirtland Presidents [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] & [[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|Marsh]] called a
contribution of the church & congregation in the time of the aforementioned 
conference to supply Elder W Woodruff's necessities the list of the contribution taken down 
is as follows Brothers [[Henry Thomas Jr.|Henry Thomas]] $5.00 five dollars [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Benjamin Clapp]] $6.00 [[Simeon Hendrickson|Simeon Hendricks]] 
$10.00 [[Jefferson Turnbow|Jefferson Turnbow]] $2.00 In the store. [[Eligah Glasgo|Eligah Glasgo]] 50 cts [[David Crider|David Crider]] 50 cts 
[[John Thomas|John Thomas]] $1.00. [[William Christmas|William Christmas]] 25 cts [[Randolph Alexander|Randolph Alexander]] $5.00. [[James McCartney|James Mccartny]] $2.00 store 
[[Isaiah Benton|Isaiah Benton]] 50 cts [[Henry Loy|Henry Loy]] $2.00 in the store [[Rachael Shultz Turnbow|Rachel Turnbow]] 25 cts [[Oliver Drown|Oliver Drown]] 75 cts [[Alfred Loy|Alfred Loy]] 
$2.00 in the store [[Jordan P. Hendrickson|Jourden Hendricks]] 50 cts [[Henry Thomas, b. 1758|Henry Thomas Sen]] $1.00 [[Jesse Turpin|Jesse Turpin]] $5.00 [[John Camp|John Camp]]
$5.00 [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Daniel S Thomas]] $5.00 [[James Allen|James Allen]] $5.00 in the store. [[Lewis Clapp|Lewis Clapp]] $6.00 [[Lewis Allen, Kentucky|Lewis Allen]] $5.00
[[Lindsey Anderson Brady|Linzy Braidy]] $6.00


Making cash $63.35
In the store $13.00
Total $76.35


The above list of contributions is recorded in the Tennessee Conference records the above list
contains the money W. Woodruff receieved previous to the Conference from Taropen Brethren See [AV 124]

Monday


5th Sept Took the parting hand with the Presidents & Elders & many Beloved Brethren
and Sisters about fifty in number with whom I have sat in conference for the 
last three days which time was spent in a cause of the greatest interest. Wrote 
a Letter to Br [[Samuel Walker West|Samuel West]] & then rode to [[Wadesboro, Calloway County, Kentucky|Waidsborough]] with [[Henry Thomas Jr.|H Thomas]] and
Purchased a coat pattern with the means contributed to me by the Brethren at the
Conference then returned to Br Thomas's distans of the day 14 miles


A true copy of a Bill from President [[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|Thomas B Marsh]] & counsellor [[Elisha Hurd Groves|Elisha. H. Groves]]


Receieved Sept 5th AD 1836 of Willford Woodruff fifty Dollars for the 
Purpose of entering land within the state of [[Missouri|Missouri]] Thomas B Marsh
Elisha H Groves

Tuesday


6 Spent the day at Brother [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Thomas'es]] in writing in the evening I rode in company 
with Elder [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Benjn Clapp]] towards [[Paducah, McCracken County, Kentucky|Paducah]] to visit Sister [[Lucinda Benton|Benton]] & cite her to [[Church trial|trial]] 
to answer to a charge prefered against her by Elder [[Johnson F. Lane|J. F. Lane]] for [[unchristian conduct|unchristian 
conduct]] rode to Parson [[James C. Beaty|Baity's]] a Preacher of the Christian order he receieved 
us in warm friendship as [[disciples|deciples]] of Christ & Elder [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]] & myself retired aside 
from the abodes of men & Prayed unto God to Bless Parson [[James C. Beaty|Baity]] & his houshold 
& we covenanted together not to leave his house untill he would become a 
Latter Day Saint We returned to the house Preached the gospel to him & 
he receieved it with gladness distance of the day 14 miles

Wednesday


7 Arose in the morning & Baptized Parson [[James C. Beaty|Baity]] Went our way left him rejoi
ing rode to Brother [[Isaiah Benton|Bentons]] in [[Paducah, McCracken County, Kentucky|Paducah]]. Elder [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]] made me a present of a fine Pen ^22m^
knife distance 22 miles

Thursday


8 Sept Rode in company with Elder [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]] & [[Isaiah Benton|Br]] & [[Lucinda Benton|Sister Benton]] from [[Paducah, McCracken County, Kentucky|Paducah]] to 
Br [[James C. Beaty|Baity's]] Preached at his house at night {and the [[spirit of God|Spirit of God]] was with us} distance of the day 25

Friday


9 Left Br [[James C. Beaty|Baitys]] on foot & we travled in the rain to Brother [[Henry Thomas Jr.|Henry Thomas'es]] on [[Damon Creek, Calloway County, Kentucky|Damonds 
Creek]] Dined with Br [[Henry Thomas Jr.|Thomas]] from thence we travled to Br [[John Camp|John Camp's]] 
on [[Terrapin Creek, Calloway and Graves Counties, Kentucky|Tarripien]] arived at his house at dark after travling in company with 
Elder [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]] on foot through a rainy day & wadeing through creeks & swamps 
for the distance of 25 miles [[Isaiah Benton|Brother]] & [[Lucinda Benton|Sister Benton]] accompanied us on 
[[horseback|horsback]] but we all arived weary & wet 25 miles

Saturday


10 Arose in the morning sumwhat ill in consequence of the hard tower we 
endured the day previous rode to Elder [[Johnson F. Lane|J. F Lane]] to attend the counsel 
of Elders to take into consideration the case of Sister [[Lucinda Benton|Benton]] the following 
is the Procedings of the court


[[Calloway County, Kentucky|Calloway County]] Kentucky Sept 10th 1836. Minites of a [[disciplinary council|Counsel]] of Elders held at 
the house of Elder [[Johnson F. Lane|Johnston F Lane.]] the [[Church court|Court]] Consisted of four Elders to it W. Woodruff 
[[Abraham Owen Smoot|A. O. Smoot]] [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Benj. L Clapp]] J. F Lane. W Woodruff Was called to the Chair & Conference 
opened by reading the law of the Church Contained in the [[Doctrine and Covenants|Book of Covenants]] & Prayer 
by the President the Court was appointed for the trial of Sister [[Lucinda Benton|Lucinda Benton]] 
who had been [[cut off|Cut off]] illegally the Charge was prefered against her by Elder [[Johnson F. Lane|Lane]] 
for [[unchristian conduct|unchristian conduct]] after which Brother [[Jefferson Turnbow|Jefferson Turnbow]] was called upon 
who arose and stated that he had seen Sister [[Lucinda Benton|Benton]] and some man lying upon a 
pallet together After which Sister [[Margaret Thompson McMeans Adkins Smoot|Margaret Atkinson]] aros & stated that 
Sister [[Lucinda Benton|Benton]] had made some fals & hard statements about her

Sister [[Matilda Kelly Lane Clements|Matilda Lane]] bore testimon to the truth of what Sister [[Margaret Thompson McMeans Adkins Smoot|Akinson]] said 
& further said they could not be reconciled to Sister [[Lucinda Benton|Benton]] unless she repented & confessed 
her sins Sister [[Lucinda Benton|Benton]] was Permitted to speak for herself which she did do and confessed 
& repented of her sins when she was again receieved into the church in [[full fellowship|full fellowship]] 
by the voice of the court & church 
W. Woodruff. Chairman
[[Johnson F. Lane|J. F Lane]] Clerk

Sunday


11 Sept Sunday rode to Br [[John Camp|Camp's]] Preached at his house & communed with the Saints spent 
the night at Father [[Lewis Clapp|Clapp's]] distance of the day 4m

Monday


12 Walked to Br [[Johnson F. Lane|Lanes]] & spent the day in writing 4 miles

Tuesday


13 Spent the day at Brother [[Johnson F. Lane|Lanes]] in writing

Thursday


15 Spent the day at Br [[Oliver Drown|Drowns]] [[John Camp|Camps]]

Friday


16 Spent the day at Br [[Oliver Drown|Drowns]]

Saturday


17 Returned to Br [[John Camp|Camps]] on Saturday & soon I had the happy Privileg of another 
interview with Presidents [[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|Marsh]], [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] & [[Elisha Hurd Groves|Grooves]] & Sister [[Phoebe Ann Babcock Patten Bentley|Patten]] who came 
to Br [[John Camp|Camps]] in a two hors waggon & bound for Zion. [[Missouri|Missouri]] We all tarried at Br Camp's

Sunday


18 Sunday we all met at Br [[Henry Loy|Henry Loy's]] for a meeting & we had a happy time
Presidents [[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|Marsh]] & [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]] Preached & exertations from Elders [[Elisha Hurd Groves|Groves]]. [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]]. [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]]
[[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]]. [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]] & I requested the Elders to [[laying on of hands|lay hands]] upon me for sickness & [[lameness|lameness]] 
Which they did do & I was healed of both Spent the night at Brother [[John Camp|Camp's]] with the Brethren

Monday


Sept 19th Is a day long to be remembered by me & others in Consequence of the interesting 
scenes transpired with the Saints of God in the South. [[Isaiah (OT)|Isaiah]] & others of the Ancient 
Prophets testify to us of the great events of the last days esspecially of the literal
[[gathering of Israel|gathering of Israel]]. They say the Saints shall gather from the East & from the 
West & that the North shall give up and the South keep not back. This interesting 
day had now arived yea the 19th of Sept 1836 when Some of the Saints of God in the 
South began to take their families their Charriots Waggons, their Oxen, their Horses 
their Tents their Armour and moove towards Zion as the [[children of Israel|children of Israel]] 
according to the command of God As followsed Arose in the morning at Br [[John Camp|Camps]] 
& breakfas'ed at his house after which we reparded to the Bank of a stream whare 
Prayers were offered up unto God when President [[Thomas Baldwin Marsh|Marsh]] led a young man into the 
waters of Baptism & he was confirmed upon the bank of the stream under the 
hands of Presidents Marsh, [[David Wyman Patten|Patten]], & [[Elisha Hurd Groves|Grooves]] then we all stood upon our feet &
receieved great Blessings confirmed upon our heads with uplifted hands of the 
three above named Brethren President Marsh being speaker We then all took 
the parting hand with these Beloved [[servants|servents]] of God & with Sister [[Phoebe Ann Babcock Patten Bentley|Patten]] also 
these four friends took their seat in a waggon & set their faces as a flint 
towards Zion not waiting for those that on the same day ware to follow 
their example but with Ox teams Soon after the above named Brethren left 
us Br [[Albert Petty|Albert Petty]] came to us from [[Cypress Creek, Benton County, Tennessee|Cyprus]] Branch with his waggon & family
to join those of the [[Terrapin Creek, Calloway and Graves Counties, Kentucky|Taropen]] Branch who ware going to Zion After spending a short 
time in aranging the waggons & teems the company were Prepared to move forward the 
company consisted of four ^4^ families with three Elders as follows

[[Lewis Clapp|Lewis Clapp]] & his family,  [[John Camp|John Camp]] & his family Albert Petty & his family & 
Elder [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Benjamin Clapp]] with his family. Also Elders [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstun]] & [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart]] This Compa^ny^ 
Chose Elder Benjamin Boydstun as their leader on the road to [[Zion|Zion]] this company 
of the South were principly the first fruits of my ministry Some were baptized 
by Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] They numbered six male members & five female & 10 ten children 
& one [[servant|servent]] making 22. twenty two in all This company of faithful Saints (after 
taking the parting hand with their friends on [[Terrapin Creek, Calloway and Graves Counties, Kentucky|Taropen]]) moved forward on their 
Journey in good spirits & with joy {[On] the [illegible] of Sister Martha Barker who desired to return back thinking it after all too great to leave her 
friends. I immediately set before her the danger of returning to Babylon and encouraged her and she became reconciled and continued her journey.} I rode 
with them this first Days travel as far as the South fork of [[Mayfield, Graves County, Kentucky|Mayfield]] whare we all camped 
for the night after pitching our tents & taking supper I assembled this small [[Camp of Israel|Camp of Israel]] 
together at Br [[Albert Petty|Albert Petty's]] tent to address them for the last time & after they were assembled 
I arose to address them & although the rain desended in torrents so 
that we were wet through a good tent yet my soul was vibrated & fired with 
emotions & feeling of no ordinary nature I endeavord to lay before them the worth and 
value of the cause they were ingaged in & that they were the first in fullfiling the 
Prophets who spake of the South's giving up ^or keeping not back^ & that it would be recorded upon the
Archives of heaven to be read in the day of eternity that they were the first fruits of the 
South who had spread their tents for [[Zion|Zion]]. I also instructed them about travling by 
the way they all covenanted to give heed to Elder [[Benjamin Boydston|Boydstuns]] Preceps as they had chosen 
him as their leader. When I closed I was followed By Elders Boydstun, [[Daniel Cathcart|Cathcart,]] & [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]] 
who spake in the [[spirit of God|spirit of God]] & with feeling of the deepest interest When this 
edifying interview closed by our kneeling & I addressed a throne of grace & implored
the [[mercy of God|mercy of God]] to rest upon the camp that they might all reach Zion in Peace {distance} 8 miles

Tuesday


Sept 20th Arose & found all well in the camp notwithstanding the severity of the weather 
through the night I breakfast'ed at Br [[Albert Petty|Petty;s]] tent & then took the last parting hand 
with those beloved Saints untill I meet them in [[Zion|Zion]] or els whare (May the blessings 
of God attend them forever) I then rode to Mr [[Mr. Calvert|Calvert's]] on the bank or ford of 
[[Brush Creek, Graves County, Kentucky|Brush Creek]] Graves County KY. & spent the night distance 20 miles

Wednesday


21 Spent the day in visiting the neighbourhood & the night at Mr [[Mr. Johnston|Johnston's]] 6 miles

Thursday


22 Preached at Mr [[Thomas Frazier|Fraziers]] at the ford of [[Brush Creek, Graves County, Kentucky|brush creek]] got one subscriber for [[Latter Day Saints|M & Ad]]
was some opposed by a [[Presbyterian|pryspeterian]] Priest & wrote a Letter for Sister [[Susanna Bishop|Bishop]]

Friday


23 Rode to [[Feliciana, Graves County, Kentucky|Feliciana]] from thence took the Dresden road & with difficulty crossed the 
[[Obion River, Weakley County, Tennessee|Obine]] swamp & creek my horse frequently wallowing in the cyprus slues nearly und
er water & mud from thence I rode to Br [[Jeremiah B. Murphy|Jere Murphy's]] [[Weakley County, Tennessee|Weakly County]] Tenn 
whare I found the saints well & rejoiced to Meet distance of the Day 30 miles

Saturday


24 Rode to Elder [[Randolph Alexander|R. Alexander's]] & was rejoiced to find hi houshold well 5 miles

Sunday


25 Preached on Sunday at Br [[Randolph Alexander|Allexanders]] & Baptized 2 two persons & then 
communed with the Saints had an interesting time because of the [[spirit of God|spirit 
of God]] upon us after meeting we took the parting hand with Br [[Jeremiah B. Murphy|Jeremiah 
B Murphy]] & his wife who started on a Journey to visit friends in the South

Monday


26
26 Spent the day at Br [[Randolph Alexander|Alexanders]] in writing Wrote two Letters one to [[Abel B. Wilson|Abel B Willson]] 
& the other to President [[Oliver Cowdery|O. Cowdery]] at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] I discontinued the [[Latter Day Saints|M & AD]] 
that was sent to 25 persons in the South Country I also sent one Subscriber

Tuesday


27 Was Joined by Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] we rode to Br [[Emanuel Masters Murphy|Immanuel Murphys]] Preached at his house rode 15 m

Wednesday


28 Rode to Elder [[Randolph Alexander|Alexander's]] Spent the day at his house distance 6 miles

Thursday


29 Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] returned to [[Blood River, Henry County, Tennessee|Bloody]] I rode to [[William Glasgow|Wm Glasgow]]  Preached at his house 5

Friday


30 Rode to Br [[Emanuel Masters Murphy|Immanuel Murphy's]] {Distance} 2 miles

Saturday


Oct 1st Rode to Br [[Randolph Alexander|Alexander]] {with Brother [[Emanuel Masters Murphy|Murphy]]} {Distance of the day} 6 miles

Sunday


2 Sunday Preached at Mr [[Simpson Alexander|Simpsons Alexander's]]

Monday


3 Spent the evening at Br [[Randolph Alexander|Alexanders]]

Tuesday


4 Rode 2 miles & returned 6th Spent the day at Elder Alexandes 2 miles

Wednesday


5 Spent the day riding in the barrens with Elder [[Randolph Alexander|Alexander]] after his cattle 12m

Friday


7 Rode in company with Elder [[Randolph Alexander|Alexander]] & [[Warren Smith|Warren Smith]] & their families to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] 
& Perhaps the last time that I shall visit the place from thence to Mr [[Johnathan Alexander|Johnathan 
Alexanders]] Preached at his house at candle light distance of the day 30 miles

Saturday


8 Rode {with Elder [[Randolph Alexander|Alexander]]} to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] distance of the day 8 miles

Sunday


9 Sunday Preached at Sister [[Sarah Frazier Turpin Brailey Sharp Murray|Fraziers]] was followed by Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] then rode to 
[[Johnathan Alexander|Johnathan Alexanders]] Preached at his house at candle light distance of the day 18 miles

Monday


10 Baptized two Persons [[Warren Smith|Warren Smith]] & his [[Lydia Alexander Smith|wife]] then took the Parting hand with 
Elder [[Randolph Alexander|Alexander]] & [[Myrza Nix Alexander|wife]] & other SaithB Saints & friends Sister [[Margaret Thompson McMeans Adkins Smoot|Margarett
Atkinson]] with the rest & then Rode to visit the [[Sulphur Well, Metcalfe County, Kentucky|Sulpher Well]] Academy branch & 
Preached a funeral sermon in the evening at Widow [[Elizabeth Autry Frazier|Frazier's]] was followed by Brs 
[[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & [[Jesse Turpin|Turpin]] much of the [[spirit of God|spirit of God]] rested upon us distance of the day 10 miles

Tuesday


11 Baptized two persons took the parting hand with the Saints & Rode to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] on [[Blood River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Bloody]] 
Preached for the last time with this branch of Beloved Saints & was followed by Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] 
& Priest;s [[Isaiah Benton|Benton]] & [[Jesse Turpin|Turpin]] we had an interesting meeting we communed together
may God save the Saints Rode to Br [[Albert Smith|Smiths]] distance of the day 11 miles
May 21, 1843 Francis Puller Dr to H Blank Book 125

Wednesday


12 Oct Retired in company with Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|A. O. Smoot]] unto the banks of [[Blood River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Bloody River]] aside from 
the abodes of men to spend some time in Prayer & Praise to God & to Perform a solemn 
duty that is required of all the Elders of Israel whose testimony is rejected by this generation 
while they are Preaching the gospel of JESUS CHRIST & bearing testimony of his NAME
After we had [[cleansed|Cleansed]] our Bodies with pure watter & also with Spirits of [[strong drink|strong drink]] this
not by commandment but from choice We then according to commandment [[cleansed|clensed]] our hands & feet
& bore testimony unto God against the [[Benton County, Tennessee|Benton County]] Mob & also against [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] & many others 
who had rejected our testimony We enjoyed a solemn, spiritual, & interesting season we 
retired from the water in the [[spirit of God|spirit of God]] & spent the night for the last time at [[Levi Taylor|Brother]] &
[[Leonora Cannon Taylor|Sister Taylors]] With the Brethren & Sisters. beneath this roof I have spent some of the most
interesting seasons of my life for the last two years Receieved 4 four subscribers for the 
[[Latter Day Saints|M & Advocate]]

Thursday


13 Took the parting hand with [[Levi Taylor|Br]] & [[Leonora Cannon Taylor|Sister Taylor]] & their houshold & all the Saints in the [[Blood River, Henry County, Tennessee|Bloody]]
Branch & travled in company with Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & Priests [[Jesse Turpin|Turpin]] to Br[[Johnson F. Lane|Lane's]] this is
the first days Journey for [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] Ohio distance of the day 18 miles

Friday


14 Travled to Br [[Isaac Hendricks|Hendricks]] spent the night at Br [[Alfred Loy|Alfred Loys]] 3 miles

Saturday


15 Preached at Br [[David Kelly|Kelleys]] 3 miles

Sunday


16 Sunday Preached at Father [[Joseph Greenwood|Greenwood's]] & [[baptized|Baptized]] one [[Mary Kelly|Mary Kelley]] then travled to 
[[Henry Loy|Henry Loys]] Preached at his house distance of the day 6 miles

Monday


17 Travled to [[Damon Creek, Calloway County, Kentucky|Damonds Creek]] Calloway County KY. Spent the night at [[Henry Thomas Jr.|H Thomas'es]] {Distance} 12 miles

Tuesday


18 Spent the day in writing & Preached at Father [[Henry Thomas, b. 1758|Thomas'es]]

Wednesday


19 Travled with my Colleagues [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & [[Jesse Turpin|Turpin]] through the rain to Br [[James C. Beaty|Beatys]] [[Clarks River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Clarks River]] 
Caloway County KY. distance 15 miles

Thursday


20 Oct Spent the day at Br [[James C. Beaty|Beaty's]] in writing or copying journal

Friday


21 Preached at Br [[James C. Beaty|Beaty's]]

Saturday


22 Preached at Br [[James C. Beaty|Beatys]] & [[baptized|Baptized]] one Mrs [[Judith Scott Beaty|Beaty]]

Sunday


23 Sunday Preached at Br [[James C. Beaty|Beatys]] & Baptized 1 his [[Margaret Beaty Hill|Daughter]] Also. Ordained 
Brother James Beaty to the Office of a Priest he had been a Christian Preacher
for several years communed with the Saints had a spiritual time & it was the 
last meeting that I held in the South within the limits of the Tennesse Confer^ence^

Monday


24 Took the parting hand with Priest [[James C. Beaty|Beaty]] & his family & travled with Elder 
[[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & Priest [[Jesse Turpin|Turpin]] to [[Paducah, McCracken County, Kentucky|Paducah]] Mccracken County KY. Spent the
night at Br [[Isaiah Benton|Benton's]] distance of the day 25 miles

Tuesday


25 For the first time in life I wen aboard a Steam Boat to journey I took a birth 
with my colleagues aboard the AID at 8 o'clock AM. Names of the Islands er
Passed through the day are as follows Tennessee, Cumberland, Three Sisters, & 
the Golconda island Also Towns [[Smithland, Livingston County, Kentucky|Smithland]] distance of the day About 100. miles

Wednesday


26 The Tempest past the Aid at 7oclock AM While she was wooding we past the 
following islands. Cincinnati Towhead, Wabash, Dimond's, Towns, Shawney, 
Mount Vernon, & Ivensville Remained at [[Evansville, Vanderburgh County, Indiana|Ivensville]] over night about 20 miles 
above the mouth of the Wabash River Which we past I Purchased A Cloak of
[[William Smith|William Smith]] one of the Deckhands on board the Aid I paid him $5.00 dollars 
for the same distance of the day (Paid on board the AID $2. for passage) 100 miles

Thursday


27 Left the Aid at 7 A.M & went aboard the HAVANA. We Past Sprinkelsburg
[[Owensboro, Daviess County, Kentucky|Owensborough]], [[Troy, Perry County, Indiana|Troy]], [[Hawesville, Hancock County, Kentucky|Hayville]], [[Cloverport, Breckinridge County, Kentucky|Clover]], [[Rome, Perry County, Indiana|Rome]], & cast Anchor about 12 oclock. 
at night in consequence of the fog Distance of the day 100 miles

Friday


28 Raised the steam at Daylight but soon run aground but liberated without damage 
the fog cleared at 8 oclock. We soon past a steam boat that had sunk She 
struck a snag stove her hull & went Down We past many boats through 
the day & the Havana broak her wheel against a flat bottom boat Passed New 
Albany at 2 oclock entered the canal at the [[Ohio Falls, Clark County, Indiana|Ohio falls]] passed through 3 locks 
arived at [[Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky|Louisville]] at 6.PM Paid $2.50 cts Passage aboard the Havana KETON [Cave]
Capt the Havana run about 10 miles.per.hour distance of the Day 100 miles
their was 12 steamers at anchor at Luisville Priest [[Jesse Turpin|Turpin]] went aboard a boat 
for [[Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio|Cincinnati]] & Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & myself left Luisville to visit his kinsman in [[Owenton, Owen County, Kentucky|Owington]] 
that he had not visited since he was five years of age We took the Frankford
turnpike rode Walked 4 miles & Put up at a tavern for the night {distance of the day} 104 miles

Saturday


29 Walked to Middletown from thence to [[Boston, Nelson County, Kentucky|Boston]] & [[Simpsonville, Shelby County, Kentucky|Simpsonsville]] & [[Shelbyville, Shelby County, Kentucky|Shelbyville]] spent the 
night in Shelbyville at Mr Staples Inn distance of the day 30 miles

Sunday


30 Sunday Walked from [[Shelbyville, Shelby County, Kentucky|Shelbyville]] to Mr Clemmons ferry on the Kentucky river 
25 miles below [[Frankfort, Franklin County, Kentucky|Frankford]] crossed at the ferry to Mr [[William Rowlett|William Rowletts]] spent the night 
at his house he is an unkle of Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoots]] distance of the day 30 miles

Monday


31st Walked to Widow [[Elizabeth Green Smoot Bishop|Elizabeth Smoots]] Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoots]] sister in Law it was an affecting 
meeting between them as it was the first time they ever met from thence to 
Col [[Joseph W. Rowlett|Joseph Rowletts]] another kinn of Elder Smoots it was a happy meeting &
we met a welcome reception distance 4 miles

Tuesday


Nov 1st Spent the Day in writing at Col [[Joseph W. Rowlett|Rowletts]]
Wednesday to

Friday


2 Spent three days at Col [[Joseph W. Rowlett|Rowletts]] in copying my Journal i.e. 2 3 & 4th of Nov. I held a number 
of interviews within the time with Mr [[William Clements|William Clemmonds]] A [[American Revolution|Revolutionary]] Soldier Aged 83 years

Saturday


5th NOV Spent the day at Col [[Joseph W. Rowlett|Joseph Rowletts]] in reading A Book bearing this title PRINCIPLES OF NATURE 
BY [[Elihu Palmer|ELIHU PALMER]] in 1806 third edition. Mr Palmer being a decided Deist his object in this work
was to overthrow the vailidty & testimony of the scriptures or Prophet & Apostles And after ende-
avouing to take the advantage by gathering together in one combined mass all the inconsistences, folies,
& eviles af a sectarian generation & heaping them upon the true Church of Christ When ther is no
more concord or connection between the two now than between the Pharasees, Sausees
Herodians, & Christ & the Apostles eighteen hundred years ago. He then says that the testimony
of Christ has failed & not fulfilled according to his word & for proof of his assertion he
voted the 24th Chapter of Math & says that in that Chapter Christ prophesied that the fall of
Jerusalem The Comeing of Christ & the end of the world Would take place in the gener
ation & he declares it did not take place & in consequence of this Mr Palmer makes the seceeping
conclusion that the Bible is fals & Jesus Christ an imposter But let Mr Palmer hold
untill that the Prophesy is fulfilled according to the declaration of Jesus Christ & all will be well
& the world will feel the power of natuers God See Page 100 [FIGURE] Preached at Col
[[Joseph W. Rowlett|Rowletts]] at candle light I followed Elder Smoot

Sunday


6th Sunday Rode to [[William Reed Smoot|William Smoot's]] Preached at his house distance of the day 7 miles

Monday


7th Sold one [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon's]] & Rode to [[Owenton, Owen County, Kentucky|Owenton]], Owen County, KY on the day of the 
[[election|election]] to vote for President &c at first they endeavor'd to Deprive Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & my
self from voting because we were strangers but after employing some Judges &
Col [[Joseph W. Rowlett|J. Rowlett]] in our favor We gave our vote for Mr [[Martin Van Buren|Vanburen]] for President & 
Col [[Richard Mentor Johnson|R. M. Johnson]] for Vice President We then returned to Mr [[Reed Smoot|Reed Smoots]] & spent the 
night with him distance of the day 16 miles

Tuesday


8th Walked to Col [[Joseph W. Rowlett|Rowletts]] spent the day writing 2 miles

Wednesday


9th Walked to Mr [[Gustavus A. Clements|Gustavus A Clements]] & Preached at his house distance of the day 5 mi

Thursday


10th Rode to Mr [[Jacob Rasor|Jacob Rasor's]] his [[Martha Frances Rowlett Raisor|wife]] & Sister [[Nancy Ann Rowlett Smoot Taylor|Nancy Taylor]] ware own Sisters Preached at
his house I followed Elder Smoot Spent the night at Mr Rasor's and receieved the
intelligence of the burning of the city of Louisville one half of which I understood was desiroved
on Sunday the 6th Which accounts for the report We herd on Sunday as it was the blowing
Up the Buildings with Poder to get them out of the way of the fire And not thunder 6 miles

Friday


11th Rode to Mr Reed Smoots from thence to Col [[Joseph W. Rowlett|Joseph Rowletts]] Preached at his house 3 miles

Saturday


12th Spent the day at Col [[Joseph W. Rowlett|Rowletts]] (The above account of the burning of Louisville is fals report)

Sunday
