13th Preached at Col [[Joseph W. Rowlett|Rowlett]] on Sunday procured 2 subscribers for [[Latter Day Saints|M[essenger] & Ad[vocate].]]

Monday


14th Rode to [[Owenton, Owen County, Kentucky|Owington]] Preached in the courthouse at night to a large congregation spent the
night at the inn of [[William Brown|Williams Browns]] distance of the day 6 miles

Tuesday


15th Walker to Esq [[Mr. Hue|Hues]] 5 miles South of the big bone lick distance 25 miles

Wednesday


16th Visited the [[Big Bone Lick, Boone County, Kentucky|big bone lick]] Boone County, KY This is the place Whare those nmoth or 
[[fossils|large bones]] of enormous size were dug from the earth & have been exhibited in many 
Parts of Europe & America it is conjectured those animals while in the lick got mired & 
Perished it is said by the measurment of the bones that those animals were about
36 feet in length & 15 in hight no record yet gives us any account of these animals
will not some record of the [[Nephites|Nephites]] yet tell us From thence we past through
Florence & spent the night with at Mr [[Mr. Sandford|Sandfords]] distance 25 miles

Thursday


17th Went to [[Covington, Miami County, Ohio|Covington]] Crossed the [[Ohio River, United States|Ohio river]] into [[Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio|Cincinnati]] visited the city & 
saw Conway & Webster Who informed me that Brother [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1814|Asahel H Woodruff]] had
located himself in [[Terre Haute, Vigo County, Indiana|Terrehaute Indiania]] & trading in Books in company with [[Robert A. Smith|Robert Smith]]
I saw the dead & wounded carried from aboard the Flora 3 dead 10 scalded by the Bursting
of the pipes Spent the night in [[Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio|Cincinnati]] on board the Robert Emmet distance 6 miles

Sunday


18th Nov Left [[Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio|Cincinnati]] on board the Robert Emmet passted the little Miami River arived at [[Portsmouth, Scioto County, Ohio|Portsmouth]] ^distance 118 mil^

Sunday


19 In the morning I saw a large Buck swiming down the river three men left the Emmet in 
a yawl & persued the deer they soon overtook him grappl'd him by the horns nocked 
him in the head with their oars then cut his throat & broat on board the steam boat
cut off his head & stuck it upon the top of the liberty pole with his hornes spread 
for a guide of the Pilot The steam boat travled during this day & night being
Sunday to [[Parkersburg, Wood County, Virginia|Parkersburg]] (distance) (Paid on board the Emmet $3.50) 162 miles

Sunday


20 Sunday travled from Parkersburg through Homridy 12 miles from thence to Wellsville
I visited [[Wheeling, Ohio County, Virginia|Wheeling]] during the day Wheeling is in Virginia this is the first time I ever was in 
the State distance of the day 137 miles
the whole distance of the 3 above days travels from Cincinnati to [[Wellsville, Columbiana County, Ohio|Wellsville]] 417 miles

Monday


21st In the morning had a happy interview with Priest [[Jesse Turpin|Turpin]] in [[Wellsville, Columbiana County, Ohio|Wellsville]] visited the town Spent 
the day at Elder [[Samuel Burwell|Samuel Burwells]] in Wellsville

Tuesday


22 Spent the day at Elder [[Samuel Burwell|Burwell's]] in [[Wellsville, Columbiana County, Ohio|Wellsville]] Columbiana County Ohio in the evening Elder
Burwell returned home we had a happy interview with him

Wednesday


23 We took the Stage at [[Wellsville, Columbiana County, Ohio|Wellsville]] Paid $4.00 fare to [[Chardon, Geauga County, Ohio|Chardon]] we travled to [[Newton Falls, Trumbull County, Ohio|Nutons 
falls]] & spent the night at the stage office distance of the day 47 miles

Thursday


24 Travled to [[Chardon, Geauga County, Ohio|Chardon]] within 9 miles of Kirtland & as we were about to leave the
stage to go our way we vary Providentially was made known to Elder [[Henry Garlick Sherwood|Henry
Sherwood]] who was on his way to [[Tennessee|Tennessee]] to watch over the Churches in
that region for a season it was a happy meeting I wrote a Letter to the Churches in
the South we spent the night writing & conversing untill 12 0clock upon the things of
the Kingdom Spent the night at Mr Cyrus Canfields distance 3 33 miles

Friday


Nov 25th Took the parting hand with Elder [[Henry Garlick Sherwood|Sherwood]] I then set out in company with Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] on 
foot in a hard snowstorm for [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] We came in sight of the [[Kirtland Temple, Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|temple]] before we reach'd 
the villedge this being the first sight I ever had of the house of the Lord I ex^c^laimed I behold
the glory of the Lord & the covering We soon entered the village & spent one of the happiest
days of my life in visiting the house of the LORD & the Presidents & the Elders of the church I
was truly rejoiced to again strike hands with President Joseph Smith Jn. & many other beloved
Saints of God who are rolling on the mighty [[work of God|work of God]] & of Israel after being seperated from 
them about 2 1/2 years & amoung the rest I was filled with Joy with the Privilege of again striking
hands with Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Warren Parrish]] & also being made acquainted with his companion Sister 
[[Martha H. Raymond Parrish|Parish]] their is an enjoyment in meeting our Brethren & companions in tribulation that the 
world knows not off Because it flows from a celestial source After spending a short time 
in conversation With the friends A more important scene was now to open to my view than Kings 
ever saw or Princes ever Knew in this generation which was to visit the Temple of the Lord & its 
contents Elder Smoot & myself visited each appartment of the house accompanied by 
Elder Warren Parrish & I must confess the scenery is indisscribable When I entered the
threshhold of the house & entered the lower room their was a great solemnity if not of Awe 
immediately overwhelmed me I felt indeed as if my footsteps were in the Temple of the Lord after 
walking into the [[pulpits|Pulpets]] erected for the Priesthoods & viewing the curtains all bespeaking that 
grandure, salemnity & order that nothing short of wisdom from GOD could invent we then visited
the upper rooms & there viewed four [[Egyptian mummies|Egyptian mumies]] & also the [[Book of Abraham|Book of Abram]] written with
his own hand & not ownly the [[hieroglyphics|hyreroglyphics]] but also many figures that this precious treasure 
contains are calculated to make a lasting impression upon the mind yea indelibly stamped upon the
memory as a nemonicle table not to be erased many other important views I was Privileged with in the

23.75 miles since 31st of May 1836
upper story the school rooms belfry &c all indicating great Architecture & wisdom we then
spent some time in visiting the Bank & Printing office. But wonder on wonder stricks my 
sense to look into the casket of the great work of Israels God in these [[last days|last Days]] as the [[Joseph Smith Jr.|Prophet]] 
exclaims he does things we looked not for:Two & a half years since I left [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] with my 
Brethren in their Poverty to go fourth to visit our Brethren in tribulation in [[Zion|Zion]] then our
brethren in Kirtland were poor dis^s^pised & even looked upon By the pomp of babylon with disda^in^ 
& disgrace who stood waiting with egar eager eyes to behold them sink into forgetfulness But 
how chang'd the scene now I behold a cheerfulnes beaming from every countenance that 
indicates Prosperity & the noise of the ax & the hammer & the sight of their walls
& dwellings newly erected & their Bank & market & esspecially [[house of God|house of God]] speak
in language loud as thunder that they will have a city in prosperity in spite of all 
the [[false prophets|fals Prophets]] of Baal or even Earth or hell because God is with them & his [[Kirtland Temple, Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Temple]] 
stands in honor of his Kingdom while [[Babylon|Babylon]] begins to wonder & will soon perish
We spent the day with Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrish'es]] distance of the day 9 miles
The money I expended in my travels from [[Paducah, McCracken County, Kentucky|Paducah]] KY to Kirtland Ohio fees aboard
steamboats & stages & board lodgings &c was $16.65 & Also I Paid $5.00 dollars for a 
cloak making $21.65 cts in all

Saturday


26 Nov Visited President & Doct [[Oliver Cowdery|Cowdery]] at the Printing office & made a general settle
ment with them for the [[Latter Day Saints|M[essenger] & Advocate]] for the subscribers of the South I gave them
9 new subscribers & Paid them $41.50 cts for the Papers receieved counsel from Pres
idents [[Joseph Smith Jr.|Smits]] & [[Sidney Rigdon|Rigdon]] returned to Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrishes]] house & spent the day in writing

Sunday


27 Nov Upon this Lords day I with Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] accompanied Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] to the [[house of the Lord|house 
of the Lord]] for the first time to Behold the congregation of the Saints assembled 
within its walls for the purpose of [[worshipping|worshiping]] God it was truly an interesting
scene it brought a lengthy catalogue of transactions contemplations & experience 
of my youth to my mind & this days experiance fulfilled many things of a spiritual 
nature Which I had looked for A number of years which I viewed as Promises from from 
God after I entered the house & was seated I cast my eyes upon the pulpits aranged in order 
for the High Priest I beheld the Patriarch or Father [FIGURE] [[Joseph Smith Sr.|Smith]] standing in the upper Pulpet
& President [[Joseph Smith Jr.|Joseph Smith Jr]] & Elder [[Jared Carter|[BLANK] Carter]] in theone below & in the third Elders
[[Parley Parker Pratt|Parley]] & [[Orson Pratt|Orson Pratt]] & [[Warren Farr Parrish|W Parrish]] was seated soon Elder Carter arose & opened 
meeting by Prayer & then [[preach the gospel|Preached the gospel]] unto us & was followed by President 
Joseph Smith jr when meeting was dissmissed & after an intermishion of an hour we 
again met in the house of the Lord When I was called into the stand in Company with Elder 
Smoot & requested to Preach to the people I opened by Prayer & read the LVI Chapter of 
[[Book of Isaiah|Isaiah]] & made some brief remarks upon the same & gave a sketch of my travels in the South
after Which I was followed by Elder Smoot When I was blessed with the privilege of 
communing with a multitude of Saints in the [[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]] assembled together 
from the east, west, North & South many with whom I had been intimately acquainted 
I truly felt to thank God that the promis of God had beenn verifyed unto me
by giving me a seat within his house & within his WALLS {better} AS of Sons & of 
daughters Their was four Confirmed after the sacrament under the 
hands of Elder [[Orson Hyde|O Hide]] President [[Joseph Smith Jr.|J Smith]] addressed the congragation & the 
meeting Closed Spent the night at Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|W Parrish's]]

Monday


28 NOV Spent the day in [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] visiting friends & the night with Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|W Parrish]]

Tuesday


29 Spent the day in writing wrote two Letters one to my Parents & the others to Br [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1814|Asahel ^Woodruff^]]

Wednesday


30 Setteled with Elder [[Reynolds Cahoon|Reynolds Cahoon]]. for the subscriptions put into my hands by the 
Saints of the South Country for the building of the [[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]] in [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] Ohio 
I Paid him one dollar which was all the back money that was due this made $91.75 cts 
that I had the charge off that I forwarded for the house I also Purchased a [[Latin|Latten]] 
Grammer of Elder [[Parley Parker Pratt|P Pratt]] for $1.12 1/2 I am now expecting to enter upon a course of study may 
the Lord open my way in temporal & spiritual thing that I may be usful In my day & 
Generation have a good warfare keep the faith & receieve a crown of Glory

Thursday


1st Dec Reparded to the house of the Lord Whare Father [[Joseph Smith Sr.|Smith]] met a number of Saints to Pronounced 
upon them a [[patriarchal blessing|Patriarchal Blessing]] I herd those blessing Pronounced upon them which
was great & glorious Spent the evening at Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrishes]] accompanied by Brother 
[[Joseph Smith Jr.|Joseph Smith jr]] which was a sosiable & interesting interview

Friday


2 I Wrote a Letter to Brother's [[Azmon Woodruff, b. 1802|Azmon]] & Thompson Woodruff it being the first communication 
between us for two years. I also Wrote a Letter to Col [[Joseph W. Rowlett|Joseph Rowlett's]]

Saturday


3 Traded with Brother [[Jacob Bump|Bump]] to the amount of $12.89cts in goods

Sunday


4 Sunday I went up to the [[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]] to worship Elder [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] Preached in the forepart of 
the day Several spoke in the latter Part of the day President [[Sidney Rigdon|Rigdon]] called a vote 
of the Church to discountenance the use intirely of all liquors from the Church in 
sickness & in health except wine at the sacraments & for external Washings the 
vote was carried eunanimously Spent the night with Elder Parish

Monday


5th Dec This Monday morning in company with Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] I entered the school & commenced 
studying the [[Latin|Lattin]] grammer under the instruction of Professor [[H. M. Hawes|Haws]] I commenced 
boarding also this morning with Brother [[Thomas Bond|Bond]] at $2.00 per week I Paid him $10.00 
dollars in advance
Tuesday to

Saturday


6. 7. 8. 9. 10th was spent in school in the evening of the 10th I wrote two Letters 
one to Elder [[Randolph Alexander|Alexander]] & the other to Sister [[Margaret Thompson McMeans Adkins Smoot|M. Atkinson]] both in [[Tennessee|Tennessee]]

Sunday


11 Sunday morning after an interview with Priest [[Jesse Turpin|Turpin]] I went up to the [[house of God|house 
of God]] to worship & O what a meeting may it be printed upon my heart as 
a memorial forever FOR on this day the [[God of Israel|God of Israel]] sharply reprooved this 
stake of Zion ([[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]]) through the Prophets & Apostles for all our Sins & 
backslidings & Also a timely warning that we may escape the Judgments of 
God that otherwise will fall upon us Even the case of the travels of the [[Zion|Camp]] of 
the Saints from Kirtland to Zion in 1834 was presented to us for an example 
{O God stay thy hand and judgment on Kirtland O Wilford
remember this warning escape judgment lest thou fall O God save me for Christ's sake}
12. 13. 14. 15. 16 17 Spent the past week in school in the [[house of the Lord|Lords house]]

Sunday


18 Sunday I went up to the [[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]] to worship Sermon deliverd By Elder 
[[William Smith|William Smith]] Elder [[Joseph Young|Joseph Young]] administered the Sacrament President [[Joseph Smith Jr.|J Smith jr]] 
Solumnized the rights of [[matrimony|Matrimony]]. at Candlelight. I Preached at Mr Daytons was 
followed by Elders [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] & [[Joseph Bates Noble|Nobles]]
Monday to

Tuesday


19, 20 was spent in school I commenced Studying the [[Greek|GREEK]] GRAMMER on Monda the 19th Dec ^1836^

Tuesday


20 At Candlelight I repaired to the [[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]] for a meeting With the quorum of 
the Seventies The third Seventy had been chosen & the business of this meeting was to 
organize them & ordain them. but as they were not all Present they ware not organized

their was ^27^ twenty Seven of the third Seventy ordained to the [[Melchizedek Priesthood|High Priesthood]] & as me
-mbers of the third Seventy. Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Abram O Smoot]] was among the number which
fulfills what I Pronounced upon his head by the Spirit of Prophecy. On the 30th of 
June while in [[Tennessee|Tenne]] See June 30th 1836. Those were ordained under the hands 
of Presidents [[Hazen C. Aldrich|Aldrich]], [[Joseph Young|Young]], & [[Zebedee Coltrin|Coltrin]]. We had an interesting meeting Much of the 
[[spirit of prophecy|spirit of Prophecy]] was Poured out upon those Presidents while ordaining the third 
Seventy they Proclaimed great & marvelous things upon their heads President 
Young had visions while Performing this ordinance

Thursday


22nd I attended Prayer meeting in the [[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]] at night

Saturday


24 Spent the Past week in School recon'd all before this

Sunday


25 Sunday went up to the [[house of God|house of God]] to worship & herd a [[discourse|discourse]] from Brother [[Samuel Smith|Sam^uel^
Smith]] Brother [[Hyrum Smith|Hiram Smith]] Broak bread which closed the meeting Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] 
was quite sick but healed by the [[laying on of hands|laying on of hands]]

Tuesday


27 Met at the [[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]] at Candle light with the quorum of the Seventies the congregation
consisted of about one hundred Elders of Israel of the 1st, 2, & 3rd Seventies it is expected
they will meet every Tuesday night through the winter for the Purpose of worshiping 
God & [[sanctifying|sanctifying]] themseves before him. Elder ^[[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]]^ was again taken sick
Wednesday to

Saturday


28. 29. 30 & 31st was Principly spent in taking care of Elder [[Abraham Owen Smoot|Smoot]] who was confined 
to his bed with the [[scarlet fever|Scarlot fever]] at the house of Brother [[Thomas Bond|Bonds]]
On the 31st of Dec being the last Day of 1836 I aranged the account of my Journal & recorded 
the same in the following Pages which is the full account of my labours & travels in 1836
Thus ends the year of 1836 which hath quickly Passed with its report into ETERNITY

On the last Day of Dec & of the year of our Lord 1836 I made the following arangment from
my Journal which is a correct account of my Procedings & travels in the ministry during the year of 1836
1st I Travled Six thousand five hundred & fifty seven Miles Travled 6557m





2nd I Held One hundred & fifty three Meetings Held 153 meetings


3rd I Baptized twenty seven Persons Baptized 27 persons


4th I ordained two Elders, Three Priest, one Teacher, & Two Deacons Ordained 8 Persons


5th Their was four Persons healed of diseases under my hands in the name of Jesus Christ. Healed. 4. Person


6th I attended four Coferences Attended 4 Conferences


7th I held four debates Held 4 Debates


8th I attended to the Ordinance of Blessing Nineteen Children in the name of Jesus Christ {shorthand} 19 children


9thI Procured Twenty two Subscribers for the M & Advocate Procured 22 Subscribers
I Also Procured $ Seventy Dollars for the M & Ad & Paid it at the Office. Procured $70. for M & Ad


10th I gave six dollars & Procured eighty five more for building the house of God in Kirtland Procured $91 for the house

11th I wrote thirty four Letters wrote 34 Letters
& Receieved Seven Letters Receieved 7 Letters
The before mentioned is an account of the most conspicuous part of my Proceding during 
the year of 1836 which has gone into eternity with its report as the year before it hath done 
& as the one following & all others must do. O time how swift & how precious thou art. 
How great the events that are bourn upon thy wings, esspecially in the dispensation of the [[fulness of times|fullness 
of times]]. 1836 is gone it cannot be recalled. Europe hath began to tremble at thy departure. The 
[[endowment|endowment]] of the Latter Day Saints hath bespake a God in Israel & is sufficient to show that 
though the heavens & the earth Pass away the word of God spake through the Prophets must 
all be fulfilled. It is true that the thought of man may now retrace his footsteps through 
1836 that is Past. But who can tell whare the end of 1837 will leave him. Yea that important 
year that is mounting the wheels of time to stand upon the stage of exhistance to do its 
Perfect work. Will not its gigantic operations, & its magna works stand upon the Archieves of 
heaven as great events. Will this gentile generation still sleep in this late hour if so sleep on 
& take thy rest which is short for thy end is come & the day is broke that Israel must be awoke 
from his slumber for the last time & Prepare himself for the [[Bridegroom|Bridegroom]] then let 
1837 finish its work with speed & let its departure say who is gone to the tomb. & what 
Kingdom overturned & what Kingdom esstablished. Yea let 1837 Report (as it departs) that 
[[Zion|Zion]] with her stakes indicates tha God will rule in her midst with Power Strength & Glory

Tuesday


Jan. 3rd 1837 At early Candle light I repared to the [[house of the Lord|house of the Lord]] in company with 
Elder [[Milton Holmes|Milton Holm^e^s]] for the purpose of Meeting with the quorum of the Seventies.
President [[Hazen C. Aldrich|Aldrich]] opened the meeting by Prayer & after a few appropriate remarks 
from President [[Zebedee Coltrin|Coltrin]] about twenty of the [[Third Quorum of the Seventy|third Seventy]] was ordained to the [[High Priesthood|high 
Priesthood]] & as members of the third Seventy ^{under the hands of the above named Presidents.}^ After this ordinance was Performed 
Elder Holms & myself was called upon by the above named Presidents to come 
foreward to be ordained as members of the [[First Quorum of the Seventy|first Seventy]] Elders of Israel to bear 
the name of Jesus to the nations of the earth. The first Seventy was Chosen out 
of the [[Zion|Camp]] that went up to Zion for the redemption of our brethren in the Spring of 
1834. but as we were not present when they were chosen we were afterwards 
chosen in the [[Second Quorum of the Seventy|second Seventy]] but their now being two vacancies in the first we 
were chosen to fill them. President Aldrich ordained Edder Holms to this appointment 
& Pronounced great blessings upon his head. President Zebedee Coltrin Ordained 
me as a member of the first Seventy & Pronounced great [[priesthood blessing|Blessings]] upon my head 
by the [[spirit of prophecy|spirit of Prophecy]] & Revelation Some of them I will mention which are as 
follows THAT my enemies would confine me in [[prisons|prisions]] & chains & that I should rend 
the prisions & chains in twain in the name of JESUS & that the Lord would give me
Great Power, [[knowledge|Knowledge]], & wisdom that I should [[heal the sick|heal the sick]] cause the [[blind|blind]] to see
the lame to leap, the Deaf to hear, stop the mouths of Lions, [[raise the dead|rase the dead]] waft 
myself from river to river from sea to sea & that I should stand before Kings &
Princes & that they would send for me to receieve wisdom, Knowledge, & 
instruction at my mouth because they consider'd me wiser than they in like 
manner as the Egyptians sought wisdom at the hand of [[Joseph (OT)|JOSEPH]] And that

God would give me a multiplicity of blessings that I should Preach to the nations of the 
Earth & the inhabitants upon the [[islands of the sea|Islands of the sea]] & that I should then return 
& stand upon [[Mount Zion|Mount Zion]] in the flesh even in [[Jackson County, Missouri|Jackson County]] Missouri at 
the [[Second Coming of Jesus Christ|Cumming of Christ]] & that I should be cought up to meet him in the clouds 
of heaven for he said thus was the [[word of God|word of God]] unto me & Also that I should 
visit [[Kolob|COLUB]] & Preach to the [[spirits in prison|spirits in Prison]] & that I should bring forth
from the [[terrestrial kingdom|Terrestrial Kingdom]] all my Kinsman ^who had Died^ by Proclaiming the gospel
unto othem. These & many other Blessings were Pronounced upon my head
& further said that I should be annointed & my life sealed up & then
their would be still greater blessing Pronounced upon my head. I felt 
much of the [[power of God|Power of God]] rest upon me in this ordinance & bear witness of 
the truth of the above [[Proclamation|PROCLAMATION]] See May 29th 1836 in this Journal

VISION
I Willford Woodruff being in the spirit on the eve of the 2nd Day of Jany AD 1836 mine understanding
was enlightened and mine eyes were opened to look within the veil and behold the things that are to
come, things which must yet be fulfilled. an angel said unto me look and I looked and beheld great
and marvelous things that are to transpire spedily many in this generation. I saw a Judgment that
doth await Babylon the great. I saw signs in the east as a warning to the nations and to fullfull the
Prophets III X II [FIGURES]
I beheld the sun turn to darknes and the Moon to Blood and the horizon covered with burning
Cities as is to come upon Babylon I saw seven golden Lions sit in the heavens as burning
brass but the meaning was taken from me. I saw the resurrection of the Celestial Kingdom
or the inhabitants theroff whose glory was that of the first born they were arayed in white
garment of fine lining most beautiful & fair. I saw the resurrection of the Terrestrial Kingdom
whose glory was lesser than the Celestial. The earth hove from its capacious bed that Immor
-tality might rest upon them and they came forth out of their graces. Great peace, joy, happiness,
and glory immortality and Eternal Life reigned in the Celestial and Terrestrial Kingdoms
Great and marvelous were the things shown unto me while in the spirit I beheld a personage
appear in the Clouds of heaven and while looking at the greatness and majesty and the
story of these things the veil was closed from my view and I awoke and my rest was seel
unto me And if I cannot write all that I saw I testify that what I have written is true

miles 6740 South
1400 richland to miss
8140 baptized
70

A.E.I.O.U&Y
{AEIOU Y}

Wilford Woodruffs Day Book & Journal
Containing An Account of My travels in the
Ministry as a member of the church of 
Latter Day Saints of
18.35.

Jan 13th 1835
Wilford Woodruff Day Book on Journal
This is the first mishion on the first commencement of my
travels to preach the gospel of Jesus Christ On the 13th day Jan 1835
I commenced hunting in Company with Henry Brown
as my partner We now intend if the Lord will to visit the
Southern States May God grant us wisdom and make
us meet for our Masters use and assist us to rightly divide
of meet in due season that our garments may
be clear of the blood of this generation

Jan 13th 1835 I left Brother [[Lyman Wight|Lyman Wights]] at 7 miles east of 
[[Liberty, Clay County, Missouri|Liberty]] Clay Co. and traveled 23 miles to Brother 
[[Brother Benson|Bensons]] Layfaette Co. got 5 signers to the petition 
In this days travel we crossed Keerys ferry into [[Jackson County, Missouri|Jackson County]] 
and upon that land for the first time Brother Harry 
Brown and myself kneeled together to offer up our petitions
to God while at the same time that precious land was
pattented by ungodly men.

14th. Left Brother [[Brother Benson|Benson]] traveled to Brother [[Charles McClure|Charles MCCline]]
being 5 miles. Got one signer to the petition

Jan 
15

Left Brother [[Charles McClure|MCCline]] an travled to Brother [[Gabhan Hitchcock|Joshua
Hitchcock]] being 12 miles got one signer to the petitions
this days travel was interesting in consequence of the road
lying through some of the most beautiful praires mine eyes
ever beheld lying in swells we took up our abode with Brother
Hitchcock for the night being again in [[Jackson County, Missouri|Jackson Co.]]

16

Left [[Gabhan Hitchcock|Brother Hitchcock]] and travled ^12^ twelve miles south of grand
river and was kinidly receieved by Mr [[James Porter|James Porter]] being 23 miles

17

left Mr Porters and traveled within twelve miles of Harmony
Mission and was kindly receieved by [[Mr. Walker|Mr Walker]] being 26 miles

Jan
18

Left Mr Walker and travled to the Harmony Mission 
from thence after long wandering to Mr [[Michel Geraud|Gerauds]] the Indian
trader was kindly received by him being 15 miles

19

Left Mr [[Michel Geraud|Geraud]] and crossed the [[Osage River, Missouri|Osage river]] and travled 
to Mr Williams being 50 long miles notwithstanding Mr Williams
was from [[Jackson County, Missouri|Jackson Co]] yet to receieved us for the night [[Polk County, Missouri|Polk Co]]

20

Left Mr [[Mr. Williams|Williams]] and travled across [[Sac River, Missouri|Sack river]] on to
Mr [[William Crisp|William Crisp]] being 18 miles in [[Polk County, Missouri|Polk County]]

21

Left Mr [[William Crisp|Crisp]] and travled again across [[Sac River, Missouri|Sack river]] 
and on to Mr [[Robert Pollan|Robert Pollan]] being 15 miles and in 
[[Greene County, Missouri|Green County]] Mr Pollan receieved us kindly we preached their

Jan 22

Left Mr [[Robert Pollan|Pollan]] travled across [[Spring River, Missouri|Spring river]] to 
[[Joseph Fisher|Joseph Fisher]] being 20 miles in [[Greene County, Missouri|Green County]]

23

Left Mr [[Joseph Fisher|Fishers]] and travled to Mr [[Nathan Turner|Nathan Turnam]] 
in [[Greene County, Missouri|Green County]] being 12 miles gave an appointment for preachig

24

preached at Mr [[Nathan Turner|Nathan Turners]] house and travled to 
Mr [[Charles J. Tea|Charles J Teas]] 1 mile in [[Greene County, Missouri|Green County]]

25

On the Lords day Left Mr [[Charles J. Tea|Teas]] and travled to Mr [[Joseph Henderson|Joseph Henderson]]
and preached at his house Being 3 miles in [[Greene County, Missouri|Green Co.]]

26 Left Mr [[Joseph Henderson|Henderson]] and travled across [[Shoal Creek, Missouri|Shoal Creek]] 
to Mr [[William C. Payne|Wm C Payne]] in [[Barry County, Missouri|Barry Co]] being 14 miles Mr
Henderson, and Son signed the petition and bid us God Speed

Tuesday


27 Left Mr [[William C. Payne|Payne]] & travled to [[Samuel Vaughn|Samuel Vaughn]] ESq 
being 20 miles

Wednesday


Jan 28 Left Mr [[Samuel Vaughn|Vaughn]] and travled out of the State of [[Missouri|Mo]] into 
the [[Arkansas Territory|Arkansas Territory]] to Mr [[Andrew Nail|Andrew Nail]] was kindly 
receieved by him this was in [[Washington County, Arkansas Territory|Washington Co.]] at the head of 
the [[Illinois River, Illinois|Illonois River]] being 24 miles

Thursday


29 Remained with Mr [[Andrew Nail|Nail]] through the day in consequence of a hard storm

Friday


30 Left Mr [[Andrew Nail|Nail]] and travled to [[Fayetteville, Washington County, Arkansas Territory|Fayettville]] from thence to Mr 
[[Mr. Inghram|Inghram]] 20 miles in [[Washington County, Arkansas Territory|Washington Co.]]

Saturday


31 Left Mr [[Mr. Inghram|Inghram]] and travled to Mr [[John Billingsly|John Billingsly]] was kindly 
receieved by him being 8 miles in [[Washington County, Arkansas Territory|Washington Co.]]

Sunday


Feb 1st On the Lords day preached at [[John Billingsly|John Billingsley]]
house to an attentive congregation got 3 Signers to 
the petition much of the [[Holy Spirit|Spirit]] rested upon us while preaching

Monday


2 Left Mr [[John Billingsly|Billingsley]] and travled to Mr [[Sanford Elmore|Sanford W Ellmore]] 
in [[Crawford County, Arkansas Territory|Crawford Co.]] being 25 miles

Tuesday


Feb. 3 Left Mr [[Sanford Elmore|Ellmore]] and crossed [[Frog Bayou, Crawford County, Arkansas Territory|Frog Bayou river]] travled 
on to Mr [[Andrew Boyd|Andrew Boyd]] in [[Crawford County, Arkansas Territory|Crawford Co.]] within 10 miles of 
the court house being 20 mils

Wednesday


4 Left Mr [[Andrew Boyd|Boyd]] and travled to Mr [[John Simms|John Simms]] in 
[[Crawford County, Arkansas Territory|Crawford Co.]] 20 miles we Crossed little and Big 
Mulbury Creeks and also White Oak Creek

Thursday


5 Left Mr [[John Simms|Simms]] Crossed [[White Oak Creek, Crawford County, Arkansas Territory|White Oak Creek]] and travled to 
Mr [[Mr. Nickolson|Nickelson]] 20 miles in [[Crawford County, Arkansas Territory|Crawford Co]]

Friday


6 Left Mr [[Mr. Nickolson|Nickolsons]] travled to Hicksons ferry Crossed at the [[Arkansas River, United States|Arkansas River]] from thence to 
Mr [[S. U. Walker|S U Walker]] in [[Crawford County, Arkansas Territory|Crawford Co]] being 30 miles

Saturday


7 Left Mr [[S. U. Walker|Walkers]] crossed the Renellee Creek from thence 
to Mr [[William Riley|William Riley]] in [[Scott County, Arkansas Territory|Scott Co]] distance 26 miles

Sunday


8 Left Mr [[William Riley|Riley]] travled to Mr [[Willis Akeman|Willis Akerman]] distance 5 miles
in [[Pope County, Arkansas Territory|Pope County]]

Monday


9th Remained at Mr [[Willis Akeman|Akermans]] through the day

Tuesday


10 Assisted Mr [[Willis Akeman|Akemans]] in his temperal business

Wednesday


11 Left Mr [[Willis Akeman|Akemans]] travled 2 mile to Mr [[Jonathan Hubbel|Johnathan Hubbel]]

Thursday


Feb 12 Spent the day at Mr [[Jonathan Hubbel|Hubbel]] in Writing

Friday


13 Remained at Mr [[Jonathan Hubbel|Hubbel]] wrote one letter to the Brethren in [[Zion|Zion]]

Saturday


14 On the evening of this day I was suddenly called to a house of 
mourning which was Mr [[Alexander Akeman|Alexander Akeman's]] who had 
walked out of his house and droped dead upon the ground in a 
few moments all his [[Wright Akeman|Son]]s and Daughters were present it was 
truly a time of Mourning Mr Akeman had belonged to 
the [[Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints|Church of Christ]] his [[Prudence Stockton Akeman|wife]] died Strong in the faith in [[Jackson County, Missouri|Jackson
County]] Mr Akeman was through the [[persecution|persecution]] in Jackson 
Co in consequence of which he moved to [[Pope County, Arkansas Territory|Pope Co Arkansas
Territory]] whare he met his death

Sunday


Feb 15 Returned to Mr [[Jonathan Hubbel|Hubbel]] On the Lords day spent the day at his house 
According to appointment

Monday


16 Attended the funeral assisted in burying the body of Mr. 
[[Alexander Akeman|Akeman]] preached the word unto the people got 
10 Signers to the Petition

Tuesday


17 Travled from Mr [[Alexander Akeman|Akemans]] to Mr [[Elijah Baker|Eligah Baker]] preached 
at his house according to appointment from thence to Mr 
[[Josiah Hart|Josighah Hart]] who invited us to spend the night with
him Mr Hart was 74 years of Age and a patriot in 
the [[American Revolution|Revolution]] he signed the petition distance of this days travel 15 M[iles]

Wednesday


18 Left Mr [[Josiah Hart|Harts]] and travled to Mr [[William Witt|Wm. Wit]] being 12 miles
got 5 signers to the petitions

Thursday


Feb 19 Left M [[William Witt|Wit]] travled 2 milsto Mr [[Jonathan Hubbel|Hubbels]] preached at his house 
according to appointment got 6 signers to the petition from 
thence to Mr [[Benjamin Snellin|Benjamin Snellin]] distance 4 miles

Friday


20 Left Mr [[Benjamin Snellin|Snellin]] travled to Brother [[Wright Akeman|Wright Akemans]] Spent 
the day in labouring with our hands from thence to Mr [[Jonathan Hubbel|Hubbel]]
distance 3 miles Spent the evening in preaching the word to and
inviting the household of Mr Hubbel to take upon them the name
of Christ and imbrace the covenant Brother [[Henry Brown|Henry]] Spoke
with [[gift of tongues|tongues]] and interpeted the [[Spirit of God|Spirit of God]] rested upon us

Saturday


21 Left Mr [[Jonathan Hubbel|Hubbel]] travled 2 miles to Brother [[Wright Akeman|Wright Akeman]] 
spent the day in labouring with our hands then went to Mr [[Benjamin Snellin|Snellin]] 
who was dangerously sick spent the night in assisting him

Sunday


Feb 22 On the Lords day Left Mr [[Benjamin Snellin|Snellin]] travled 2 miles to Mr [[Jonathan Hubbel|Hubbel]] 
preached at his house much of the [[Spirit of God|Spirit of
God]] rested upon us. Baptized 2 persons

Monday


23 Counceled together and concluded to go down to the mouth of
the [[Arkansas River, United States|Arkansaw river]] and cross the [[Mississippi River, United States|Mississippi River]] After landing
to go by water we left Brother [[Jonathan Hubbel|Hubbel]] accompanied by Brother [[Wright Akeman|W
Akeman]] for the purpose of making a Canoe to go down the 
[[Arkansas River, United States|River]] in as we could not go by land without great difficulty on account
of swamp and water. We crossed the Arkansaw river - Spent the night 
with Mr [[John Julian Morse|John Morse]] distance 23 miles

Tuesday


24 Spent the day in digging out a canoe

Wednesday


25. Finished our canoe and launched it into the River

Thursday


Feb 26 Left Mr [[John Julian Morse|Morse]] crossed the [[Arkansas River, United States|Arkansaw River]] travled to Brother [[Jonathan Hubbel|Hubbel]] 
distance 23 miles

Friday


27 Spent the day in [[labor|labouring]] for Brother [[Jonathan Hubbel|Hubbel]] with our hands

Saturday


28 Preached at Brother [[Jonathan Hubbel|Hubbels]] house

Sunday


March 1st On the Lords day preached at Brother [[Jonathan Hubbel|Hubbel's]] house Accord
ing to appointment got 1 signer to the petition

Monday


2 On the 2 day of March Took the parting hand with [[Jonathan Hubbel|Brother]]
and [[Sister Jonathan Hubbel|Sister Hubbel]] and all our friends at [[Petit Jean Mountain, Conway County, Arkansas Territory|Petty John]] 
was accompanied by Brother [[Alexander Wright|Wright]] to the [[Lake Dardanelle, Dardanelle, Yell County, Arkansas Territory|Dardanell]] we crossd 
the [[Arkansas River, United States|River]] was kindly received by Mr [[John Julian Morse|John Morse]] and there 
found Mr [[William Akeman|Wm]] & [[Willis Akeman|Willis Akemans]] Distance 23 miles 
got 7 Signers to the Petition

Tuesday


March 3 An unfortueene circumstance caused us to think it wisdom
to travel in this place and labour with our hands Spent the day in
labouring for Mr [[Frederick Sangrain|Frederick Sangrain]]

Wednesday


4 Spent the day in [[labor|labouring]] for Mr [[Frederick Sangrain|Sangrain]]

Thursday


5 Spent the day in labouring for Mr [[Frederick Sangrain|Sangrain]] I had a
view in this place of some dangerous reptiles which were
two [[centipedes|sandapeads]] and three [[tarantulas|terrantiallens]] their touch upon
human flesh is considered immediate death I saw these reptiles
at the Dardaneell Arkansaw which coundry abounds with
them espeaclly among the rocks

Friday


6 Spent the day in [[labor|labouring]] for Mr [[Frederick Sangrain|Sangrain]]

Saturday


7 Spent the Day in labouring for [[Alfred A. Sangrain|Alfred A Sangrain]]

Sunday


March 8 On the Lords day preached at Mr [[John Julian Morse|John Morse]] house
Monday to

Tuesday


9Spent the day in [[labor|Labouring]] for Mr [[Frederick Sangrain|Sangrain]]


10 Also

Wednesday


11 In consequence of low water the boat which we had been
waiting for could not go down the [[Arkansas River, United States|River]] and we concluded
to procede on our journey in our canoe. We took our
teene of Mr [[Frederick Sangrain|Sangrain]] and embarked in our canoe
travled to Petty John Mountain Stayed At the mouth of Petty
John Creek and put up for the night at the house of Mr [[Abraham Barnet|Abraham Barnet]] distance 25 miles [[Pope County, Arkansas Territory|Pope County]]
the first of a journey in an [otten] Canoe Distance 4,0 Miles

Thursday


March 12th Left Mr [[Abraham Barnet|Barnet]] proceded down the [[Arkansas River, United States|River]] through the
day and travled to the [[Cadron Creek, Arkansas Territory|Cadron]] and spent the night in an old 
deserted trading house. distance 50 miles. [[Conway County, Arkansas Territory|Conway County]]
got one Signer to the petition

Friday


13 Left the [[Cadron Creek, Arkansas Territory|Cadron]] after visiting the black Bluffs travled 
40 miles and put up for the night with Mr [[Samuel Blackburn|Samuel
Blackburn]] in [[Pulaski County, Arkansas Territory|Pulaski County]]

Saturday


14 Left [[Samuel Blackburn|Blackburn]] travled to [[Little Rock, Pulaski County, Arkansas Territory|Little Rock]] 35 miles
after visiting Little Rock 3/4 of an hour travled we preceded down the [[Arkansas River, United States|River]] 
18 miles and was kindly receieved by Mr [[Isaac Jones|Isaac Jones]] 
in [[Pulaski County, Arkansas Territory|Pulaski County]] the whole distance 53 miles

Sunday


15 Spent the day with Mr [[Isaac Jones|Jones]] being the Lords day preached 
the word unto him

Monday


March 16th After Receieving information from Mr [[Isaac Jones|Jones]] the thread
was possible for tratmet per [[Little Rock, Pulaski County, Arkansas Territory|Little Rock]] to [[Memphis, Shelby County, Tennessee|Memphis]] we can
chaded to leeve our Canoe and go by land as the distance
was owedy 150 miles by land and 550 miles by water
Left Mr Jones travled up the [[Arkansas River, United States|River]] 10 miles Took the Military
road ^2 signers to the petition^ on to Col. [[Colonel Blue|Blues]] in [[Pulaski County, Arkansas Territory|Palaski Co.]] Distance 22 mles

Tuesday


17 Left Mr [[Colonel Blue|Blue]] travled to Mr [[F. Cribbins|Thomas Cribbins]] in [[Monroe County, Arkansas Territory|Monroe Co]] 
Distance 40 miles greatest part of the way was mud & water

Wednesday


18 Left Mr [[F. Cribbins|Cribbins]] Crossed [[White River, Arkansas Territory|White River]] At Cash ferry 
from thence to Mr [[James P. Kelleam|James P Kelleam]] [[Monroe County, Arkansas Territory|Monroe County]] 
Distance 18 miles
Thursday to

Saturday


19 Spent the day in [[labor|laboiring]] with our hands for Mr [[James P. Kelleam|Kelleam]], Also 
the 20 & 21

Sunday


March 22. On the Lords day preached to an attentive 
congregation at the house of Mr [[James P. Kelleam|Kelleam]]

Monday


23 Left Mr [[James P. Kelleam|Kelleam]] and travled 40 miles much mud
and water and put up for the night with [[William S. Clonn|William SChon]] 
at Second Creek in [[Saint Francis County, Arkansas Territory|St Francis County]] got 2 signers to petition

Tuesday


24th Left Mr [[William S. Clonn|SChon]] travled to Mr [[John Casheen|John Casheen]] St Francis
Co. Distance 14 miles. The time had now arived when my 
Beloved partner Deemed it expedient that he should take a 
speedy journey to his family at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] And of this 24th 
day of March took the parting hand with Brother [[Henry Brown|Henry Brown]] 
after commending each other to God [I am rang whane may a]
double portion of the spirit of Eligahs God rest upon me that I

may be faithful over a few things I preached in the evening 
at Mr Casheen house to a crowded Congregation got 2 signers to the petition

Wednesday


25 Left Mr [[John Casheen|Casheen]] to [[William A. Johnson|Wm A Johnson]] in 
[[Crittenden County, Arkansas Territory|Critentan Co.]] distance 20 miles Crossed [[Saint Francis River, Arkansas Territory|St. Francis River]] 
got 3 signers to Petition

Thursday


26 Left Mr [[William A. Johnson|Johnsons]] Crossed the [[Blackfish Lake, St. Francis County, Arkansas Territory|Black Fish Lake]] at Johnsons ferry
travled 14 miles through mud and water andw as kindly receieved
for the night at the house of Mr [[Willis Fields|Willis Fields]] in [[Crittenden County, Arkansas Territory|Crittentan County]]
preached at Mr Fields got 11 signers to the petition

Friday


27 Left Mr [[Willis Fields|Fields]] travled to and crossed the [[Mississippi River, United States|Mississippi River]] 
into [[Memphis, Shelby County, Tennessee|Memphis]] ^State of [[Tennessee|Tennessee]]^ distance 14 miles got one signer to the petition
preached at the house of [[Josiah Jackson|Josighah Jackson]] to a company of [blank] And [meanne them]

Saturday


March 28th Left Mr [[Josiah Jackson|Jackson]] passed through [[Raleigh, Shelby County, Tennessee|Raleigh]] from 
thence to Mr [[John A. Logwood|John A Logwood]] [[Fayette County, Tennessee|Fayette County]] was kindly treated
by Mr Logwood Distance 32 miles got 1 signer to the petition

Sunday


29 On the Lords Day attended meeting 1 mile from Mr [[John A. Logwood|Logwoods]]

Monday


30 Left Mr [[John A. Logwood|Logwood]] and travled through [[Somerville, Fayette County, Tennessee|Sommersville]] to [[Bolivar, Hardeman County, Tennessee|Bolivar]]. 
Spent the night at the house of ESq. [[Squire Hardman|Hardamand]] amid [[music|Music]]
& [[dancing|dancing]] in [[Hardeman County, Tennessee|Hardamand County]] Distance 35 miles

Tuesday


31 Left Mr [[Squire Hardman|Hardamand]] and travled to Mr [[Jacob Sipes|Jacob Sipes]] preached
at his house in [[Madison County, Tennessee|Madison Co.]] got 1 signer to the petition Distance 24 miles.

Wednesday


Aprail 1st Left Mr [[Jacob Sipes|Sipes]] crossed [[Mount Pinson, Madison County, Tennessee|Mount Pinson]] and travled to Mr 
[[David Beard|David Beard]] in [[Henderson County, Tennessee|Henderson Co.]] Distance 30 miles

Thursday


Aprail 2th Left Mr [[Daniel Beard|Beard]] travled through [[Pleasant Grove, McHenry County, Illinois|plesant Grove]] and 
[[Lexington, Henderson County, Tennessee|Lexington]], and [[Maple Springs, Henderson County, Tennessee|Maple Springs]] to Mr [[William Morris, Tennessee|Wm Morris]] in
[[Carroll County, Tennessee|Carrel County]] Distance 30 miles

Friday


3 Left Mr [[William Morris, Tennessee|Morris]] travled 14 miles to Brother [[Cade A. Crawley|Cade Crawley]] 
visited two sisters on the road got 2 signers to the petition [[Humphreys County, Tennessee|Humphreys Co]]

Saturday


4 Left Brother [[Cade A. Crawley|Crowley]] travled 5 miles to Brother [[Joseph Fry|Joseph Frey]] and
Soon after arriving at Brother Frey's I had the happy privilege of meeting
with Brother [[Warren Farr Parrish|Warren Parish]] who was faithfully ingaged in the
[[work of the Lord|work of the Lord]] and Baptizing Such as should be saved I am 
now expecting to [[labor|labour]] with him for a season

Sunday


5 On the Lords Day remained at Br [[Joseph Fry|Freys]]

Monday


6 Preached at the Meeting house on [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]] also in the evening

Tuesday


Apreal 7th Spent the Day in visiting the Brthren & Sisters on [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]]
and travled to Brother [[Cade A. Crawley|Cade Crawley]] Distance 8 miles

Wednesday


8 Left Brother [[Cade A. Crawley|Crawley]] travled to miles to Mr [[John Jackson|John Jackson]] 
preached in the Evening at Mr Jacksons house

Thursday


9 Left Mr [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] travled to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] to Brother [[Isaiah Benton|Isaiah 
Benton]] Distance 24 miles [[Henry County, Tennessee|Henry County]]

Friday


10 Continued at Brother [[Isaiah Benton|Benton]] through the Day A prayer Meeting in Evening

Saturday


11 Left Brother [[Isaiah Benton|Benton]] travled 10 miles to Mr [[John Hartfield|John Hartfield]]

Sunday


12 Left Mr [[John Hartfield|Hartfield]] travled to [[Naples, Henry County, Tennessee|Naples]] On the Lords Day preached 
at the Meeting house Distance 10 miles was kindly receieved for the night
By Dr Jacob Braswell Dr [[Richard B. Clausell|Richard B Clausell]]

Monday


13 Left Mr Braswell ^[[Richard B. Clausell|Clausell]]^ travled into the State of [[Kentucky|KY]]. [[Graves County, Kentucky|Graves County]] And
preached in the Evening at the house of Mr [[David Kelly|David Kelly]] Distance 9

Tuesday


Aprail 14th Left Mr [[David Kelly|Kelleys]] travled to Mr [[John Clapp|Clap's]] preached to an attentive 
congregation also in the evening Distance 6 miles

Wednesday


15 Left Mr [[John Clapp|Clap]] travled 3 miles to [[Widow Brusles|Wid Brushes]] preached at
her house from thence to Dr [[Richard B. Clausell|Clausell]] [[Henry County, Tennessee|Henry Co]] Distance 6 miles

Thursday


16 Left Wid Brusles travled to Dr Claudell Henry Co. 6 miles


16 Left Dr [[Richard B. Clausell|Clausell]] travled 8 miles to Mr [[Mr. Estherage|Etherage]] preached 
to an attentive congregation was blessed with the [[Spirit of God|Spirit of God]]
then travled 2 miles to Mr [[Mr. Butterworth|Butterworth]] and preached in 
the evening

Friday


17 Left Mr [[Mr. Butterworth|Butterworth]] travled to Brother [[Levi Taylor|Levy Taylor]] in 
[[Henry County, Tennessee|Henry County]] Distance 14 miles

Saturday


Aprail 18th Saturday preached at the Schoolhouse by Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Joseph 
Chumbley]] 1 mile from Brother [[Levi Taylor|Taylor]] Spent the night with
Mr Chumley

Sunday


19 On the Lords Dat preached at the School house by Mr [[Joseph Chumbley| Chunley]]
Brother [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] Baptized 5 fine persons three of Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumleys]] family

Monday


20 Left Brother [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] travled to Brother [[Samuel Smith|Samuel Smith]] 3 miles
Preached at Mr [[Wiley Mallory|Willey Mallory]] [[Calloway County, Kentucky|Calloway Co]] KY

Tuesday


21 Left Brother [[Samuel Smith|Smith]] travled 14 miles Preached at the house
of Col [[Solomon Copeland|Soloman Copeland]] ^His [[Sara Tippet Copeland|wife]] healed^ [[Henry County, Tennessee|Henry Co.]] Tennessee

Wednesday


22 Left Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland]] travled 10 miles to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|paris]] found the Brethren well

Thursday


23 Spent the Day in [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris.]] Also the 24 & held a friendly Debate with
two [[Methodist|Methodest]] Priest held a prayer meeting with the Brethren in the evening

Friday


Aprail 24th Left the Brethren [[Johnson F. Lane|Lane]] & [[Isaiah Benton|Benton]] at [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|paris]] travled 
to Mr [[Elijah Foster|Elijah Foster]] preached at his house ^12^ un tto A M also in
the evening at easrly candelight Distance 15 miles

Saturday


25th Left Mr [[Elijah Foster|Fosters]] travled to Mr [[John Jackson|John Jacksons]] in
[[Humphreys County, Tennessee|Humphreys County]] 15 M[iles]

Sunday


26 On the Lords Day left Mr [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] travled to Mr [[William H. Camp|Wm Camp]]
at [[Chalk Level, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Chalk Level]] preached at his house Brother [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] Baptized 
one person [[Humphreys County, Tennessee|Humphreys County]] Distance 10 miles

Monday


27 Baptized one Monday morning then Left [[Chalk Level, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Chalk Level]] travled
to Brother [[Joseph Fry|Joseph Frey]] on [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]] Distance 10 miles

Tuesday


28 Preached at the Meeting house at [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Ea[gle] Creek]] & visited
& prayed with the sick travled 4 miles
travled 1227 miles

Wednesday


29th Aprail Spent the Day at Brother [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] in writing wrote 
one letter to the friends in [[Zion|Zion]]. Also to my friends in the [[Arkansas Territory|Arkansas]]

Thursday


30 Wrote a letter to My parents in [[Connecticut|Connecticut]] & preached in the
Evening at the house of Mr [[Caswell Matlock|Caswell Medlock]] Distance 2 miles

Friday


May 1th Travled to Brother [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] spend the Day in writing. 2 miles

Saturday


2 Att night Preached at Sister [[Mary Barnett Matlock Barnett|Medlocks]] Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Ph]] baptized 2 pers

Sunday


3 On the Lords Day preached at Brother [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] to a large congregation

Monday


4 Wrote A letter to Friend [[Ozem Woodruff, b. 1787|Ozem Woodruff]] [[Avon, Hartford County, Connecticut|Avon Co]] there visited
& prayed with the sick Spent the night at Br [[Caswell Matlock|Cll Medlocks]]

Tuesday


5 Visited the sick and Returned to Father [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] travled 4 miles

Wednesday


6 Travled 3 miles & preached at the house of Mr [[William M. Malin|Wm Malin]]
was Blessed with much of the Spirit of God

Thursday


May 7th Travled from Mr [[William M. Malin|Malin]] to Father [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] from thence to
[[Morgan Creek, Perry County, Tennessee|Morgan Creek]]. Preached at Mr [[John Walker, Tennessee|John Walker]] returned to Br Freys ^Distance 15 Miles^

Friday


8 Remained at Father [[Joseph Fry|Frey]] Spent the day in Study & writing

Saturday


9 Travled from Fr [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] 2 miles visited the Brethren & returned

Sunday


10 Sunday Morning left Fr [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] Crossed Bird Sarq Creek to Mag 
[[Samuel Madden|Maddens]] & preached to a large congregation from thence 
to Br [[Cade A. Crawley|Crawleys]] [[Humphreys County, Tennessee|Humphreys Co]] Distance 30 Miles Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Ph]] Preached ^& baptized one^ at [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|E Creek]]

Monday


May 11 Left Brother [[Cade A. Crawley|Crawleys]] travled to Brother [[Seth Utley|Utleys]] 8 miles

Tuesday


12 Travled from Brother [[Seth Utley|Utley]] to Mr [[Lewis Barker|Lewis Barker]] preached at his 
house Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|P,s]] Baptized 2 persons Distance 6 miles

Wednesday


13 Left Mr [[Lewis Barker|Barkers]] travled to Mr [[John Jackson|Jacksons]]. Preached at his house Baptized
one after Meeting then travled to Brother [[John H. Williams|John H Williams]] & Baptized
him at the 11th hour of the night being 2 persons Baptized Distance 7 miles

Thursday


May 14th Travled from Mr [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] Henry County
Distance 23 miles we there found at Br Bentons a Brother by the 
name of [[Asa Dodds|Asa Dodds]] a high priest he was blind or nearly so & had
been for two years & he was overwhelmed in error

Friday


15 Spent the day in [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] & preached in the evening at the Court house

Saturday


16 Left Br [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] travled 10 miles to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland]] Henry Co
Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] Mail'd a letter to Br Cowden at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] yaw att the numbers Baptize

Sunday


17 Sunday Preached at Mr Hogans to a congregation of hundreds
also in the evening at Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland]] Mr Joice healed

Monday


18 Travled from Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] to Brother [[Samuel Walker West|West]] to [[Humphreys County, Tennessee|Humphreys Co.]] 30 miles

Tuesday


19th From Brother [[Samuel Walker West|West]] to ESqe [[Willis Beard|Beards]] from thence to Brother [[Joseph Fry|Frey's]] 18
20 Left father [[Joseph Fry|Frey's]] travled to Mr [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] Preached at his house distance 20 miles

Thursday


21 Travled from [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland's]] [[Henry County, Tennessee|Henry Co]] distance 25 miles

Friday


May 22 Travled from Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] to Brother [[Levi Taylor|Taylor's]] Distance 10

Saturday


23 Travled from Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] to Mr [[Mr. Butterworth|Butterworths]]. Preached at his house 10 miles

Sunday


24 Sunday Preached at Mr [[Mr. Butterworth|Buths]] also in the evening [[baptized|Baptized]] 2 persons 
from thence to Parson [[James Ray|James Ray]] Spent the night with him

Monday


25 Travled from Mr [[James Ray|Rays]] to Brother [[Levi Taylor|Taylor]] at Bloody Distance 10 Miles

Tuesday


26 From Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] to Br [[Samuel Smith|Smith]] then to Col [[John Rowlett|Rowlets]] 7 miles

Wednesday


27 Left Col [[John Rowlett|Rawlets]] travled to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland's]] [[Henry County, Tennessee|Henry Co]] 14 miles

Thursday


28 Left Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] travled to Br [[Johnson F. Lane|Lane,s]] in [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] Distance 10 miles

Friday


29 Left Br [[Johnson F. Lane|Lanes]] travled to Mr [[Elijah Foster|Fosters]] preached at his house from 
thence to Mr [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] Distance 30 miles [[Humphreys County, Tennessee|Humphrys Co]]

Saturday


30 Left Mr [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] travled across [[Tennessee River, United States|Tennessee River]] through
[[Reynoldsburg, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Reynoldsburgh]] to Mr [[Jesse Roggers|Jesse Roggers]] preached at his house Humphy
Distance 15miles Co

Sunday


31 On the Lords Day Preached at Mr [[Jesse Roggers|Roggers]] to a large congregation
On the authenticity of the [[Book of Mormon|Book of Mormon]] then to Mr Thompsons

Monday


June 1st Left Mr Thompson crossed the [[Tennessee River, United States|River]] at Wiley's ferry travled to
Brother [[Samuel Walker West|West]] [[Humphreys County, Tennessee|Humphreys County]] Distance 12 mile

Tuesday


2 Rode from Brother [[Samuel Walker West|West]] to Br [[Seth Utley|Utleys]] preached at his house
& Baptized 1 person then to Br [[Reuben Caps|Caps]] distance 4 miles

Wednesday


3 Rode from Br [[Reuben Caps|Caps]] to Mag [[Samuel Madden|Maddens]]. Preached at his house visited
& prayed with Sister Sanders from thence to Mag [[Burrel Beard|Beards]] Distance 25M

Thursday


4 Preached at Mag [[Burrel Beard|Burrel Beards]] then Rode to Father [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Ege Ck]] 18 mls

Friday


5 Spent the Day in visiting the Saints on [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]]

Saturday


6 Preached at the Meeting house on [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]]

Sunday


June 7th On the Lords Day preached at the Meeting house on [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]] Also
at Father [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] at four clock AM & Baptized 2 two persons

Monday


8 Rode from Father [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] to Br [[Cade A. Crawley|Crawley's]] Distance 6 miles

Tuesday


9 Rode from Br [[Cade A. Crawley|Crawley's]] to Mr [[Lewis Barker|Barker]] Preached at his house from
thence to ESq [[Albert Petty|Albert Pettey]] was kindly Recevied Distance 8 miles

Wednesday


10 Rode from Esq [[Albert Petty|Pettys]] to [[John Jackson|John Jackson]] 3 Miles

Thursday


11 Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Psh]] Baptized 1 person which was Esq [[Albert Petty|Albert Pettey]] then
Preached at [[John Jackson|J Jacksons]] end of the day
Rode from Mr Jacksons to Mr [[Johnathan Lowery|Johnathan Lowery]] Distance 14

Friday


12 Rode from Mr [[Johnathan Lowery|Lowerys]] to Brother [[Johnson F. Lane|Lanes]] in [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]]. Preached in Court House

Saturday


13 Rode from [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland's]] Distance 10 miles

Sunday


14 On the Lords Day preached at the Meetinghouse

Monday


15 Juneth Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Ph]] Baptized (1 one) Mrs Sarah Copeland we then Rode from
Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland]] to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] Henry Co. Distance 10 miles

Tuesday


16 Preached at Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylor's]] then Rode to Mr [[John Freeman|John Freeman's]] 5 miles

Wednesday


17 Rode to [[Concord, Lewis County, Kentucky|Concord]] called on Dr [[Richard B. Clausell|Clausell]] then returned to Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumbleys]] 7M

Thursday


18 Rode from Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumley]] to Mr [[Isaac Hendricks|Isaac Hendricks]]. Preached 
at his house Distance 10. Confirmed Br [[William B. McCullock|Wm MCullock]]

Friday


19 Rode from Mr [[Isaac Hendricks|Hendricks]] to Col [[Asa Dodds|Dodds]] [[Graves County, Kentucky|Graves County]] Distance 10 Miles

Saturday


20 Rode from Col [[Asa Dodds|Dodds]] to Mr [[John Clapp|Claps]] preached at his house Distance
6 miles [[Graves County, Kentucky|Graves County KY]]

Sunday


21 On the Lords Day preached in the grove to a large congregation
Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] Baptized 3 three persons then Rode to Mr [[Thomas E. McCaman|MC Camrans]]
Preached at his house Distance 10 miles

Monday


22th June Rode from Mr MC Caman to [[Blood River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Bloody River]] from thence to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland]] Distance 25 miles

Tuesday


23 Rode from Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]]. Preached at the Court
house Distance 10 On this 23 Day of June we receieved 
a letter from Brother [[Oliver Cowdery|Oliver Cowdery]] at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] containing
a request for Brother [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] to return to Kirtland 
immediately as he was one of the Seventy chosen. Also stating 
that it was wisdom for me to tarry & [[labor|labour]] with the Church 
in great humility that I need not fear as there were 
other [[Seventy|Seventy]] to be called & that I was remembered

Wednesday


24 Held a [[debate|Debate]] with a [[William L. Sloss|Lawyier]] then rode to Mr [[Elijah Foster|Foster's]] 
preached at his house Distance 14 miles

Thursday


25 June Rode from Mr Fosters to [[John Jackson|John Jackson]] [[Humphreys County, Tennessee|Humphrys Co]] 
Distance 16 miles I procured 4 subscrber for the M & A while officiating as a Priest

Friday


26 Baptized 1 one person which was Brother [[John Jackson|John Jackson]] by Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] 
then Rode to Mr [[Lewis Barker|L Barker]]. Preached at his house was 
followed by a speach from Mr [[Cave Johnson|Cave Johnson]] Also from 
Mr [[Congo Pervatt|Congo Pervatt]] then Rode to Br [[Albert Petty|Pettys]] & Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Ph]]
Baptised Mrs [[Catherine Petty Petty|Catherine Petty]] Humphreys Co Distance 6 miles

Saturday


27 Rode from Br [[Albert Petty|Pettys]] to Mag [[Burrel Beard|Beards]] preached at his house 
from thence to Father [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]] Distance 26 miles

Sunday


28 On the Lords Day preached at Fr [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] Preached 
his farewell sermon to the [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]] branch of the Church 
Brother [[Calvin H. Nicholson|Calvin H Nicholson]] Elder was present

As Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parrish]] was one of the [[Seventy|seventy]] Called it became
necessary for him to Return to [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] it also was necessary 
I should that he should set the churches in order before his departure 
and ordain such as should be chosen by the [[gifts of God|gifts]] & [[calling|Callings]] of God 
to watch over the Church And on this 28th day of June 1835 
Brother [[Warren Farr Parrish|Warren Parrish]] was ordained a Deacon over
the [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Eagle Creek]] branch I wrote & presented a [[recommend|recommend]] 
to the Church ie Recommending Brother [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] to the Bishop & Church 
in general it was signed by the male members We truly had an 
affecting time partook of the [[sacrament|sacrament]] closed the meeting by 
Rode to Brother [[Caswell Matlock|Medlock]] with Bra [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] & [[Calvin H. Nicholson|Nicholson]] ^Singing an Hymn^

Monday


29 June Rode from Br [[Caswell Matlock|Medlock]] in Co with Brs [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] & [[Calvin H. Nicholson|Nicholson]]
to Br [[Joseph Fry|Frys]] Spent several hours in writing then Rode to 
Squire [[Squire Ivins|Ivins]] & Br Ph ^+Baptized^+ 1 one Mrs Ivins from thence 
to Br [[John Walker, Tennessee|Walkers]] Distance 4 miles

Tuesday


30 Rode from Br Walkers to Mr [[John Walker, Tennessee|John Walkers]] on [[Morgan Creek, Perry County, Tennessee|Morgans 
Creek]] preached at his house from thence to Father [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] 14 miles

Wednesday


July 1th Rode from Father [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] to Br [[Seth Utley|Utley's]] Distance 8 miles

Thursday


2nd Preached at Br [[Seth Utley|Utley's]] & we organized that branch of the Church 
Called the [[Chalk Level, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Chalk Level]] branch Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Psh]] ordained Brother [[Abel B. Wilson|Abel 
B Wilson]] a Deacon Brother Parish delivered to that Branch his [final] address

Friday


3 Rode from Br [[Seth Utley|Utleys]] to Br [[Cade A. Crawley|Crawleys]] Distance 6 miles
Brother Parish on the same Dy Rode to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]]

Saturday


4thJuly Rode from Br Crawleys to Col [[Colonel Rutherford|Rutherford's]] in [[Reynoldsburg, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Reynoldsburgh]]
East of [[Tennessee River, United States|Tennessee River]] [[Humphreys County, Tennessee|Humphrys County]] Distance 12 miles

Sunday


5 Preached at Col [[Colonel Rutherford|Rutherford's]] & Baptized 1 one Elizabeth 
Loyd. Left an appointment at the same place on the 6 of August

Monday


6 Rode from Col [[Colonel Rutherford|Rutherfords]] to Br [[Seth Utley|Utleys]] Distance 12 miles
On the same day Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Psh]] Br Baptized 3 persons in [[Henry County, Tennessee|Henry County]]

Tuesday


7 Rode from Br [[Seth Utley|Utleys]] to [[John Jackson|John Jacksons]] preached at his house 
^4 miles^ to an attentive Congregation this was a Day appointed by our 
enemies to meet at Br Jacksons for the purpose of [[mob|mobing]] 
us but while sickness fell a ceased some & fear others they abandoned their design

Wednesday


8 Spent the Day with Br [[John Jackson|Jacksons]]

Thursday


9 Rode from Brother [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] to Mr [[Elijah Foster|Fosters]] preached at his 
house then Rode to Br [[Johnson F. Lane|Lanes]] in [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] Distance 30 miles

Friday


10th July Rode from Br [[Johnson F. Lane|Lanes]] to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] Distance 10 miles

Saturday


11 Spent the Day at ^Col^ [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] in writing travled in the evening to Br ^[[Robert Davis|Davises]]^

Sunday


12 On the Lords Day preached at th Academy 13 miles from Col 
[[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] to a Congregation of hundreds Mr [[William L. Sloss|Wm. L Sloss]] accompanied us to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]]

Monday


13 Rode from Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] to Mr [[Samuel Roberts, Tennessee|Samuel Roberts]] preached 
at his house from thence to [[Blood River, Henry County, Tennessee|Bloody]] spent the night at Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] Distance 10M

Tuesday


14 Preached at Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] then Rode to Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumleys]]

Wednesday


15 Rode from Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumleys]] to Doct [[Richard B. Clausell|Richard B Clausell]] at 
[[Concord, Lewis County, Kentucky|Concord]] Preached in the grove at Concord then Rode to 
Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] Distance 10 miles The last evening Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] spent at Br ^Taylors^

Thursday


16 Took the parting hand with Brother [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] and the friends at [[Blood River, Henry County, Tennessee|Bloody]] 
& Rode & preached at Mr [[Mr. Butterworth|Butterworth]] then to Mr [[John McCullock|John MCCulloch]] 13 miles

Friday


17 July Rode from Mr McCulloch to [[Thomas E. McCaman|MCCaman's]] /^18^ Preached at 
his house /1st Cors 15=4 1=1 Distance 6 miles

Saturday


18 Rode from Mr [[Thomas E. McCaman|MCCaman]] to Mr [[Lewis Clapp|Lewis Claps]] [[Kentucky|KY]]. [Caly] Co.
Distance 15 miles Receieved [[Asa Dodds|Asa Dodds]] ^Elders^ Credentials according 
to the appointment of the [[high council|Counsel]] at [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] I ordained Br 
[[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Benjamin Clap]] a Teacher in the [[Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints|Church of Latter Day Saints]]

Sunday


19 On the Lords day Preached by the School house 1 mile from
Mr [[Lewis Clapp|Claps]]. I followed A [[Campbellite|Campbellite]] preacher Although much
threatened before meeting I was not disturbed Also Preached in 
the evening at Mr [[Lewis Clapp|Claps]] & Baptized 2 two ^2 Cor 4=5 Isaiah 8:20

Monday


20 Rode from Mr [[Lewis Clapp|Claps]] to [[Clarks River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Clarks River]] & Prached at Mr [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Thomas'es]]
at 12 & also at 5 oclock to a large Congregation of priests & people was opposed by 
one priest the rest were silent I spent the night with [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Daniel Thomas]] Distance ^12 miles^

Tuesday


21 July Rode from Clarks River to [[Concord, Lewis County, Kentucky|Concord]] from thence to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] 30 M

Wednesday


22 Rode from Br. [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] Distance 10 miles
whare I again met Br [[Warren Farr Parrish|Psh]] he informed me that he had 
Baptized 5 five persons since we parted Receieved letter from Paren^ts^

Thursday


23d Rode in Company for the last time With Brother [[Warren Farr Parrish|Parish]] 
^When Br Parish Left for the East there was 88 Members of the Church in Tenn^
to the mouth of [[Big Sandy River, Henry County, Tennessee|Sandy]] Br Parish preached to several hundred
for the space of three hours & Baptized 1 one The time had now
arived (however painful it might be) for me to take the parting
hand with Brother Parish & I know not that we shall
meet again untill we meet again in Eternity as he was one of the
Seventy Chosen it is now expedient for him to return to Kirtland
& also the will of God for me to tarry & labour with the Churches

may the blessings of God Crown his days & prepare him 
for the [[celestial kingdom|Celestial Kingdom]]. O worthy Brother farewell but not
forever) I am now left alone without human aid to asist me 
in preaching the gospel of Christ in an extent of Country about one
hundred miles in length & thirty in width besides the Care of all 
the Churches within the limits of the same who is [[weak|weak]] & I am not 
weak who is offended & I burn not O may the LORD give me 
strength according to my day & many souls as seals of my 
Ministry. O God prepare me for the battle. I 
returned to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] after taking the parting hand
with Brother Parish & Br [[Seth Utley|Utley]] who was to accompany
him to [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] Distance of the day 20 miles

Friday


24 July Rode from Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] to Br [[Johnson F. Lane|Lanes]] in [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] Distance 10 miles

Saturday


25 Spent the day in [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] at Br [[Johnson F. Lane|Lanes]]

Sunday


26 Rode from to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] to [[Johnathan Lowery|Johnathan Lowery]] on Sunday Preached 
at this house to a Large congregation was [[opposition|opposed]] by some
individuals then Rode to Br [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] on Cyprus Distance ^25^

Monday


27 Spent the day at Br [[John Jackson|Jackson's]]

Tuesday


28 Preached at Br [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] Baptized one. Some armed 
men gathered together it was supposed as a mob but came not ^against me^

Wednesday


29 Rode from Brother [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] to Br [[Albert Petty|Pettys]] then to Br [[Mr. Williams|Williams]] ^4 miles^

Thursday


30 Rode from Br [[Mr. Williams|Williams]] to [[Lewis Barker|Barkers]] Preached at his 
house then Rode to Br Caps Distance 8 miles

Friday


31 Rode from Br Caps to Br [[Seth Utley|Utleys]] then to Br [[Cade A. Crawley|Crawleys]] 8 miles

Saturday


1st Aug Rode from Br Crawleys to Father [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|E Creek]] 8 miles

Sunday


2 Preached at [[Eagle Creek, Humphreys County, Tennessee|E Creek]] Meeting house at 12 oclock also at 4 oclock
in the evening at Sister [[Polly Barnett Jennings|Barnets]] & Baptized 2 two 
Spent the night at Sister [[Polly Barnett Jennings|Barnets]] in Company with [[William L. Sloss|Wm L Sloss]]

Monday


3 Returned to Father [[Joseph Fry|Freys]] Spent the day
in writing & Studying Stenography from [[William L. Sloss|Wm L Sloss]] Esq

Tuesday


4 Took the parting hand with [[William L. Sloss|W L Sloss]] ESq & the rest of 
the friends Rode to Br [[Seth Utley|Utleys]] Preached at 12 oclock Distance 10

Wednesday


5 Spent the day at Br [[Seth Utley|Utleys]]

Thursday


6 Rode from Br [[Seth Utley|Utleys]] to Col [[Colonel Rutherford|Rutherfords]] East of [[Tennessee River, United States|Tenn River]] 
Preached at his house then returned through [[Reynoldsburg, Humphreys County, Tennessee|Reynoldsburgh]] 
on Election Day where there was much drunkenness & fiting to Br [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] 
Distance & Preached in the Evening Distance 23

Friday


7th Aug Rode from Br H Williams to [[Elijah Foster|Eligah Fosters]] Preached at his house
Receieved two subscribers for the [[Latter Day Saints|M[essenger] & A[dvocate] ]]. Distance 15 miles

Saturday


8 Rode from Mr [[Elijah Foster|Fosters]] to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] & herd of much excitement
fearing an insurrection of the [[Blacks|blacks]] H C. Distance 14 miles

Sunday


9 Sunday Rode from [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] Preached at the
Academy Distance 10 miles

Monday


10 Rode from Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland]] to [[Blood River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Bloody]] Distance 10 miles

Tuesday


11 Preached at Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] then rode to Br Taylor
[[Samuel Smith|S Smiths]] Br Smith Receieved a blessing by prayer & the laying
on of hands for the deliverance of sickness Distance 5 miles

Wednesday


12 Visited the sick & Rode to Brother [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] Distance 5 miles

Thursday


13th Aug Rode from Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] to Mr [[Mr. Butterworth|Butterworth's]] Preached at his
house Distance 10 miles

Friday


14 Spent the day at Mr [[Mr. Butterworth|Butterworth's]]

Saturday


15 Rode from Mr [[Mr. Butterworth|Butterworth's]] to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] was under 
the necessity of [[swimming|Swiming]] [[Blood River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Bloody River]] after some difficulty 
I extricated myself & horse from the wattery Element 10 miles

Sunday


16 On the Lords day held [[communion|communion]] with the Saints at Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] 
& wrote a letter to Brother [[Asahel Hart Woodruff, b. 1814|Asahel H Woodruff]]

Monday


17 Spent the Day at Brother [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] in study & writing

Tuesday


18 Rode to Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumbley]] & wrote a letter to Brother [[Henry Brown|Henry Brown]] in [Zion]

Wednesday


19 Rode to Mr Freemans then to [[Concord, Lewis County, Kentucky|Concord]] then Returned to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] 14 ^miles^

{a [[dream|dream]] on the night of the} 19 {of} aug 1835. {After meditating on the first dream I dreamed another.}

{shorthand}

Thursday


20 Aug Rode from Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] Distance 10 miles
Friday to

Saturday


21 & 22 Spent the day in visiting friends Also the 22 Day

Sunday


23 On the Lords Day Preached at the Academy by Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] ^from thence^

Monday


24 Rode from Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copeland]] to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] Distance 10 miles

Tuesday


25 Rode from [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] to Mr [[Elijah Foster|Fosters]] Distance 14 miles

Wednesday


26 Rode from Mr [[Elijah Foster|Fosters]] to Br [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] Preached at his house 14 miles

Thursday


27 Rode from Br Williams to Br [[Albert Petty|Albert Pettys]] Distance 2 miles

Friday

22 Rode to Mr [[David Cranshaw|Cranshaws]] Preached at his house in the evening distance 15 miles

And had a happy interview with Brother Utley as he had just returned from [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]]

24 Spent the day in perusing the [[Doctrine and Covenants|Book]] from Br [[Oliver Cowdery|Cowdery]] found it to be A precious treasure A legacy from heaven

25 Rode to [[Lewis Barker|Lewis Barkers]] Preached at his house Baptized 1 Distance 5 miles 1 subscriber for M & Ad

26 Rode to Br [[Samuel Walker West|Wests]] Preached at his house Distance 6 miles

28 Rode to Father [[Joseph Fry|Frey's]] commenced copying my Journal also 29th 30th preached at Br [[Joseph Fry|Frys]]

Oct 1st Continued copying my Journal through the Day Rode in the evening to Br [[Caswell Matlock|Medlocks]] 2 miles

2 Rode to Brother [[Cade A. Crawley|Crawleys]] Preached at his house distance 8 miles

16 Oct Rode to Brother [[Alfred Loy|Loys]] 1 mile 17th Preached at Mr [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clap^p^s]] & Baptised 1 one Lewis Clap^p^, then

Sunday


18 On the Lords day Rode to [[Clarks River, Calloway County, Kentucky|Clarks River]] 10 miles & Preached in the meeting house had

Monday


19th Receieved 1 subscriber for [[Latter Day Saints|M[essenger] & A[dvocate] ]] Preached in the evening at Mr [[Daniel Stillwell Thomas|Thomas]] the [[spirit of God|Spirit of God]] rested upon me

Tuesday


20 I Baptized 3 persons which were [[Campbellite|Campdellites]] then Rode 12 miles & Preached at Mr [[Joseph Greenwood|Joseph Greenw^oods^]] 
Mr [[Joseph Greenwood|Greenwood]] was aged 81 years A [[American Revolution|revolutioner]] under [[George Washington|George Washington]] his wife who was carding 
wool [[Elizabeth Greenwood|Elizabeth Greenwood]] was 93 years of Age and well remembered [[Braddock|Braddock's Army]]

Wednesday


21 Got 2 signers for M & A Rode from Father [[Joseph Greenwood|Greenwoods]] to Br [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapps]] 3 miles Preached in the 
evening at Br [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Claps]] from Lth Psalm 3:4:5: verses: When I opened A door for baptism and
8 came foreward & gave me their hand all wer [[Campbellite|Campbellite]]s save 1 which was A [[Baptist|Baptist]]
we repaired to the water whare the [[spirit of God|Spirit of God]] & the solemnities of Eternity rested upon
Us while administering the Ordinance of Baptism 3 men led their wives in^to^ the water to obey

Oct 22 Preached at Br [[John Camp|Camps]] got 1 signer for E & M Star

23 Rode in company with Br [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Benjn Clapp]] to Br [[Levi Taylor|Taylors]] distance 22 miles

24 Wrote A Letter to Br [[John Whitmer|John Whitmer]] [[Kirtland, Geauga County, Ohio|Kirtland]] 7 s[ubscriber]s for papers & 14 baptized ^Last 21 Sep [sinse whoth]
sent $500 money

25 Preached at Mr [[Joseph Chumbley|Chumleys]] on the Lords day Communed with the Saints

26 Rode to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] distance 10 miles 27th Rode to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] 10 miles held

28 Rode from [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] to Capt [[Johnathan Lowery|Lowerys]] from thence to Br [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] 40 miles ^for M & Ad^ 1 subscriber

4 Rode to Br [[Albert Petty|Pettys]] Preached at his house rode to Br [[John Jackson|Jacksons]] 8 miles

Thursday


5th Nov Wrote A Letter to Br [[Isaiah Benton|Benton]] Rode to ParisMr [[Elijah Foster|Fosters]] with Brs [[Seth Utley|Utley]] & [[Benjamin Lynn Clapp|Clapp]] 14 ^miles^

6 Rode to [[Paris, Henry County, Tennessee|Paris]] 14 miles 7th Rode to Col [[Solomon Copeland|Copelands]] distance 10 miles
